story:
Growing up I've had the comfort of receiving a new pair of pajamas every Christmas Eve from my family.  Getting to go to bed feeling so cozy has always felt like the beginnings of the “Magic of Christmas”.

Currently I am working at The Catholic Children’s Aid Society, where we find that a lot of the magic of Christmas is missing for many boys and girls.

So a few social workers came up with a beautiful idea to try to give as many children a present to open up on Christmas morning, and the wish is for it to be a new pair of pajamas.

I have already received an overwhelming amount of support for this wish so far and I have been able to purchase 58 new pairs of pajamas. Thank you so much to everyone who has been able to contribute.

I will be collecting online donations until Tuesday December 17th, in the hopes to reach my goal of donating 100 PJ's!

All donations will go directly to the purchase of pajamas, which in turn, will go to the children living in foster and group homes over this holiday season.

Each pair of PJ’s range from $8-$20, so truly any dollar amount donated will make a difference. Thank you in advance to anyone that is able to contribute!

story:
Three years ago, 30 urban dwellers came together to grow food in downtown St Louis. The Downtown Community Garden became incredibly successful uniting city residents of all ages and walks of life, truly bringing our community together. We built the garden from the ground up on an underutilized plot of land, and after 3 fruitful years, our lease is coming to an end. Since undeveloped land is nearly impossible to come by in our neighborhood, we explored all possibilities, from underutilized parking lots to city parks.

We are forging ahead at a new location - on top of a parking garage! We are excited to try out a completely different approach to urban gardening, but this transition will require different methods of growing and new planting systems. To bring the garden to life we need help purchasing water-efficient planters, healthy soil, vertical trellis, tools, storage and seeds. 

Not only are we growing food, but we have grown a community of friends and neighbors that are actively contributing to their health and the sustained health and welfare of our social fabric. By donating to this campaign you are making an impact:

1 community garden
30 urban farmers
2705 lbs of food harvested
394 lbs donated to charity
1535 volunteer hours

story:
Team Global Himalayan Electrification ( GHE ) is  driven by a mission to take on the extraordinary - people from very remote, resource-challenged areas working against odds to make their world a better place. We serve as a connecting medium for educational, health, environmental and energy initiatives between the local population of rural India and the Global audience.

This year we are set out on the Himalayan Village Electrification project. Our team’s mission is to set-up a micro-grid in Sumda Chenmo village of a remote region in the Himalayan region of India , this village will be powered exclusively by solar energy. The houses residing in these villages would therefore be equipped with basic lighting infrastructure, and charging provisions for small appliances. The introduction of even a limited source of electrical power can have immediate and significant economic, educational, and health benefits.

This would open doors to a better life at home & boost new ideas for greater productivity of the locals with efficient lighting solutions to help change their lives.

What do the locals gain from this project : People of the Himalayas face extreme odds, a dispersed population, poor communications capacity and minimal resources hence my team & I are motivated towards providing a sustainable living to these remote parts of India . Continuous supply of electircity in these villages provides more opportunities for income generation; the villagers can now work during the evening/nights, engage in traditional handicrafts and wool weaving to supplement household income.

In order to raise funds , with  the help of my team , we are organizing a  Zumbathon Fundraiser event  for a duration of  2 hrs in  New Jersey, USA . The event details are as follows :-

Venue : Boomz Fitness Center , Dover ( NJ)
Date & Time : July 11th 2014
                           6:00pm -8:00pm EST
Entry Ticket : 15$(Advance) 20$ (At door) per head

funds generated would be directed towards electrifying these
villages with the help of affordable and sustainable home lighting technologies
( LED bulbs , solar grids, power backup products) for providing high-quality, non-polluting lighting to illuminate  rural homes.

Please do not hesitate to contact me for any further queries,  email me on prianca.kamath12@gmail.com

This is our first step for  making a transition from darkness to light to the residents of Sumda Chenmo village in remote India , we are motivated to undertake many such projects in the future that will help rural homes experience electricity for the very first time in the villages.

story:
WHY?

My name is Yvonne Pierre.  I'm a proud mom of two sons, my youngest son was born with Down syndrome.   When Zyon was born, I received a lot of negative comments from professionals about what Zyon would not able to do.  But his dad and I decided to focus on simply loving Zyon and giving him the help he needs.  In 2004, when Zyon was ready three years old, he was transitioning from an early intervention called "Babies Can't Wait" into public school.  During this time, I began to join several Down syndrome Parents Yahoo Group to network with other parents to see what their experiences were.  I was blown away by how many parents were struggling to cope with having a child with Down syndrome.  

I began to research, seeking inspirational stories and I came across many amazing stories about advocates with Down syndrome.  I wanted to share the "GOOD" news by highlighting the accomplishments of individuals with Down syndrome.   In 2005, I began to advocate positive awareness through various projects such as "Have Ya Heard" (blog), "Then You Stand" (stage play) and now the "Rise Awards".    

The mission for the RISE Awards is to enlighten and inspire the audience of the achievements of individuals with Down syndrome by highlighting and celebrating the stories of the honorees.

Less than 40 years ago, it was a common practice to institutionalize individuals with Down syndrome and various disabilities restricting their human rights to an education, resources and therapies needed. Today, over 90% of abortions are due to the detection of Down syndrome. Over 50% of children put into the adoption system are children with disabilities.

Too often we hear about limitations and things that persons with Ds are incapable of, but some are musicians, actors, painters, dancers, advocates, teacher assistants, college students, entrepreneurs and graduates. But these are the stories that are not often seen or heard. RISE is a platform that will be utilized to tell these stories and further spread positive awareness.

Over the years, I've come out of pocket to fund these projects.   I need your help!  Your contribution will help offset the costs of expenses and make this a night for the audience and the advocates to remember.



WHAT & WHEN?

The 2014 RISE Awards is a red carpet event that will honor and celebrate the accomplishments of advocates with Down syndrome (Ds).  RISE (Rising in Spirit of Expectations) is an event filled with live entertainment and special presentations for the honorees and award recipients.  

We have an awesome line up of talent to perform at the 2014 Rise Awards – Viva-Brazil, Leaf, Sujeet Desai and The God Sent Project.

The 2014 RISE Awards will be held at the Porter Sanford III Performing Arts & Community Center, 3181 Rainbow Dr, Decatur, GA 30034 on Friday, November 7, 2014. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Not about to make a monetary contribution?   You can still help:

  • Spread the word the the 2014 RISE Awards!
  • Spread the word about this IndieGoGo campaign by using the share tools below.
  • Plan to attend to help celebrate these deserving advocates.  Early Bird tickets are on sale NOW at www.eventbrite.com/e/the-2014-rise-awards-tickets-11424365585
  • If you are a business own and would like to make either an in-kind donation or monetary, please contact me at yvonne@ypierre.com
  • You can be a volunteer.  Email Yvonne and let her know how you can help.
  • Follow us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/hyhriseawards 
NOTE:  For contributions larger than $100, contact me directly to receive a sponsorship packet at yvonne@ypierre.com

From the core of my heart, thank you in advance!   Let's make a difference together!   God bless you!

story:
About Us

Riley’s Toffee and Candies began wholesaling in April of 2010. If you have never tasted our candies be forewarned, they are addicting! Cindie and Earnie Riley have been making candy for holiday gifts over for 30 years. Our goodies including our original Almond Toffee soon developed a following, so we began filling small orders for friends and family. People were constantly calling asking for more Toffee. With the popularity and increasing demand for our candies we decided to open a wholesale commercial kitchen and began production. Our kitchen is located in Cambria CA.

 

 Family recipes from our childhoods have been our inspiration, we’ve taken Grandmas original Toffee recipe and modified it slightly, it’s buttery and melts in your mouth, coated with dark chocolate and toasted sliced almonds a delicious and unique taste.

 

Our Caramels were the next candies to come from Riley’s kitchen; we have created two different and distinctive tastes. Our buttery smooth caramels, we coat with just a little Sea Salt to give them a sweet-salty taste.

 

The newest candy from our kitchen is our Hunny Bees, take that same delicious butter caramel add our toasted pecans and an amazing sweet little bite results.

 

At Riley’s all of our candies are handcrafted in small batches and we use only all natural ingredients, just like grandma did! We take great pride in every batch of candy, after all our name is on every package!

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for 15,000.00 to help us to expand and grow. our goal is to hire at least three more employees and to aquire some of the equipment necessary to step up our production. We have a vision of our candy being available to everyone,yet still staying true to our philosiphy of quality handmade candies.

Please look to the right for the list of perks! We are excited to share with all of you!

 

The Impact

We feel strongly that the economy is going to be best served by small community based businesses that are successful, and with their success every business that is connected to them also thrives. Our goal of hiring additional staff will help bring much needed jobs as well as a sense of pride to us  and our community! When one of us wins we all win!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our story! tell your friends about us and our campaign

story:
The Universalist-Unitarian Church of Waterville, Maine has been Representing liberal religious values at this location since 1826.                     

 Here is some of what we do every day, every week, and throughout the year:

 

 Services Sunday morning

  • Religious Education concurrent with service for pre-school – 12
  • Adult Education/2nd Hour
  • UU Singers & Musicians

 Service

  • Evening Sandwich Program provides upward of 150 meals/day M-St
  • Pastoral Counseling
  • Monthly Newsletter ; we rally the troops!
  • Sustainability Group seeks to continually improve the green footprint of our congregation and promotes green values in the surrounding community through the promotion of green values, providing public education on weatherization, and volunteering with “Sustain Mid-Maine” sustainability coalition.  Through these efforts we affect attitudes toward public transportation/access, alternative energy/conservation, and the support of local agriculture.

 Social/Enrichment

  • Dinner Discussion Groups
  • Game Nights/Potlucks
  • Lunch Bunch
  • Spirituality Group
  • Meditation Group
  • We are LGBTQ welcoming (always have been)

 Events/Fundraisers

  • Holiday Fair
  • Annual lawn/plant sale
  • Blues & BBQ
  • Other, by inspiration in the ongoing attempt to keep our beloved base of operations intact.

There is always something that needs attention.  Much of what arises is attended to by in-house volunteers with the necessary tools and skills, with little money spent.

 Now we look ahead to a very large project like repairing the roof and making it good for the next generation of community builders and we realize we need help to get it done. After all, with our small membership it is good if we can focus on borrowing less and working on our ongoing social justice projects.

We believe that what we do here and in the wider community has value to the world at large.  Who of us can say which of our young people will go from here with these living values to lead another community far away in this country or abroad.  We are growing the kinder, more conscientious generation here, and sharing the fruits of our lives with people in need of kindness, inclusion and sustenance.  

 Every dollar you provide to help us literally "keep a roof over our heads," promotes and sustains this work and leaves us able to focus on those other things closer to ground level that our volunteers can take care of to ensure the integrity, safety, and accessibility of our old building.   With your help, the members of our wider community that depend on us for their daily bread will be assured that we remain here with them.  This will be a great comfort in their lives; knowing that every member of their family gets a solid meal at least once a day.  How better can anyone spend the price of a six-pack, or a couple of latte’s.  People get happy, proud of themselves, and "sustainability" people get sustained.  See?  Good brain chemicals flow all around.

Every contributor of $15 or more will receive a pack of 10 note cards with envelopes depicting a scene from within or around our church.  Of course your donations to our survival are 100% tax deductible. 

If you are not one who can offer cash, please consider sharing this appeal with your friends and family, or, if you live near us, come by and volunteer in the kitchen any weekday afternoon and help the Evening Sandwich Program, or attend one of our small group meetings to share ideas on how to spread the message of sustainability and humility and helpfulness.  Come join us on a Sunday morning for fellowship and feel welcome.  You might just find a committee to join that will change your life, and hopefully that of someone else, for the betterment of the human condition.

story:
Pride vs. Prejudice: Sullivan Solidarity Ball is an event being held on Saturday, April 20th, 2013 in Terre Haute, Indiana. Sullivan, Indiana recently made national headlines when a small group of parents, students and teachers from the area formed to plan a “traditional” prom upon hearing news that Sullivan High School would allow same-sex couples to participate in the school’s Grand March and Prom activities. 

Pride vs. Prejudice: Sullivan Solidarity Ball is a response to the outpouring of love and support to the LGBTQ community from the community of Sullivan and around the world. This event will be open to all who wish to attend and show support and solidarity to the students and community of Sullivan who firmly believe that love has value and meaning regardless of sexual orientation.

PLEASE NOTE that we are in no way affiliated with Sullivan High School and we are VERY excited for all SHS students to be able to attend their prom with whomever they choose! This event is merely meant as a compliment to the local prom and as a larger celebration of equality and love for the entire community! Please know that we are NOT creating a separate prom! That is not our intention! This event is truly meant as a means for adults and kids from all walks of life to come together and celebrate equality and love! We 100% support the efforts of the SHS prom and wish all the kids who attend a magical night!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Tickets for the event are FREE to the public and will be available via online registration on a first come first serve basis. However, your generous donations will help us pay for all of the following:

 

  • Location
  • Legal Assistance (including all permits and liability insurance) 
  • Volunteer Coordination
  • Parking Facilitation 
  • Local Terre Haute Bar Sponsorship for After Party
  • DJ/ Music
  • Security
  • Catering
  • and any other fees which might occur.

 

IN RETURN YOU GET A FREE NIGHT YOU WILL NEVER FORGET! 

Also! We will be raising funds (with a goal of $9,000) for the actual event through Indigogo. After the funds are raised we will be using any extra money as start up to create more Solidarity Balls all over the country. We want to use the Sullivan ball as the beginning of a wave of events that will promote conversation and community anywhere we might be needed. 

 

The Impact

There is nothing brave about having love in your heart for others. There is, however, something cowardly about wanting to deny people the same freedom that you enjoy and believing that the way you live is the only acceptable lifestyle that exists. By helping us, you are being fearless by using your voice and your wallet to promote equality, justice, and love while enabling us to cultivate conversation, provide clarity, and solidify a supportive and educated community. There is no greater impact you can make on this world! 

Other Ways You Can Help!

This is a bold fundraiser for a worthy cause. But if you cannot contribute at this time, you can help by spreading the word. Word of mouth is really important if we're going to be successful! Please tell your family, friends, co-workers, colleagues, and associates about the Solidarity Ball and our goal to raise $9,000 in 45 days. That would be a HUGE help!

Thank you for taking the time to WATCH THE VIDEO and for reading our statement. My team and I will be happy to answer any questions you may have. Please contact us on Facebook and Twitter, or via email at pvpsolidarityball@gmail.com.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Also! We will be raising funds (with a goal of $9,000) for the actual event through Indigogo. After the funds are raised we will be using any extra money as start up to create more Solidarity Balls all over the country. We want to use the Sullivan ball as the beginning of a wave of events that will promote conversation and community anywhere we might be needed. 
 
The Impact
There is nothing brave about having love in your heart for others. There is, however, something cowardly about wanting to deny people the same freedom that you enjoy and believing that the way you live is the only acceptable lifestyle that exists. By helping us, you are being fearless by using your voice and your wallet to promote equality, justice, and love while enabling us to cultivate conversation, provide clarity, and solidify a supportive and educated community. There is no greater impact you can make on this world! 
Other Ways You Can Help!
This is a bold fundraiser for a worthy cause. But if you cannot contribute at this time, you can help by spreading the word. Word of mouth is really important if we're going to be successful! Please tell your family, friends, co-workers, colleagues, and associates about the Solidarity Ball and our goal to raise $9,000 in 45 days. That would be a HUGE help!
Thank you for taking the time to WATCH THE VIDEO and for reading our statement. My team and I will be happy to answer any questions you may have. Please contact us on Facebook and Twitter, or via email at pvpsolidarityball@gmail.com.
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Be a Part of Sports History, Contribute Today

Why This Non-Profit Campaign is So Important

Today it’s hard to find positive role models for our children to emulate.  Sometimes we need to look to the past to find our heroes for today.  But how can we keep the memories and achievements of sports history’s greatest athletes as fresh today as they were back then?

Once in a while a project comes along that has the cache and charisma to transcend race, gender, age and nationality.  The SPORTS IMMORTALS MOBILE MUSEUM EXPERIENCE is such a project.   Its not only the manifestation of the lifelong effort of one man's love and dedication to sports history, but also a true and inspirational story of never losing sight of your dreams. 

My name is Jim Platt and this campaign is about helping make my father's lifelong dream come true. With your help and support...together we can make it happen!  

All donations will go directly to our 501(c) non-profit organization, The Platt Sports Foundation.  This IndieGoGo account is linked directly to our Foundation's Bank Account at Chase Bank.*

How it all Began...

Joel Platt’s lifelong quest to assemble the largest and most valuable collection of sports memorabilia has been filled with both triumph and tragedy.  It all started in 1943, when a mischievous four-year-old boy threw a match into the gas tank of a car resulting in a towering inferno.  Bedridden for over a year with severe burns after the explosion, Joel’s parents bought him baseball cards to entertain him during his long days of recovery.  His first one was of Babe Ruth. 

This 1933 Goudey card was what ultimately determined the path that Joel would take for the rest of his life.  He decided at a young age that his goal would be to preserve the achievements of great athletes so that their memories would live forever in the hearts and minds of generations to come and serve as inspiration to us all to try our best in all aspects of life.

To that end, as he grew older, his collection grew to include programs, tickets, autographs and actual mementos used by the athletes.  Upon becoming a teenager, Joel embarked on a sixty-year adventure, traveling over one million miles to curate over one million mementos for the Sports Immortals Collection. 

Along the way he had the unique opportunity to meet several of the most famous athletes and their relatives including Mrs. Honus Wagner, Mrs. Babe Ruth, Mrs. Jim Thorpe, Muhammad Ali, Gordie Howe, Jack Dempsey, Wilt Chamberlain, just to name a few. 

He related to them his goal of honoring the accomplishments of the greatest sports icons.  More often than not, Joel came home with a special object to represent the athlete in the Sports Immortals Collection.

Now at the age of 74, Joel Platt is the Founder of Sports Immortals, Inc.  As he reflects on his life, he realizes that the most precious treasures he obtained on his journey were not the artifacts themselves, but the inspirational lessons and gifts of knowledge he learned along the way.  The time has come to share his collection and all the anecdotal stories with sports fans young and old so that they may benefit from the culmination of his life’s work. 

What’s the Big Idea? It’s All About the Experience

The Sports Immortals team has designed several “must see” projects that will combine some of the most priceless sports artifacts with the most compelling multimedia technology.  The SPORTS IMMORTALS MOBILE MUSEUM is the first of the planned projects to be launched. It will be the most innovative experience of its kind and tour the United States stopping at major sporting events, universities, local schools, shopping malls, state fairs, etc.  Imagine hundreds of thousands of children having the opportunity to see Jackie Robinson’s game worn hat and learning how courageous he was by breaking Major League Baseball’s color barrier in 1948.  What if they could learn about the determination and focus of Jesse Owens competing in the 1936 Berlin Olympics with Hitler in the stands, ultimately winning four gold medals?  How about Little Leaguers motivated by the dedication of Lou Gehrig and Cal Ripken Jr. to never want to miss a practice or a game?   These are just a few examples of the valuable benefits that will accrue to the public once this exciting project begins.

Sounds Great, but What Will it Look Like?

 

This mobile shrine to sports will trace sports history beginning in the 19th century area and ending in the “Immortals Among Us” Section.  Each twenty-year period shall feature the Immortals of that era describing in rich detail not only their career achievements, but also their work ethic, any obstacles they overcame and other anecdotal stories they may have shared with Joel Platt.  Guests will be entertained and educated by actual artifacts used by the athletes, video footage and historical information describing the political climate in which they competed, such as Joe Louis uniting our nation by defeating the German boxer, Max Schmeling, during World War II.

Upon entering the exhibit, visitors will find a large video wall displaying great moments in sports.

The photos above and below show examples of how rooms will be organized inside the Experience.  Please notice that sports fans will be given information through the same source that people received in that time period.  The above features the old time radio.  This same theme occurs throughout, i.e. the “Immortals Among Us” features WiFi, Television, Ipad, Phones, etc.

Upon completion of the tour, visitors will enter the final area which provides them the opportunity to purchase Sports Immortals Branded Merchandise, to take a photograph holding a unique sports artifact like a Babe Ruth bat and lastly, to vote for whom they believe should be the original 50 athletes to be inducted into the Sports Immortals Hall of Fame, and lastly to learn the benefits of living a healthy lifestyle and the dangers of obesity in this country.  

When Will the Tour Begin?

According to MRA, once we reach our funding goal, it should take about 100-120 days for them to have the Sports Immortals Mobile Museum Experience ready to roll.  

Can the Mobile Museum Come to my Home Town?

Yes!  It is possible.  As one of the incentives to increase donations, the city that contributes the most funding will receive an exciting celebration for all the contributors and their friends.  The Sports Immortals Tour will make a special stop for these wonderful and passionate supporters.  The routing of the tour has not been determined.  Once we reach our goal and start planning the locations, the winning city will be contacted and we will schedule the big event.

Why Support Sports Immortals?

In today’s economy, it is very difficult to obtain funding for new projects.  Sponsors are very selective on which concepts they support and are most likely to provide additional funding to projects that are already operational.  One of our goals is to keep the exhibition free of charge so that everyone can see it regardless of socioeconomic constraints.  Your contribution to the development of the Sports Immortals Mobile Museum Experience will not only help us preserve the memories and achievement of the world’s greatest athletes, but it will also help Sports Immortals attract the sponsorship dollars necessary for the tour to last many years and educate and inspire millions of sports fans across the country.   

Joel Platt has dedicated his life to fulfilling his dream.  He is not a collector, but a curator on a mission to preserve sports history.  He has done his part to assemble the collection, but we need your help so that he can start sharing it with the public.  To use a football analogy, Joel has carried the football 99 yards down the field.  With your financial support, together we can take it into the endzone and everyone will win! 

How Much Do You Need?  How Will the Funds Be Used?

We are seeking $350,000 that will be used for the following:

  • Design and installation of the exhibition inside the expandable 18 wheeler trailer
  • Operation of the Exhibition (Lease of Truck, Gas, Staff, Security, Insurance, Site Fees, etc.)
  • Marketing (Television, Print, Radio, Internet, Social Media, Grassroots, Sponsorship Efforts, etc.)
  • Events

How Can I Help and be Part of Sports History?

1.  We would be so grateful if you could make a financial contribution to our project.  No matter how large or small, we appreciate your support.  Remember the higher the donation, the greater the Perk.  Please take action and donate NOW!!   Please note: THE CITY THAT DONATES THE MOST MONEY TO THE CAMPAIGN WILL WIN THE GIFT OF THE EXHIBITION COMING TO THAT CITY FOR A SPEICAL EVENT FOR ALL DONORS.

But you can still help us in other ways than donating money…

2.  Please use the "Social Media" buttons above to post our IndieGoGo page to your Facebook page (use LIKE button) and/or Twitter account, please send an email to all your contacts that may be interested in Sports Immortals and ask them to visit http://www.indiegogo.com/sportsimmortals (you can embed the link by using the button above).  Anything you can do to spread the word about our campaign would be helpful.

3.  Stay connected with Sports Immortals by checking our Indiegogo Campaign Site (http://www.indiegogo.com/sportsimmortals), our website (http://www.sportsimmortals.com), our Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/SportsImmortals) and our Twitter (@SIHALLOFFAME)

4.  If you or any of your contacts are in P.R. or have blogs, please help us get this campaign mentioned as much as possible!  You can embed the site by using the Social Media Buttons above.

Additional Information on Sports Immortals

Please review the additional Videos and Files that are part of this campaign by clicking on the "Gallery" tab at the top of this page:  (1) Television Program on Sports Immortals  that aired on the Velocity Channel by Discovery in May 2012, (2) Legends and Legacies Video, (3) Complete Design Booklet for Sports Immortals Experiential Mobile Museum, (4) Moves Magazine Article and several other great images from the Sports Immortals Collection.

Sports Immortals, Inc. is headquartered in Boca Raton, Florida where roughly 2% of the collection is on display in the 5000 square foot Showcase Museum.  If you are ever in the area, please visit at 6830 N. Federal Highway, Boca Raton, Florida 33487.

You can also find information online at www.sportsimmortals.com

If you have any questions please contact us at 561-997-2575 or legends@sportsimmortals.com

Sports Immortals Team

Joel Platt, President and Founder, Sports Immortals®, Inc.

Acknowledged by ESPNEWS as the “Foremost Curator of Sports Memorabilia in the World”, Mr. Platt has amassed the largest and most valuable collection of sports artifacts in the world. The Smithsonian Institute has recognized Platt’s assemblage as “Absolutely the most outstanding collection on all sports.”

Joel Platt has been featured on such television shows as “Million Dollar Collections” (Velocity Channel) ESPNEWS, The Best Damn Sports Show Period on FOX, Cold Pizza (ESPN 2), Real People, PM Evening Magazine, Chicago Tonight and numerous others. In addition, he has been writ- ten up in Sports Illustrated, Sport Magazine, Street and Smith’s Sports Business Journal, Sports Collector’s Digest and ESPN The Magazine which named Joel Platt “number 2” on their list of the 63 greatest things in sports you may not know about.

Mr. Platt is a graduate of Duquesne University and was recently inducted in the Western Pennsylvania Jewish Sports Hall of Fame.

Jim Platt, Vice President, Sports Immortals®, Inc.

Mr. Platt has extensive experience in the areas of strategic marketing, strategic management, advertising, promotions, Internet development and museum operations. He is current- ly spearheading the Sports Immortals® Experiential Mobile Museum Tour and working on his second literary work in conjunction with best selling author, Lou Aronica. In addition, Jim Platt recently launched the Sports Immortals Educational Program where he provides motivational words of wisdom to children and adolescents by teaching them about values and lessons in life using athletes and Joel Platt as examples.

While working at Motorola, he was instrumental in the intro- ductions of two products, including the ESPNet TO GO sports pager. He also served a variety of clients while working for the Latin American division of Burson-Marsteller, such a Sky Entertainment and Gatorade. Both an avid sports enthusiast and writer, Jim Platt’s first book, Sports Immortals, Stories of Inspiration and Achievement, has already been purchased by over 100,000 sports fans.

Mr. Platt received his BA in Psychology from the University of Pennsylvania and his MBA from the University of Miami.

David Christensen, Co-Founder of Clearpath Entertainment

David specializes in developing and marketing entertainment based projects, both domestic and international, with a specific focus on high-profile and historic touring exhibitions. His specialties include partnership and brand development, strategic planning and public relations.

Sean Brescia, Co-Founder of Clearpath Entertainment

Sean has a diverse background creating and marketing experiential and entertainment based events and tours. His work includes high-profile touring exhibitions, concerts, festivals, sporting and political events, in addition to a range of entertainment and communications projects across all media.

Visit Clearpath website at http://clearpathentertainment.com

MRA Experiential Tours and Equipment

The leader in mobile experiential marketing, specializing in the custom design, build, vehicle sales and leasing, tour equipment and logistics management services for the experiential marketing and exhibiting needs of many well known cultural institutions and For- tune 1000 companies. Mobile tours have been MRA’s core business since 1989.

The company delivers turnkey services for institutions, muse- ums, foundations and corporations directly or in association with leading agencies and exhibit builders worldwide from their headquarters in Madison Heights, Michigan.

MRA differentiates themselves with their specialized turnkey development and management services. Their experienced staff Driver Teams, Docent/Attendants, full-time DOT Compliance Specialist, and a comprehensive nationwide service and maintenance program keeps their clients’ tours on the road. Clients stay connected to the tour’s progress with a customized 24/7 client MicroSite portal for event reporting.

MRA clients include: Smithsonian, Library of Congress, Ford, Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library & Museum, Tavis Smiley’s America I AM Tour, American Legacy, NIKE, Motorola, Boeing, Mazda, Hard Rock Café, Mattel, Macy’s and many more.

Visit MRA website at: www.gomra.com

 

 

Here's What Others Had to Say About Sports Immortals...

 

 

Mr. Ernie Banks

Chicago Cubs, Baseball Hall of Fame

“The Sports Immortals Museum collection features over one million mementos and honors the greatest athletes in sports history.”

 

Mr. Franco Harris

Pittsburgh Steelers, Football Hall of Fame

“I have been impressed with Joel Platt’s dedication and determination ever since our first encounter during my rookie season.  As Chairman of the Sports Immortals Honorary Board, I am proud to be involved with a project that will be entertaining, educational and an inspiration to mankind.”

 

Mr. Carl H. Scheele

Retired Director,Smithsonian Institution

“Absolutely the most outstanding collection on all sports.”

 

Mr. Joshua Evans

Chairman, Leland’s Collectibles, Inc.

“The finest sports collection in the world...bar none.”

 

Rabbi Harold Kushner

Best Selling Author of When Bad Things Happen to Good People

“We celebrate athletes who overcame obstacles to reach their goals.  Joel Platt, by force of his indomitable will, brought his body back from a serious injury as a youngster to curate the world’s greatest collection of sports memorabilia.”

 

Mr. Casey Stengel

Baseball Immortal, Baseball Hall of Fame

“Your Sports Immortals Museum sounds very interesting and should prove very rewarding.  Many adults along with thousands of children will derive hours of pleasure.  It is a wonderful thing and I wish you every success.”

 

Captain James Lovell, USN

NASA Astronaut, Commander of Apollo 13

“I extend best wishes for the continued growth and success of the Sports Immortals Museum.  Many people find inspiration in the lives of our athletic heroes, and it is appropriate that the records and mementos of their achievements should be preserved.”

 

Photos of Perks 

Level 3  

Level 4   

Level 5 

Level 6                    

 

 

This Indiegogo campaign is linked directly to the bank account of The Platt Sports Foundation. It is a 501(c)3 not-for-profit organization registered with the State of Florida.

story:
Support the Work of Under the Hood Cafe

In the shadow of the largest military base in the United States, nestled between train tracks and chop shops, there is an outpost of rights and resistance called Under the Hood Cafe. This is where Army Specialist Ryan Holleran went to get his humanity back. 

It happened bit by bit, as transformation does. He showed up one night for the café’s famous poetry slam, and there was something hopeful about the place that made him come back for more. Ryan was just back from Iraq, struggling with his participation in the military, and coming to embrace his queer identity. He walked into the cafe that night, saw artwork other service members had created as a collective response to military life, and knew this was a different kind of community. 

He came back nearly every day for a year.

“I would get home from work and I’d go to the café, and I would be surrounded by people who were compassionate and loving,” said Ryan, who soon became involved in anti-war organizing. “They really started to integrate the concept of humanity.”

Since its founding outside the Fort Hood military base in Killeen, TX, four years ago, Under the Hood has helped empower hundreds of military service members and their families to fight for their own rights, as well as connect to a larger peace and justice community. It is grassroots anti-war work at its best.

The vital work of Under The Hood cannot continue without supporters like you. We have an urgent need to raise $12,000 in the next few weeks. Please help us meet our goal.

In the days to come, you will find updates here about the core elements of Under The Hood's work, from community organizing and leadership development to arts workshops to the much-beloved "Ribs and Rights." But to understand the critical importance of this cafe, there’s no better place to start than with Ryan.

“I’ve learned things this past year that it would take some people $50,000 and a college education to learn,” said Ryan, who plans to work with Iraq Veterans Against the War when he leaves the military this month. “I feel like I’ve had a crash course in community organizing and social justice.” 

When Ryan was ready to address the effects of combat-related trauma, including the depression and substance abuse that followed his time in Iraq, it was the community at Under the Hood that helped him through. They made his first counseling appointments for him. They drove him off post and sat with him for hours while he waited for help. He was able to talk with other service members about his problems with the military as a part of the Under the Hood community.

“They’ve watched me through this transition of being incredibly fucked up and not knowing what to do to having some skills and being able to adapt and adjust to life,” said Ryan.

Right now, an average of 22 service members commit suicide every day. At least one-fourth of people without homes are veterans. Sexual assault inside the military is rampant; an estimated 1 in 3 women service members experience it. At Fort Hood, the Sergeant in charge of “sexual assault prevention” is himself being investigated for sexual assault.

Under the Hood is not only a focal point for anti-war and social justice work; it is also a lifeline for service members in critical need of community and support.

As Ryan said of the café: “It was all I had.”

Please keep this community alive and thriving by making a donation today.

 

The Perks


 

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you a service member, veteran or community member who has any experience with Under the Hood? Submit a video sharing your experience with UTH so we can use it for our Indiegogo Updates.

Contact us to learn how you can get involved. 

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Stay engaged and follow us on Facebook.

story:
My Product:

In the days of Top Chef and Hell’s Kitchen more and more home cooks are delving into the culinary arts. Without proper training, cooking and prepping food can be a dangerous undertaking. When looking at the kitchen gadgets being sold today, most are geared towards efficiency and unique cooking needs. This leaves an opportunity in the market to fill a gap with an item that focuses on safety. The S.V.P. is that item. Safe Veggie Prep is an innovative kitchen tool that will serve all markets including the professional industry. The S.V.P. is a second skin that will protect the most vulnerable fingers during the peeling, chopping, cutting and preparation process. No other product on the market can fulfill these claims.

Our mission is to assist and aid those who are not as confident as professional chef’s when it comes to the preparation of vegetables, fruit and other foods in the kitchen. Our product, Safe Veggie Prep or S.V.P., will ensure safety in the kitchen while chopping, cutting, peeling, dicing or slicing vegetables, fruit and other foods.  This unique tool is safe to be used by adults and older children with adult supervision.

There is nothing like this currently on the market. You cannot compare this to the bulky mesh cutting gloves being sold today. The S.V.P. covers only the fingers most vulnerable, features gripper fingertips, is dishwasher safe and extremely comfortable.  

In order to move forward with this amazing kitchen tool, funding is needed to make all of the necessary product molds, prototypes, and third run samples for testing as well as to assist with advertising, marketing, and the packaging of the product. 

                                       

                                         *** [Patent Pending] ***

 

Upcoming Challenges for final glove: 

 I have been diligently working for the past year to perfect the design and thoroughly develop all aspects of the S.V.P. Through trial and error we have chosen the best suitable material that is thin enough to allow flexibility while maintaining the strength to stand up to our rigorous safety testing. I know there will be challenges to come that we must surpass in order to succeed and I am confident we can do so.

ADDITIONAL PROTOTYPE:  1 Additional prototype will be needed in the other 2 sizes being offered of the S.V.P. A portion of the funding will allow these key prototypes to be produced. All size variations are currently protected by my current patents.

WAREHOUSING: Our initial orders will ship directly off the product line but the need for an off site warehouse will be necessary once the S.V.P. becomes successful. We will need to find a warehouse in a good location that will provide adequate space.

story:
Short Summary

ASAP Haiti needs your help to raise funds to buy solar panels that were stolen from a small village in Lambert, Haiti. These solar panels helped to provide clean water for the people who live there. Can you help us to get solar panels to provide life giving water for Lambert, Haiti?

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3000 to replace the stolen solar panels to provide clean water for the people of Lambert, Haiti. We will also need $2000 to build a security building for the police who will provide security for the new solar panels once they are installed.

 

The Impact

Providing clean fresh water for Lambert, Haiti. Currently the people of Lambert have to walk miles with buckets on their heads to provide water for their families. Unclean water has caused many diseases and hardships for the children of Lambert.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people may not be able to provide financial support so we ask that you help us get the word out about this campaign. Don't forget to share this information using Indiegogo' sharing tools!

story:
Please also see https://www.facebook.com/IDoNationMM/

I Do Nation Phase I - Results Achieved so Far

On April 17 Doh Eain - in collaboration with MultiVerse Advertising, Moonji Production and Wave Money, launched “I Do Nation”. 

I Do Nation was launched as a platform to assist vulnerable people in Yangon in response to COVID-19 and beyond, starting with street vendors. I Do Nation rallies support, contributions in kind, and funding in order to: 

  • distribute personal protective equipment, particularly masks and hand sanitisers
  • place shared protect equipment, particularly hand washing and sanitiser stations, in areas busy with vendors
  • make weekly direct cash transfers of 10,000 MMK (40,000 MMK per month i.e. 1/3rd of minimum wage) 

 

Between April and June 2020, I Do Nation: 

  • enumerated 5,536 vendors and verified 3,762 vendors across Yangon 
  • disbursed over US$37,000 directly to vendors 
  • distributed 7,700 litres of hand sanitiser and 20,000 facemasks 
  • installed 20 durable handwashing stations in high traffic locations 
  • 52% of vendors used this support for household essentials including servicing debt, 33% to pay needed business operations costs.

 

We know this work made a difference because I Do Nation (through Doh Eain's Research and Analytics team) made the largest enumeration and survey of street vendors ever conducted in Yangon. Half of the surveyed vendors told us that I Do Nation was the only support they received in the last semi-lock down.

I Do Nation Phase II - We Need Your Help Again!

Mid September the Government of Myanmar announced a new lockdown, and street vendors are once again suffering severely. 

Based on the work done during I Do Nation phase 1,  we have all the infrastructure in place to directly reach and support 8,000 verified vendors with direct cash support, PPE and vital information.

But we are out of cash and materials and once again need your help! 

Like our Facebook Page for regular updates on disbursements and information! https://www.facebook.com/IDoNationMM/ 

We are:

Doh Eain, a participatory urban design practice based in Yangon dedicated to making better cities (see www.doheain.com);

MultiVerse Agency, a full-service independent agency specializing in creative solutions to complex challenges (see https://multiverseadvertising.com) and Moonji Production, an award-winning production company (see https://moonjiproduction.com/);

WaveMoney, a joint venture between Telenor and Yoma Bank to provide accessible, safe and convenient mobile financial services via a nationwide agent network or via a wave account on your phone (see https://www.wavemoney.com.mm/).

story:
Project Summary

I have been making dolls for a dozen years and have enjoyed the happiness it provides children. I love it when I turn up at someone's house and their doll is loved to the point where its been loved to death like the Velveteen Rabbit! Years of hugging and kissing can do that to a doll.

Some children don't have dolls but need them more than the average child. Children who are abused and traumatized are comforted by a doll. They feel secure and settled. We all have "off" days and hugging a baby doll, especially one that is organic cloth, warm with soft wool, and scented with amazing essential oils, is more than comforting and relaxing. It's like spending a day at the spa!

When contributors support my project, they will be helping me introduce a new type of doll that, when it reaches the hands of abused and traumatized children, can have a lasting impact and help them on their way to healing.

I'm not alone in thinking that these dolls can be and are beneficial to children:

"Dolls have been a part of play therapy for a long time because the idea in play therapy is that the doll will represent part of the child's self which can then be externalized and difficult feelings or experiences can then be played out."
      ~ Karen Fraley, Licensed Clinical Social Worker, Faculty Member, Intl. Psychotherapy Institute, Board Certified Diplomat in Advanced Clinical Work.
 
"These dolls settle her. They make her feel secure. She doesn't go anywhere without them." ~Nikki Weiser, parent to Alize

What We Need & What You Get

I need $5,000 to fully develop a template and then prototype for this doll. I have identified a design student that I would like to have help me in this venture. Together, we would perfect a doll that I have created, "freestyle," and make an accurate pattern and directions so that other dollmakers can replicate the doll and so that it is perfect for larger production. The funds are needed to purchase all of the supplies to make 25 prototypes, the equipment/tools needed for creating the patterns, reproduction of the instructions and a stipend for the design student.

My mission is to help make a difference in the lives of children - those abused and traumatized. Underlying this is my intense passion to bring the Waldorf philosophy of the essential need for play to the greater public. Creating age-appropriate therapy dolls for children allows them to unleash their imagination, and for those who have been damaged, find wholesome ways to bring about healing.
 
For contributors, I have a host of fun and exciting perks that will show you just how much I appreciate your generosity and commitment in what I am trying to achieve. The top investors will get to name one version of the doll and help me decide on its various features! What a great way to recognize someone that you honor and love.

The Impact

We've all heard gastly stories in the newspaper, on the news, and even from friends about the horrific abuse that occurs in our world, damaging children and changing their life forever. Years and years of therapy is often required to bring about healing.

I have a vision to create something unique - a heavy baby with limbs that is more suitable for an older child - five through ten - scented with special organic essential oils that have healing properties for emotionally bruised and abused people. According to the manufacturer, this is how they describe this special oil: "SARA™ is an empowering blend of therapeutic-grade essential oils designed to help soothe deep emotional wounds. It may help individuals release and begin recovery from the traumatic memory of sexual and other forms of physical or emotional abuse." Specifically, this oil is a combination of the following essential oils: Ylang ylang, geranium, lavender, orange, blue tansy, cedarwood, rose and white lotus in a base of almond oil.
 
These top-grade oils are generously added to organic millet that has been gently warmed and fill the bottom of the doll, allowing her to sit. The doll's body is made with warm, organic 100 percent cotton. The size is such that it will fit into preemie baby clothing.
 
Doll therapy is very popular today but therapists don't have many choices when it comes to selecting all natural materials in their dolls. Therapy Babies will feel life like to help foster nurturing qualities in children. The warmth of the wool is healing and the weight is comforting. The simplicity of the features allow the imaginative life of the child to take flight. Every detail of this soft baby is made to inspire healing, creativity, and imagination. Some parents report that heavy babies are especially helpful when a child is transitioning to their own bedroom/bed or when a new sibling arrives. Some parents share that children with sensory processing disorders can be helped with weighted dolls to keep them still and calm.
 
Once the pattern is designed, I will create five different versions of the therapy doll representing a variety of ethnic groups and there will be a boy and a girl version. I will perfect and fine tune the doll until I am satisfied that I have achieved my goal of creating a beautiful doll that is made of the very best materials that will provide years and years of joy and therapeutic nurturing to all children who come in contact with it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

1. Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

2. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

3. Let social worker and therapist friends know that these dolls will be available by spring 2013!

story:
My twin boys have known this family for many years. They are good friends with all three of the boys.  

The family has not only been dealt with the blow of losing their mother last week to liver failure - she was 47 years old. Their father has suffered for many years with Lou Gehrigs disease. He is now in his final stage of life and was put in hospice a few days ago. These three boys will be left with no parents.

I have come to know the middle son "Anthony" very well the last couple months. He comes over to the house often and is such a well spoken boy and so genuine and sweet.   I have had a few long chats with  "Anthony". Through these chats I have learned what a very special boy he is. I am asking all of you to please consider helping me to collect money for this family.  

Recently, I had the opportunity to speak to Anthony and Troy and expressed my condolences to them and they expressed to me how the last couple of weeks have been. They have told me that they are going to stay in the rental house for the time being because their father's hospice is only minutes away. The younger son Troy has been home for two years looking after the father and he told me that he is going to be looking for a full time job now. Troy is my twin boys age (21). I expressed to them how sad I am for them and how its so tragic that they have this to go through and have had no option but to grow up very quickly in the last while.

Immediately when they left my home today I thought I have to do something for these boys.   I am just in the early stages of figuring out my other options for gathering donations. I am also considering how this money collected will be used for them - thinking purchasing grocery gift cards - gas cards - possibly contacting their landlord and paying a few months of their rent in advance. Many ideas to ponder - all money collected will be going to these boys basic needs in life. Christmas is just around the corner and what better reason to give to this family. All those that contribute I will include your name in the card to show these boys just how many people helped in their time of need. I AM HOPING THIS GOES VIRAL!!

Please share this link with your friends and family. The more attention to this cause the more success it will have!  Any amount of money even a few dollars will help - it will eventually add up to be a significant amount to make a difference and help these boys in their time of need. Please feel free to spread this story to others so they may consider donating also. Possibly some of you will be able to have your employer jump on board and become a donor to this family!!

 

Regards,  

 

Sandra
story_txt:
My twin boys have known this family for many years. They are good friends with all three of the boys.  
The family has not only been dealt with the blow of losing their mother last week to liver failure - she was 47 years old. Their father has suffered for many years with Lou Gehrigs disease. He is now in his final stage of life and was put in hospice a few days ago. These three boys will be left with no parents.
I have come to know the middle son "Anthony" very well the last couple months. He comes over to the house often and is such a well spoken boy and so genuine and sweet.   I have had a few long chats with  "Anthony". Through these chats I have learned what a very special boy he is. I am asking all of you to please consider helping me to collect money for this family.  
Recently, I had the opportunity to speak to Anthony and Troy and expressed my condolences to them and they expressed to me how the last couple of weeks have been. They have told me that they are going to stay in the rental house for the time being because their father's hospice is only minutes away. The younger son Troy has been home for two years looking after the father and he told me that he is going to be looking for a full time job now. Troy is my twin boys age (21). I expressed to them how sad I am for them and how its so tragic that they have this to go through and have had no option but to grow up very quickly in the last while.
Immediately when they left my home today I thought I have to do something for these boys.   I am just in the early stages of figuring out my other options for gathering donations. I am also considering how this money collected will be used for them - thinking purchasing grocery gift cards - gas cards - possibly contacting their landlord and paying a few months of their rent in advance. Many ideas to ponder - all money collected will be going to these boys basic needs in life. Christmas is just around the corner and what better reason to give to this family. All those that contribute I will include your name in the card to show these boys just how many people helped in their time of need. I AM HOPING THIS GOES VIRAL!!
Please share this link with your friends and family. The more attention to this cause the more success it will have!  Any amount of money even a few dollars will help - it will eventually add up to be a significant amount to make a difference and help these boys in their time of need. Please feel free to spread this story to others so they may consider donating also. Possibly some of you will be able to have your employer jump on board and become a donor to this family!!
 
Regards,  
 
Sandra

story:
What Would You Do?

When we started Raw Eats we were asked how we could help a customer and her father, her father had been diagnosed with cancer and had been prescribed a Raw Food Plant Based diet as way to over come it. Due to her having to work and not having the available resources to do this for him she was in desperate need of help. We were taken aback the first time this happened, we realise we have invested our time and lives in to something truly amazing that can help many people not just reactively but those proactive about their future health and well-being. 

Jodie Gilbertson who is our Certified Raw Food Chef and her partner Anthony Stevenson are now taking the time to make a difference, first in their own community and then embarking on sprouting the Raw food health and goodness through Australia.

We see people with busy lives struggling to maintain a healthy, work/life balance we see the articles on healthy living but no one is serving these unadulterated foods needed, until now! 

We know the people who take the time to read this are smart enough to realise what we are embarking on here. We are a small business starting up and want to grow, and grow with good health just like our customers, it is simple, we are offering the best foods, amazing tastes, low prices and the best of intentions with our business and foods. We do need a little help to make it real. 

We are now moments away from releasing Australia's 1st Raw Food Meal Plan. Raw Eats caterers for people who are concious about their health and well-being and those who have not had the opportunity to eat the right foods and ended up with an illness and are now reactively embracing the Raw food benefits. There is no missing out we include people's favourite foods and turn into Raw goodness such as Pizza, Lasagne, Pad Thai, Curries, Taco's, and snacks. The foods on the menu have been tried, tested and loved! This is one of the tastiest ways to get and be happier and healthier. 


Why is Raw food and the philosophy behind it so good for us?

  • Only Organic and chemical free foods are used.
  • No Gluten
  • No Dairy
  • No Additives
  • No Processed foods
  • The only sugar is from the produce itself!
  • No Meat 
  • No Animal Products
  • No Cooking

When doctors advise patients to cut things from their diet when there are health concerns, all the above exclusions are what are advised to be cut. 

What are the benefits of all this?

We know you know that you are only as healthy as the food you put in to your body.

The Health Benefits:

  • Less risk of diabetes
  • Helps reverse diabetes
  • Lowers risk of heart disease
  • Increased energy
  • No more tired feelings after eating the heavy foods.
  • Weight management
  • Healthier Ph levels
  • Healthier liver and kidneys
  • Better functioning metabolism 
  • Vitality
  • Stonger immune system
  • Clear minded

There are many many more benefits and we love talking about them, we could keep going with pages upon pages and books upon books on the benefits that can be gained from improved eating habits.

* Please note we offer our meal plan on a 4 day a week basis, this makes for a good transition for people to change their eating habits. We do not tell people to go 100% Raw, we can cater for people who do want to. We believe 4 days per week is enough to start seeing differences and encourages people to further their healthy life style choices. 

Time Benefits:

  • Less shopping (less impulse purchases)
  • Less parking, traffick 
  • No washing up or cleaning up
  • No preparing foods
  • No packing lunch
  • No wasted food
  • Amazing fresh foods without having to find them yourself! 
  • We educate on the ingredients being served. 
  • More time for yourself
  • More time for exercise
  • More time for family
  • More time for friends
  • More time at breakfast, lunch and dinner no worrying about what to have!

The Money Benefits:

  • No premium "ORGANIC" costs
  • No impulse "purchases" at the shops 
  • Cheaper than most peoples eating habits

  • Health, how much better and financially healthy will you be if you don't miss work days, if you are clear minded and working to your best? 
  • No expensive equipment to buy
  • No more wasted time! We saw all the time saved above! 
  • There are plenty of savings to be had. 

Want more info about the Raw methods?

The foods we prepare need a lot of time and love, this includes sprouting, activating and slow dehydrating. This ensures the optimal nutrition can be provided from the foods. Raw foods are not heated above 40 degrees (a really hot day), the reason is once the foods are heated above this the good enzymes are being cooked and killed, our bodies need these to get energy, vitality and to function properly. Our bodies don't enjoy going above this temperature and neither do our foods. 

Our meal plan which has the tick of approval from Nutritionists, Dietitians, Dr's, Personal Trainers, Health Coaches and countless of healthcare professionals is the tastiest, healthiest REAL foods available. We will only use ORGANIC and chemical free produce with no compromise, meaning the ultimate nutritional benefits for the recipients. 

Many see ORGANIC as a way to charge a premium, we don't! Because of our buying power and using seasonal produce we are able to offer our meal plan at similar if not cheaper than current eating habit prices, it just makes sense, not to mention all of the other benefits we have started to point out.


Why do people need a meal plan?

We know how difficult it can be to change eating habits, excuses are easy outs and making new and delicious foods day in day out are not in everyone skill sets. People are simply time poor to put the efforts into making healthy and organic dishes, people need time for themselves, family and friends, cooking, preparing delicious foods every meal is not convenient for many busy people. Raw Eats Meal Plan is convenient for so many reasons, money, time, less frustration and confusion, no need to compromise and this list goes on as well..

What choices are available to people who get home late or at odd hours? What happens when people are tired or cant make the healthy foods the body needs? They tend to go for the easy options which is junk, this starts a bad health cycle. 

Other reasons the Raw food meal plan is needed:

  • People don't have time to nourish themselves properly.
  • Quality is masked by marketing ploys, we don't know what we are consuming.
  • Fresh and delicious meals for breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks. 
  • No more dependence on takeaways. 


What do Raw Eats need to get going?

We need you, you can help improve our economics with having a larger premises to work from, we need signage for our shop, commercial grade refrigeration, freezing kitchen fit out and upgraded commercial quality equipment. A good thing is this is cheaper than a normal kitchen as we need no ovens, stoves microwaves! but we do need food processors, dehydrators blenders and other pieces. 

With the help you provide it's paid back in through the perks, plus you will be responsible for helping change people's lives! We will be able to fund our equipment meaning we are able to make more foods for more people and one by one start making Australia one of the healthier countries. Because of you!


If you heard of someone whom was gravelly ill, what could you do or say?

You could say you helped get Raw Eats off the ground and that they offer the healthiest, tastiest foods and cleanest food around, the foods they make are prescribed by Doctors, Nutritionists and Healthcare Professionals. These professionals advise patients to eat a Raw Food Plant Based diet reason being is it's what we put in to our bodies that makes us either healthy or sick, everybody has heard the saying "You are what you eat", so if you eat the healthiest, cleanest and most nutritional foods available it is going to have some very positive effects on the mind, body and well being of that person. 


What happens if we don't get started now?

It's simple, it means we cannot start helping people with their health, we do not want to say we cant help, "yet" any more. It is heart wrenching not having the resources to help. We have come so far already, help us get to the next step and be responsible for a positive change in ours, yours and others lives.


Can't contribute? 

That's OK, we would still appreciate your support if you passed on the details of this campaign to your family and friends, maybe post this on to your Facebook, Instagram or Twitter? Your help is appreciated! 


Gift the perk to someone who would love the Raw food experience. 

How about a gift for a friend?


Want to contribute more to the movement?

Please visit our website and make contact with us. We would love to hear from you and we can discuss our full business plan and goals in more detail. 


25/10/13 

Update, thank you for purchasing of perks so far! This is what this means to us, it is 25% towards a stainless steel bench with splash-back for the new kitchen. 


30/10/13

Update, thank you to the newest contributors, we are nearly at buying our splash-back stainless steel bench now! Whoop whoop!

30/10/13 

Update, we had a lovely contributor come by and give quotes on helping fix the shop front ready for occupation and serving!

story:
What is it?

Lowdown is a mobile application that dynamically pulls together highly relevant, context aware, company, personal, and industry information. Making preparation for meetings, interviews, and conference calls a breeze.

Who is it for?

Client facing professionals, interviewees, in fact any person that needs rich and pertinent information to prepare themselves for meetings. Sales, Recruitment, you?

Why use it?

Currently, to be well prepared for a meeting, you have to arduously research dozens of sources to gather the information required to be fully prepared.  With Lowdown, your mobile application does the heavy lifting, so you don't have to. 

The story behind Lowdown 

Spark33's founders have consulted for many FTSE100/Fortune500 companies during the last 25 years. Over the past 5 years they have been consulting enterprise businesses on mobile strategy and mobile applications.   

After listening closely to the common pains and challenges these businesses face (rather than just common business cases for apps), it became clear that employees could benefit from mobile-unique business productivity apps. 

We slowly mapped out many features and applications that work to make everyday tasks not only easier, but more creative, more communicative, and better connected. Spark33 started talking about the idea in every client meeting, and after much intrigue, excitement, and unanimous interest in when such an application would be available, we realised we had to be the ones to build it.

Where are we with it?

The project has been carefully analysed, designed, technically & functionally specified, and estimated during this year. The application has about 4 weeks left of initial design and user experience mapping before development of the minimum viable product (MVP) can commence. We'll keep backers close to the process with weekly newsletters on how it's all coming along.

When can backers expect the releases?

The application will be developed using agile development methodologies. This means that the first developer release can be expected after 8 weeks. This will be a fully tested demo, as all releases are, consisting of 4 features. After the initial iteration there will be a release every 2 weeks until the final release. We use this method of development to respond to rapid change, and as a backer, we would love your input in usability testing to analyse and refine the product. However involved you'd like to be, you'll be providing great insight just by using it.

When can everyone have it?

The first release will be available on the App Store at the beginning of next year, for both iPhone & iPad, followed in the second half of 2014 with an Android version.

How will the funds be spent?

The funds will be spent on the development of the Lowdown iPhone & iPad Apps, and on costs surrounding that development. Included in this is iOS and Web programming, project management, hosting, and personnel costs. All user business analysis, prototyping, solution design, user experience design, interaction design, and visual design is already covered.

£48,000 gets us, and you, the first release.

Any funds above £48,000 will be spent on the next App Store release which will further integration with popular business services, refine and strengthen the context and semantic engine, and incorporate user feedback with regards to usability and design aspects.

Sorry, who are we?

Key People

David Senior - CEO

See David's LinkedIn

Helping FTSE100/250 companies with Enterprise Client Computing and Mobile challenges and since 1996.

Over 17 Years IT Consultancy Business Development for CC, SCC, BT, HP.

In 2013 I started a company that provides CxO's with an Agile Strategy Model for Mobile and Mobile Apps in a world where information and communication are at the heart of all our lives.

Also experienced consulting at board level to FTSE 100 and fortune 500 companies on their competitive intelligence strategy.

In addition, I believe that B2B buyers are more inclined to a permission based approach to solving business problems, aided by Content that engages and informs.

Customers have included - BT, BBC, Worldcom, Coca Cola, BSkyB, Ford Motor Company, Vodafone, O2, Global Crossing, Computacenter, Yell, Microsoft, Logica, Interoute, GfK NOP, Chevron, VT Group, Sony, WPP Group, British American Tobacco, BG Group, ExxonMobil, SITA, Chevron, Jaguar Land Rover, John Lewis Partnership.

Michael Worley - CTO & User Experience Designer

See Michael's LinkedIn

Michael's Profile

Since the inception of consumerisation, even before mobility, it has been clear that standards in user interaction design have been raised. With the exponential growth of consumer applications and a new level of product availability through Smartphone evolution, it's more apparent each day that users will not fully engage with poorly realised design.

I have always been a fervent champion of user experience and have developed a diverse and passionate knowledge of well thought out design, presentation and information architecture. These skills have been honed through experience in freelance web development, gastronomy, and currently the mobile applications industry; each area providing widely contrasting client and business delivery expectations.

I proactively research to obtain the most up-to-date industry insight and to gain practical understanding of end-to-end processes in mobile application development. My goal is to realise growth opportunities in enterprise by consulting on the architecture, design, usability, and delivery of products that match both the business and end user needs.

As an advocate of agile development, leading not only personal but technical and organisational excellence, I strive towards instilling simplicity, solid communication, valid feedback, and most importantly trust in a competitive landscape that is often bewildering and unclear.

Michael has worked on mobile apps with the following companies :-

Ernst & Young, Jaguar Land Rover, VW Group, Bombardier, RedOrbit, Gorkana Group, Giant Group, Personal Group, McLaren, Brother.

story:
Short Summary

Mai Bao Anh Truc is a 3 year old girl living in Vietnam. She is in the Hospital suffering of pneumonia and sinusitis.  She had been in and out of the hospital for over a month and shows no sign of recovery.  Because she lives in a poor part of Vietnam her treatment has be ineffective in curing her illness. The doctors are treating her illness as a bacterial infection and have not been able to cure her.  The problem is that the doctors do not have the tools to properly test for the cause of the illness.   She has had a high fever and vomiting and is now showing signs of weight loss and malnutrition.   Her vomiting has been so intense that it has caused her to pass out and received a concussion.  Also she has not been able to complete a full course of antibiotics and has been on and off medication due to a lack of money to purchase medicine.  This may have caused a resistant form of bacteria to develop which is why further treatments have been ineffective.  Her family is currently unable to continue to pay for treatments and she desperately needs to be moved to a private hospital, the French Vietnamese hospital in Saigon, for a proper diagnosis and treatment of her illness.

Her mother is a school teacher and her father works for the national railroad.  Their combined income is not sufficient to pay for all their hospital bills.  Her mother has not been able to work in order to take care of her in the hospital. They have had to go to local lending sources, equivalent to loan sharks, and borrow money.  Her mother has had to sell her motor bike to help pay for the hospital bills.  Even with help from family and friend they are very close to running out of money and are no longer capable of paying for treatment for this little girl. If they cannot find additional funding soon they will have to sell their house or the Truc will die.

What We Need

The $2000 being asked for is only enough to pay for the Hospital bill and for transportation to Saigon.  This is the minimum amount required to help her receive the treatment to cure her.   A hospital room and physiotherapy daily will cost $200+ a day.  Due to respiratory distress her oxygen saturations is less than 90% requiring her to be hospitalized.  She cannot recover at home.  

All the funds raised will go directly to the family to help pay their insurmountable bills.  Any additional money will be used to help other poor families in Phan Thiet that desperately need funds to help their sick children.

The Impact

This money will not only help save the life of Truc but will also allow her mother to get back to work and help the community.  Her mother is a selfless volunteer helping poor children get ahead in school. She has even helped raise children for families that have experienced tragedies and can no longer care for their kids.  This money will do a world of good in a very poor part of the world and will do more than save the life of this little girl.

Perks

The little girl with the red shirt in the image above is Truc.  Her name in Vietnamese means wish and gấu trúc is the word for panda.  She is our little panda bear that’s why I am using the purple panda as my avatar.  If you can donate $50 I will send you a purple panda T-shirt in any size you request.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help.

Help get word out and make some noise about this campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
