story:
Fulton Street Books & Coffee is Necessary

Everyone deserves a place and  a space where they feel welcome. A space for community, community building, and conversations that push us towards better versions of ourselves. A space with a familiar face. An anchor space that feels like home. And that space is precisely what we are building. My name is Onikah, and I am the booklover and founder behind Fulton Street Books & Coffee. After over a decade in the nonprofit sector, I am taking a leap and opening a new space - Fulton Street. Fulton Street is a space to call home. It is a space to build community and to change our city through civic discourse. It is a space on a mission to increase literacy, with people at the center of all the work that we do. It is a space for books, coffee, and a good time (and, yes, there is wine too). It is a space for Tulsans; Tulsans who have been longing for a space created with them in mind.

The Impact

Fulton Street is so much more than books & coffee. Here are just a few issues that are core to our mission and vision:

  • Representation: A pain point for book lovers,  parents, and educators alike is finding and accessing literature that represents diverse cultural and ethnic backgrounds. At Fulton Street, 70% of our books will feature or be written by authors representing a rich array of backgrounds, cultures, languages, voices, and narratives.
  • Literacy: 31% of adults in Oklahoma function with basic literacy skills and 20% of Tulsans between the ages of 18-24 have less than a high school diploma. We are expanding the definition of literacy and reaching community in new ways through creative programming designed to ensure that more Tulsans have access to rich learning experiences that enhance literacy skills.
  • Access: According to the Tulsa Equality Indicators Report, Black Tulsans are 3x more likely than white Tulsans to find it difficult to access resources, activities, and opportunities in Tulsa. Anecdotally, people of color in Tulsa often feel unwelcome and out of place in many mainstream establishments. Fulton Street is made with these Tulsans in mind. We will foster an inclusive environment and create a space for people to finally feel like they have walked into a space that was created with them in mind.

Okay, but is opening a bookstore risky?

Fulton Street Books & Coffee is a business, and like any business, comes with a certain amount of risk. But here is why we believe we will succeed in spite of:

  • Believe the hype - independent bookstores are thriving. While Amazon gets points for convenience, independent bookstores offer what Ryan Raffaelli, an assistant professor at Harvard who studied independent booksellers, coined, the "Three C's": community, curation, and convening. Each of those c's are core to Fulton Street's mission and vision.
  • Community investment - businesses like Fulton Street rely on strong community investment to succeed. We have been diligently working on building our community over the past year. One way that we have started to build trust and community is through pre-opening gatherings  in The Heights, the neighborhood where we are primarily located. Pre-opening gatherings have allowed us to meet our neighbors and for community members to contribute to building the neighborhood bookstore and coffee shop they want for themselves and for their community.
  • Currently, neither The Heights, nor any of our adjacent neighborhoods; Owen Park, Cheyenne Park, Ben Hill, Crosbie Heights, Country Club, or Gilcrease Hills have a neighborhood coffee shop. No bookstore. No gathering place. Fulton Street Books & Coffee is filling a void. We cannot wait to open our doors.

Let's Talk About Money

Let's be real, fundraising is hard. Leaving a successful career is hard (and scary). But you want to know what makes it worth it? You. The people contributing to this campaign. The people who I could not, and would not want to do this without. Seriously.

I value every single dollar that you contribute. And as supporters, I believe that you deserve to know what your dollars are building. Fully funded, it will cost $250k to get Fulton Street up and running. I plan to raise $20k of that right here on Indiegogo. Here is what $20k will buy:

  • A Point of Sale System (POS) - not sexy, but so necessary
  • Inventory - stocking our shelves with all of the book titles we want and deserve. Non-book inventory will include all of the items that you didn't expect to find, but just can't leave behind. Like the prayer candle with Beyonce's face on it (yes- they exist and you will find them at Fulton Street)!

If we exceed our goal, we will use the additional funds for added inventory, building our garden and patio area, and launching some of our programming.

Press, Press, Press, Press, Press

We are so thankful to have had the opportunity to share the journey of opening Fulton Street Books & Coffee on a national platform and as part of a larger conversation on financial wellness and legacy building. You can watch part of our journey in the Documentary Legacy Lives On, by Prudential and Urban One. 

 

MadameNoire - https://madamenoire.com/1075253/exploring-the-r...

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to this campaign, don't fret. Here are two quick and easy ways that you can help us get our doors open:

  1. Share this campaign with family and friends. Share it on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, via email, or any of the other ways you connect with the people in your life.
  2. Find us on Facebook and Instagram - shout us out and show us some love! 

We are so thankful for your support! And we can't wait to see your face in the space!

And feel free to contact us anytime at info@fultonstreet918.com

story:
Short Summary

Matt B. Davis and Obstacle Racing Media have been leading the way in bringing you the most live, up to date coverage and interviews from The Death Race, Fuego y Agua, Spartan World Championships, and World's Toughest Mudder since 2012. (Some past links listed below).

Now is your chance to be a part of helping forward the sport of OCR so that ORM can continue to do this and get some cool perks for doing so. 

(How's entry into a Spartan or Tough Mudder sound for starters?)

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $1000.00 to help cover travel costs so that we can send Matt B. to this year's World's Toughest Mudder. He will be doing tons of live updates and recording interviews for future podcast episodes.

The Impact

Our track record of up to the minute updates with these types of events is unmatched by anyone. We follow the action with constant twitter and facebook updates, then put together all the great interviews shortly after the event.

We want to continue to provide this kind of content for all of the OCR fans and those of you rooting for your friends and family.

ORM does get advertising dollars, but as a startup, we would love some help as we get growing.

Now is an opportunity to do what you can to help us so that we can tell the world about what goes on at this incredible event.

__________________________________________________

Some past website and podcast coverage

2013 Death Race Updates

World's Toughest Mudder 2012 Part I

World's Toughest Mudder 2012 Part II

story:
New: People are talking about CarryON on Twitter!

Tweets about CarryON

What do homelessness, repurposing, and entrepreneurship have in common? CarryON!

According to the Massachusetts Coalition for the Homeless, there were over 16,000 people experiencing homelessness in Massachusetts alone. And chronic unemployment is what is trapping many people in homelessness. CarryON aims to end the cycle of homelessness with the power of green entrepreneurship. We create bags from repurposed materials and provide employment opportunities. Along with economic gain, jobs bring hope, dignity and real life social skills. We hope CarryON becomes a model for other social enterprises, inspiring manufacturing pods across the country and creating jobs for those who believe in the value of repurposing.

This summer, we begin our entry into the retail market, renting a booth at Boston’s Summer Street Art Market and launching an online marketplace at www.CarryONusa.org. We manufacture the bags in a workshop in Boston, and we have a supply of burlap, canvas, and linens, sourced from local coffee roasters and awning companies. As we begin this retail adventure, we are focusing on marketing our products and spreading our mission to repurpose.

We are asking for your support in expanding CarryON so that it can meet the employment needs of more people. Each new job changes a life and breaks the cycle. We want to prove that both bags and people can find new lives.

How did CarryON begin?

Four years ago, a small group of St. Francis House guests sought help in building their path to economic independence. St. Francis House, a day shelter located in downtown Boston, responded by providing a few tools, some financial resources, and, perhaps most important, encouragement to reach their dreams. This led to the creation of CarryON, which is a St. Francis House subsidiary.

At CarryON, we know that the homeless aren’t hopeless, and we want to prove that there are ways to employ the chronically unemployed. 

What are we doing?

At our current stage, we pay our employees and our bills with a combination of our wholesale revenues and funding from supporters. With an increased demand for our repurposed bags in the retail market, we will build a greater capacity to employ people who have limited options yet great motivation.

In our small workshop, our employees work diligently in  a supportive and encouraging environment. We have a waiting list of motivated people who are eager for employment; however, we currently lack the financial resources to hire new employees.

We would love to move into a new space to increase our production capacity. Our goal is to make CarryON both financially and environmentally sustainable, providing employment and purpose for years to come.

What will the funds be used for?

(What does it cost to change a life?)

Our goal is to raise money to partially fund the next fiscal year’s expenses as we establish our name in the retail market and reach new customers. We have the costs of compensating our employees, promoting our business, and expanding our operating capacity. Some of the expenses include:

  • Bobbins
  • Thread
  • Vendor booth rentals
  • Website hosting
  • Sewing supplies
  • Workshop rent
  • Salaries/worker stipends
  • Sewing machine maintenance

How can you help?

We appreciate your contributions to our campaign! Any amount can help us to move forward. We strive to create opportunities for the homeless, and we want everyone to know about the motivation and dedication that our employees devote to this enterprise. They are determined to make a better life despite their histories.

We would love for you to spread the word about CarryON!  Whether you are environmentally-conscious, interested in social entrepreneurship, passionate about ending homelessness, or a believer in the power of a second chance, your support of our mission is invaluable. Following the CarryON journey and sharing on Twitter, Facebook, or in your local neighborhood will empower more people to carry on.

 

Thank you! 

 

Twitter: @CarryONusa

Website: www.CarryONusa.org

Please note: when you donate, your receipt will say "St. Francis House Inc". CarryON, LLC is a subsidiary of St. Francis House, a registered 501(c)(3) organization. Donations to CarryON via St. Francis House are tax-deductible.

story:
Bref résumé/Project summary



Cette campagne vise à financer l'achat de produits dérivés de la culture hip-hop (vinyles, CD, DVD et livres) afin de combler le meuble que l'on voit ci-dessous et d'offrir une plus grande variété de produits à la clientèle du Hip-Hop Café. De plus, nous procéderons également à des améliorations locatives, toujours dans le but de répondre à la demande de la clientèle: "poufs" pour s'asseoir, postes d'écoute, meubles pour ajouter d'autres vêtements, télés, etc. Nous sommes en pleine période de démarrage (en opération depuis le 1er mars 2014) et nous avons besoin de votre aide afin de nous développer à notre plein potentiel.

This campaign will fund the purchase of products associated to the hip-hop culture (vinyls, CD, DVD and books) in order to fill what you see in the picture underneath and offer a wider range of products to the clientele of the Hip-Hop Café. We will also go forward with some leasehold improvements, always with the objective to satisfy our supporters, our clients: bean bags to enjoy the music/vibe, listening stations, more furniture, etc. We are still in our start up (we opened on March 1st 2014) and really need your help to go to the next level and get where our true potential is. 



Qu'est-ce que le Hip-Hop Café?/What's Hip-Hop Café?

​Le Hip-Hop Café se veut un centre culturel dédié au hip-hop, comprenant deux parties: une section café et une autre où l'on peut se procurer différents produits dérivés: t-shirts à l'effigie de groupes, CD, vinyles, magazines, livres, DVD etc... Plusieurs événements y prennent également place: expositions (photos/toiles), live DJ's, séance d'autographes, événements de "breakdance", séances d'écoute d'album, etc. Nous vous invitons à visiter notre site web pour l'historique des événements qui ont eu lieu et ceux qui prendront place prochainement.

The Hip-Hop Café is a cultural center dedicated to hip-hop, which is divided in two parts: a café section on one side and on the other, a place where you can purchase various related products: t-shirts of groups/artists, CD's, vinyls, magazines, books, DVD's...Many events also go down: exhibition of pictures/paintings, live DJ's, autograph sessions, breakdance events, album listening sessions, etc. Visit our website to see the historic of the events that already went down and those that will take place soon.


L'impact que vous avez/The impact you have

L'atteinte de cet objectif est excessivement importante. En effet, augmenter la variété de nos produits et procéder à des améliorations locatives nous permettra de solidifier notre lien avec notre clientèle en plus d'aller chercher les gens qui ne sont pas encore venu, étant donné que nous sommes ouvert seulement depuis 5 mois. Le geste que vous posez en nous aidant à financer cette campagne est donc directement en lien avec notre développement et notre expansion en tant qu'entreprise. Vous avez l'opportunité de nous aider à amener ce centre culturel de hip-hop à un autre niveau. Le pouvoir de votre action est considérable.

Achieving this objective is extremely important. In fact, increasing the variety of our products and making leasehold improvements will allow us to strengthen our relationship with our customers as well as get new people in, since we only open 5 months ago. The action you take in helping us to support this campaign is directly related to our development and growth as a company. You have the opportunity to help us bring this hip-hop cultural center to another level. The power of your action is considerable.


      D'autres façons d'aider / Other ways you can help

      Vous ne pouvez pas nous aider monétairement? Aucun problème. Partagez l'information avec votre entourage. Cela peut avoir un grand impact sur le résultat final!

      You can't help on a monetary level? No problem. You can share the info with as many people as possible. It can have a geat impact on the final result.
story_txt:
Bref résumé/Project summary






Cette campagne vise à financer l'achat de produits dérivés de la culture hip-hop (vinyles, CD, DVD et livres) afin de combler le meuble que l'on voit ci-dessous et d'offrir une plus grande variété de produits à la clientèle du Hip-Hop Café. De plus, nous procéderons également à des améliorations locatives, toujours dans le but de répondre à la demande de la clientèle: "poufs" pour s'asseoir, postes d'écoute, meubles pour ajouter d'autres vêtements, télés, etc. Nous sommes en pleine période de démarrage (en opération depuis le 1er mars 2014) et nous avons besoin de votre aide afin de nous développer à notre plein potentiel.
This campaign will fund the purchase of products associated to the hip-hop culture (vinyls, CD, DVD and books) in order to fill what you see in the picture underneath and offer a wider range of products to the clientele of the Hip-Hop Café. We will also go forward with some leasehold improvements, always with the objective to satisfy our supporters, our clients: bean bags to enjoy the music/vibe, listening stations, more furniture, etc. We are still in our start up (we opened on March 1st 2014) and really need your help to go to the next level and get where our true potential is. 





Qu'est-ce que le Hip-Hop Café?/What's Hip-Hop Café?
​Le Hip-Hop Café se veut un centre culturel dédié au hip-hop, comprenant deux parties: une section café et une autre où l'on peut se procurer différents produits dérivés: t-shirts à l'effigie de groupes, CD, vinyles, magazines, livres, DVD etc... Plusieurs événements y prennent également place: expositions (photos/toiles), live DJ's, séance d'autographes, événements de "breakdance", séances d'écoute d'album, etc. Nous vous invitons à visiter notre site web pour l'historique des événements qui ont eu lieu et ceux qui prendront place prochainement.
The Hip-Hop Café is a cultural center dedicated to hip-hop, which is divided in two parts: a café section on one side and on the other, a place where you can purchase various related products: t-shirts of groups/artists, CD's, vinyls, magazines, books, DVD's...Many events also go down: exhibition of pictures/paintings, live DJ's, autograph sessions, breakdance events, album listening sessions, etc. Visit our website to see the historic of the events that already went down and those that will take place soon.




L'impact que vous avez/The impact you have
L'atteinte de cet objectif est excessivement importante. En effet, augmenter la variété de nos produits et procéder à des améliorations locatives nous permettra de solidifier notre lien avec notre clientèle en plus d'aller chercher les gens qui ne sont pas encore venu, étant donné que nous sommes ouvert seulement depuis 5 mois. Le geste que vous posez en nous aidant à financer cette campagne est donc directement en lien avec notre développement et notre expansion en tant qu'entreprise. Vous avez l'opportunité de nous aider à amener ce centre culturel de hip-hop à un autre niveau. Le pouvoir de votre action est considérable.
Achieving this objective is extremely important. In fact, increasing the variety of our products and making leasehold improvements will allow us to strengthen our relationship with our customers as well as get new people in, since we only open 5 months ago. The action you take in helping us to support this campaign is directly related to our development and growth as a company. You have the opportunity to help us bring this hip-hop cultural center to another level. The power of your action is considerable.






D'autres façons d'aider / Other ways you can help
Vous ne pouvez pas nous aider monétairement? Aucun problème. Partagez l'information avec votre entourage. Cela peut avoir un grand impact sur le résultat final!
You can't help on a monetary level? No problem. You can share the info with as many people as possible. It can have a geat impact on the final result.

story:
Hi, My name is Jody R. Weiss, and I founded PeaceKeeper Cause-Metics (www.iamapeacekeeper.com) almost 11 years ago. PeaceKeeper is a For-Benefit company that gives donations to urgent human rights issues globally. 

PeaceKeeper is the activist beauty brand of the industry. We launched a lipgloss with the United Nations which gives donations to the UN's Trust Fund To Eliminate Violence Against Women. We have a lipgloss with Eve Ensler and her V-Day movement to end violence against women. We have a lipgloss called Fairness Gloss to advocate for a fair wage & we have a lipgloss called Eternal Equity Gloss which gives a dollar to women who live on less than a dollar a day. 

THE CHALLENGE

•One year ago, PeaceKeeper Cause-Metics took a direct hit from Hurricane Sandy in New York. The warehouse where we housed PeaceKeeper filled up with five feet of water, flooded 95% of our inventory and destroyed our computers and paper files.

•We received no disaster assistance due to loads of red tape and crazy regulations!!

•Even our insurance agency left us high, and not-so-dry, claiming we didn’t have the right kind of coverage despite paying over $30K in premiums over the past decade.


The CAMPAIGN

•We are raising $7,500 to get back in the game and show buyers that we can overcome.  Our funds will go towards re-launching and improving our packaging so that our brand will be seen on par with other upscale brands at Sephora or Ulta, especially in foreign markets.

•We are working with a great distributor in Asia who will help us re-launch and grow by handling the marketing and sales of our goods, if/when we deliver our new look.

•If we surpass our Indiegogo raise and reach $15,000, we will actually manufacture an upscale line of lipsticks and lip glosses for distribution in Asia. 

•We are also committed to contributing 10% of all campaign dollars to Apne Aap women’s charity (which helps young women out of high risk situations in which they are or can be forced into prostitution, into a sustainable trade. Visit www.apneaap.org) and are also thrilled to be participating in Indiegogo's Giving Tuesday campaign.

•If we can hit $50,000 with Indiegogo, we will introduce our new upscale lip line to very exclusive stores in the USA and other upscale distributors overseas.  We have lots of plans if we can exceed our goals and all along the way we’ll be helping women around the world who live on less than a dollar a day. 

Who needs the US Government's “disaster assistance” or the insurance industry's excuses when we have a universe of friends like you?

THE PERKS- 

We are offering either gift boxes that you can give as gifts or donate to a charity of your choice for the Holidays or, if you are not into cosmetic gift boxes, some other perks that will engage you directly with your brand. For instance, how often in your life will you be able to name a product that will appear on the shelf at retail! Read the perks below and become a PeaceKeeper with us. 


THE GIFT BOXES - Here is a description of what you will find in the gift boxes!

With the Holidays & New Year here, we can offer you fantastic gift boxes and other perks in exchange for your donation. Buy gifts now or for birthdays and other events next year! PeaceKeeper products are made with organic ingredients and are not tested on animals. 

HOW WE SOURCE INGREDIENTS - 

We  source certain raw ingredients from developing world farmers to support them and their families. What we mean by this is that we work with bio-dynamic, organic farms in India, where the soil is not poisoned with pesticides. The fertilizer used is a "living fertilizer" made from cow dung, rosemary (used as a natural preservative), neem (used as an anticeptic), shell (for calcium), worms and other organic ingredients that create enough richness in the soil the farmers can get two to three crops a year as oppose to one crop. That is called a "LIVING SOIL". We also source from US farmers who have received USDA or organic certification for the raw ingredients they sell (such as rosemary, spearmint & beeswax).

We have four delicious gift boxes for you to choose from:

Three Flavors of Our USDA CERTIFIED ORGANIC YUM Balms

Three of the following flavors will be included: Raspberry, Strawberry, Blueberry or Citrus

Retail Price $36.00

Indiegogo Price: $ 28.80, a 20% savings

Gift Box, Ribbon & Gift Card Included

Order By December 18th to arrive in time for Christmas.

FREE Shipping anywhere in the USA (Canadian & overseas orders will be charged shipping and we will contact you to approve the shipping rate).

Three Flavors of ORGANIC MEGA Balms

Three of the following flavors will be included: Fair Trade Cocoa Chocolate, Organic Rose, Organic Spearmint or Organic Superfruit/Berry

Retail Price $24.00

Indiegogo Price: $20.00, a 20% savings

Gift Box, Ribbon & Gift Card Included

Order By December 18th to arrive in time for Christmas.

FREE Shipping anywhere in the USA (Canadian & overseas orders will be charged shipping and we will contact you to approve the shipping rate).

Visionary Gift Box - Darker Skin Tones

One Darker Toned 75% Organic Lipstick, Empowered or Mysterious (perfect for brunettes or darker skin tones or taste)

One Sheer Red VDay or Sheer Burgundy UNIFEM Lip Gloss with 75% Organic Ingredients

Provocative Nail Polish - Real Holiday Red - Lasts 5-7 days with a top coat!

Made without harmful Toluene, Formaldehyde, Acetone, Phthalates, Parabens, DBP's

Retail Price $30.00

Indiegogo Price: $24.00, a 20% savings

Gift Box, Ribbon & Gift Card Included

Order By December 18th to arrive in time for Christmas.

FREE Shipping anywhere in the USA (Canadian & overseas orders will be charged shipping and we will contact you to approve the shipping rate).

Diplomat Gift Box - Lighter Skin Tones

One Lighter Toned Lipstick, Loving or Oh So Sexy (perfect for blondes or lighter skin tones or tastes)

One Sheer Baby Pink Women For Women or Sheer Fairness Lip Gloss

Provocative Nail Polish - Real Holiday Red - Lasts 5-7 days with a top coat!

Made without harmful Toluene, Formaldehyde, Acetone, Phthalates, Parabens, DBP's

Retail Price $30.00

Indiegogo Price $24.00, a 20% savings

Gift Box, Ribbon & Gift Card Included

Order By December 18th to arrive in time for Christmas.

FREE Shipping anywhere in the USA (Canadian & overseas orders will be charged shipping and we will contact you to approve the shipping rate).

THE VALUES FOR YOU

PeaceKeeper has funded women who have been trafficked, indentured or who live in servitude by sourcing from women farmers in the developing world and giving micro loans to their families. We have given away over $100K to urgent human rights issues! With your help, we can have a second life and a second chance in making a difference in the lives of those in the greatest need. Please be a PeaceKeeper with us and make a donation today! 

THANK YOU!

story:
Imagine the change we could effect!

Imagine being able to return to your youth and remove all of your insecurities, squash your fears and lead the life you dreamed of as a child. Our goal at Confidence Connection Coaching is to empower youth to choose healthy self-confidence and self-esteem as a way of life. To encourage them to break down barriers and limiting beliefs before they become an ingrained part of their personality.
 
By raising our goal amount of $15,000 we will be able to get the word out to many more parents and youth and empower many more youth!
 

The Time is NOW!


  • Research has shown that some form of bullying happens every 3 – 7 minutes.
  • 1 in 4 students have been bullied online
  • Less than 50% of cyber bullying is reported.
  • Bullying is most prominent among 6 - 13 year olds.
  • 20% of children who are bullied, it is because of how they look or speak.

Youth today are experiencing an increased level of stress. With additional pressure at school to succeed in order to obtain very high grades just to apply to university, increased social pressures, heightened conflict situations both online and in person and increasingly hectic schedules kids are struggling to manage.

Possible Effects of Stress in Children

   • 30% of tweens and 42% of teens say they get headaches. However, only 13% of parents reported being aware of their children having headaches.

   • 39% of tweens and 49% of teens report difficulty sleeping. However, only 13% of parents reported being aware of their children having trouble sleeping.

   • 25% of tweens and 39% of teens reported eating too much or too little due to stress. However, only 8% of parents reported being aware of this issue.

Teen Pregnancy has increased:

“Girls with low self-esteem often base their self-worth on being in a romantic relationship, despite the quality [of it],” says Richard Shadick, Ph.D., director of the counseling center at Pace University. “Girls who do not value themselves tend to accept poor treatment from boyfriends, in part, because they have few supports in their life.”

Other issues include low grades, lack of concentration, getting into trouble or fights and much more.


Our Mission

Our mission is to add value and empower as many youth and parents as we can. We are Confidence Coaches trained by a premier life coaching institution. Our values based coaching style mixed with educational programs and workshops instill life long skills and behaviours that lead to confidence and self-esteem.

Why we're doing this

Do you hear a voice in your mind that is mean to you? I used to.  In fact, I know many people who have heard this voice. My voice used to tell me I was fat. He was telling me this to protect me, make it okay that I had some weight issues. I had heard this voice since I was a young girl. He was born with my bully back in grade school, and he didn’t die until I made the choice at 38. He lived for 30 years. RIP.

A few months ago I was talking with a 10 year old neighbour. She is one of the kindest, most loving people I know. Suddenly a few minutes into our conversation, she got very quiet and I saw a tear run down her face.

She said, “Jenn, I’m fat. I need to go on a diet.” Astounded that a 10 year old would be worrying about these things I asked her why she thought that. She said that she heard it inside of her all of the time. After a bit of digging, I realized that she too had been called fat by a number of people in her life. Those voices stuck with her just like they had with me.

Although it was a difficult thing to hear, I realized right then and there that something had to be done.  As Gandhi says “A man is but a product of his thoughts, what he thinks, he becomes."

What We Need

Our mission is to empower youth with confidence and self-esteem through education and coaching. We have created a 10 week program dubbed SpringBoard Confidence Project for both boys and girls ages 10-13.This interactive program is designed to be both a web-based program and a live program. 

This is where we need your help! We need to raise $20,000 to get this program launched both online and in the classroom.  In order to help as many youth as we can, we would like to be able to offer this program in the classrooms for free, or at least at cost. In order to attain these goals, we need some start up capital.

To keep accountable to you we commit to providing updates of our efforts, challenges, achievements and successes through this site and our website www.confidenceconnectioncoaching.com. As supporters of the program we will periodically email you directly (if you wish) with free strategies and tips on how to support the mission in your own areas of influence and share ideas we get through the implementation of the mission.

We guarantee your money is going to a great cause! The money raised will be used for marketing and running programs focused on getting to as many kids as possible.  We plan on a full scale internet marketing campaign to get the word out, and to build and print our workbook and other resources for use in the classroom.

Should we not attain our goal, we will begin with marketing.

There are many ways you can help even if you cannot pledge money!!

Not everyone can always help by way of money, here's some other ways you can help us spread the word!

  • Please share our indiegogo campaign page with your facebook, twitter, emai and  linked in networks!
  • Check out our facebook page and "like" it! www.facebook.com/confidenceconnectioncoaching
  • Add us to your twitter @kidsconfidence
  • Our blog flows directly to our website: www.confidenceconnectioncoaching.com

Thanks for your support!

Jenn & Shauna

story:
FOR THE LOVE OF WHISKEY!

 

(Krystle & Jason Jorgensen)

We love whiskey. We love whiskey so much, we want to make it every day. In an effort to do so, we've started Alley 6 Craft Distillery. We're a small batch distillery aiming to produce some of the finest rye, wheat, and bourbon whiskey. By participating in our campaign, you will help us get off the ground and make us the first distillery in Healdsburg, California. 

We'll strive to make sure that every step in the process is sustainably and responsibly managed, and all of our spirits are made using the best organic grain sourced as locally as possible. We're taking the whole process in-house every step of the way to ensure the highest quality product. We've teamed up with the City of Healdsburg as the pilot project to showcase the way forward for the local distilling industry. Some of the ways we will reduce waste is to give the left over grain to the local farmers to feed the livestock, while the used barrels will be turned into various items such as planters, furniture, and lighting. In the end, this will allow us to make a quality artisan whiskey, while helping our community. . . which makes us happy. 

We began to develop an interest in beer and winemaking after moving to Northern California. Jason started slinging drinks at a steakhouse where they sell some of the best whiskies in the world and soon fell head first into the craft-distilling arena. We began attending tastings and shows, touring local distilleries, and eventually going on a life-changing trip to Scotland. We knew this was our life’s passion and could be happy making whiskey every day. This has been a dream in the making and it gets so much closer to being a reality each and every day. There has been so much research and hands on education, as well as an abundance of support from our family, friends, and advisors to get us to where we are today. We want to make this dream come true and need some help in doing so. 

We've moved in to an awesome location and plan to start production in the beginning of 2014. We invite you to share in our dream! Your contributions will help us get off the ground and be able to start producing. We promise to make you proud.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

For the past couple of years, we've been taking on extra jobs and scraping up every cent in order to purchase whatever we can within our means. However, making hand-crafted whiskey is a costly endeavor and there are a lot of hoops to jump through, as you can imagine. We've gotten as far as we can on our own and now here we are, we need help.

Now that we've moved into our warehouse we're itching to launch, but there's still a lot of work to do. Your donations will help us get our facility up to date and purchase materials for the first few batches to actually start producing. The total amount we are looking for is upwards of $50,000; however, we are hopefully setting a more achievable goal of $10,000 to get us started. We will be ecstatic if we surpass our goal because every bit counts! The additional dollars will go towards increasing production amounts, purchasing new equipment, and building out our tasting room. All of your support is greatly appreciated and will be well used.

With that being said, we have some great perks to share with you for your donations of $25 and up, although all donations are welcome! So please check 'em out and help us get this barrel rolling!

Now, we realize most of you will be wondering why you don’t see free bottles delivered to your door as a gift. Hold your horses, we aren’t actually legally allowed to provide these items yet. Well, that’s no fun. But rest assured, once we get up and running you will be able to drink our delicious whiskey soon enough! We will do our best to reward you for your contributions. 

If you want to help distilleries in California be able to operate tasting rooms like breweries and wineries do, you can go here to join in on the cause: 

The California Artisanal Distillers Guild

MONEY FOR WHAT??

Now that we have our facility, we are doing everything we can to open the doors and start production. We know we can do it with your help. Your money will go towards:

  • Production Equipment (stills, tanks, pumps, burners…) 
  • Tenant improvements for compliance with codes & permitting  
  • Barrels & Grain (our biggest operating expense) 
  • Bottles & Labels

OTHER WAYS TO HELP YOUR HOMIES OUT

We know not everyone has funds to contribute. There are other ways you can help so please, spread the word and tell your friends, family, and co-workers about this campaign and our story. You can send them to our website, Facebook, or Indiegogo pages. Be sure to tell your local bars, restaurants, and liquor stores about Alley 6 whiskey too. After all, who doesn't like whiskey. . . or a dream.

Visit our website and sign up for our newsletter at www.alley6.com

Like us on facebook https://www.facebook.com/Alley6CraftDistillery

We are putting our hearts and souls into this opportunity and want to extend a sincere thank you to everyone for hearing our story, supporting the little guy, and sharing in our dream!!! We are forever grateful for any support you can give, we are humbled by those that believe in us, and hope you can stop by to see us in action soon!
story_txt:
FOR THE LOVE OF WHISKEY!




 


(Krystle & Jason Jorgensen)
We love whiskey. We love whiskey so much, we want to make it every day. In an effort to do so, we've started Alley 6 Craft Distillery. We're a small batch distillery aiming to produce some of the finest rye, wheat, and bourbon whiskey. By participating in our campaign, you will help us get off the ground and make us the first distillery in Healdsburg, California. 

We'll strive to make sure that every step in the process is sustainably and responsibly managed, and all of our spirits are made using the best organic grain sourced as locally as possible. We're taking the whole process in-house every step of the way to ensure the highest quality product. We've teamed up with the City of Healdsburg as the pilot project to showcase the way forward for the local distilling industry. Some of the ways we will reduce waste is to give the left over grain to the local farmers to feed the livestock, while the used barrels will be turned into various items such as planters, furniture, and lighting. In the end, this will allow us to make a quality artisan whiskey, while helping our community. . . which makes us happy. 
We began to develop an interest in beer and winemaking after moving to Northern California. Jason started slinging drinks at a steakhouse where they sell some of the best whiskies in the world and soon fell head first into the craft-distilling arena. We began attending tastings and shows, touring local distilleries, and eventually going on a life-changing trip to Scotland. We knew this was our life’s passion and could be happy making whiskey every day. This has been a dream in the making and it gets so much closer to being a reality each and
every day. There has been so much research and hands on education, as well as
an abundance of support from our family, friends, and advisors to get us to
where we are today. We want to make this dream come true and need some help in doing so. 
We've moved in to an awesome location and plan to start production in the beginning of 2014. We invite you to share in our dream! Your contributions will help us get off the ground and be able to start producing. We promise to make you proud.






WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET
For the past couple of years, we've been taking on extra jobs and scraping up every cent in order to purchase whatever we can within our means. However, making hand-crafted whiskey is a costly endeavor and there are a lot of hoops to jump through, as you can imagine. We've gotten as far as we can on our own and now here we are, we need help.
Now that we've moved into our warehouse we're itching to launch, but there's still a lot of work to do. Your donations will help us get our facility up to date and purchase materials for the first few batches to actually start producing. The total amount we are looking for is upwards of $50,000; however, we are hopefully setting a more achievable goal of $10,000 to get us started. We will be ecstatic if we surpass our goal because every bit counts! The additional dollars will go towards increasing production amounts, purchasing new equipment, and building out our tasting room. All of your support is greatly appreciated and will be well used.
With that being said, we have some great perks to share with you for your donations of $25 and up, although all donations are welcome! So please check 'em out and help us get this barrel rolling!

Now, we realize most of you will be wondering why you don’t see free bottles delivered to your door as a gift. Hold your horses, we aren’t actually legally allowed to provide these items yet. Well, that’s no fun. But rest assured, once we get up and running you will be able to drink our delicious whiskey soon enough! We will do our best to reward you for your contributions. 

If you want to help distilleries in California be able to operate tasting rooms like breweries and wineries do, you can go here to join in on the cause: 
The California Artisanal Distillers Guild



MONEY FOR WHAT??
Now that we have our facility, we are doing everything we can to open the doors and start production. We know we can do it with your help. Your money will go towards:



Production Equipment (stills, tanks, pumps, burners…) 

Tenant improvements for compliance with codes & permitting  

Barrels & Grain (our biggest operating expense) 


Bottles & Labels






OTHER WAYS TO HELP YOUR HOMIES OUT
We know not everyone has funds to contribute. There are other ways you can help so please, spread the word and tell your friends, family, and co-workers about this campaign and our story. You can send them to our website, Facebook, or Indiegogo pages. Be sure to tell your local bars, restaurants, and liquor stores about Alley 6 whiskey too. After all, who doesn't like whiskey. . . or a dream.

Visit our website and sign up for our newsletter at www.alley6.com
Like us on facebook https://www.facebook.com/Alley6CraftDistillery
We are putting our hearts and souls into this opportunity and want to extend a sincere thank you to everyone for hearing our story, supporting the little guy, and sharing in our dream!!! We are forever grateful for any support you can give, we are humbled by those that believe in us, and hope you can stop by to see us in action soon!

story:
Since I was five years old I have known in my heart that I wanted to live at an orphanage and help kids who didn't have families (I don't know where this idea came from although I'm pretty sure Mister Rogers had something to do with it!)

I am finally making that goal happen and am heading to Tanzania, Africa for 10 weeks to volunteer at the Forever Angels Baby Home the 27th of January.

I am hoping you can help.

All it takes is just one drink, one latte, tea, frappacino, beer, cocktail. Take the pocket money you would spend on just one drink this weekend and donate it. It's that simple. The money I raise will help supply water, food, medical supplies to kids who have absolutly nothing. If you would like to donate more, this is how far your money can go....

$5 will diaper a baby for an entire week.

$8 will pay for a months supply of clean water for child

$20 will pay for a child to see a Doctor in the hospital and be treated for a life threatening illness such as pneumonia or malaria. That's just $20 to literally save a life.

$40 will feed eight kids 30 days and stop them from feeling constant hunger.

$130 would pay a nurse's salary to care for the children at the baby home for an entire month.

$160 will pay for a entire family to rent a room for ONE YEAR! That enables a family who wants to adopt to have somewhere to call home.

 

You only have until Monday January 14th to contribute so PLEASE DONATE NOW! It will take 5 minutes and could save a life....

 

The Baby Home houses up to 50 babies and children who have been abondened and have no family to care for them. They run souly on donations and anything helps.

 
If you would like to purchase items rather than donting money, consider buying the items below and getting them to me by January 23rd so I can take them with me to Africa:
 
-Bubbles
-Garbage Sacks
-Hand Blenders (for liquidising baby food)
-Baby wipes
-Swim Diapers (ages 6 months - 3 years)
-Face Paints
-Baby/Child Tylenol
-Digital Ear Thermometers
-Child Fingernail Clippers
-Baby Lotion
-Baby Soap
-Toys for the sandbox
-Kitchen toys
-Plastic toddler spoons
 
Please visit their website if you want any further information: www.foreverangels.org

story:
The Lemong'o Project - InDemand

We were overjoyed with the results of our first Indiegogo campaign in April 2014.  With your generous contributions we were able to raise $10,775.  In meeting our goal during this first campaign, we were able to serve over 5,000 lunches to 500 children and pay eight teachers their FULL salaries for a year, all while building stepping stones in becoming a more sustainable non-profit.

Because of our first success, we've extended our Indiegogo campaign and are currently "InDemand," which allows us to continue fundraising even though our first campaign is over.  With your support, we hope to raise an additional $10,000O!  Our Indiegogo site shows what was earned during our last drive, combined with what has been raised this year making it appear that we have met our goal already - but we still have a long way to go. Please consider helping us meet our current goal!


                 


About Us

The Lemong'o Project became a registered 501(c)3 non-profit  in 2011, although the work with the Maasai people of Lemong'o began several years prior in 2007. Through the years the  village has gone through struggles and successes and continues on a path of positive change. The Lemong'o Project strives to work with the community in partnership and is committed to create sustainable solutions to their education, health, nutrition, and employment needs. We are currently fundraising in hopes to transition towards sustainability for the Lemong'o Project and the people it serves.

            

 

Our Immediate Needs

Nutrition - School Lunches

Before the school lunch program was started, students were often too weak to walk to school or would fall asleep in class due to undernourishment. When the school lunch program was initiated, there were approximately 225 students enrolled.  Currently there are over 500 students enrolled. Our school lunch budget ($850 per month) has remained the same despite the school's enrollment doubling. As a result, the amount of food each student receives has been cut in half. School lunches are provided to students each day and for many students this is their only meal of the day.  

     


Education - Teacher's Salaries

Eleven teachers at Belgrove K-8 school serve over 500 students. The Kenyan government only provides and pays for three out of the eleven teachers. The remaining eight teachers are local community members, many of whom have grown up in Lemong'o. Parents are responsible for those teachers' salaries. Unfortunately the vast majority of parents are unable to pay the tuition in full. Consequently, teachers are often only partially paid and children are frequently sent home for not paying their tuition. This is very disruptive to their education. Currently the Lemong'o Project pays half the salaries for the eight non-government teachers ($350 monthly, roughly $40 a month per teacher). Without these non-government teachers, there would only be three government teachers instructing over 500 students.       


Health - Medical Clinics

Medical clinics are provided twice a year by  the Lemong'o Project and are open to all in the village and surrounding areas.  Frequent medical concerns include: malnutrition, malaria, skin diseases (the result of poor hygiene due to lack of access to water,) dental issues, goiters, at risk child birth and burns from cooking fires.  Since 2011, approximately 2,300 people have been treated and over 200 people have been supported for follow-up medical referrals.  Also included in the Lemong'o Project medical clinics are vision screenings by an optometrist.  In addition, vision screenings are held for all children at the school.


Employment - Economic Development

The Lemong'o Project aims to support economic development within the village.  A future goal is to provide small micro finance loans to villagers, especially to women, which will begin to create sustainability.  We are confident that with this support the people of Lemong'o will apply their strong work ethic to develop successful small businesses. 

   


Why we need your help now

Since its inception, The Lemong'o Project has been primarily self-funded,  largely operating on “friends and family” donations and our first ever crowdfunding campaign.  With this type of hand-to-mouth funding, the Project’s programs are subject to great uncertainty every year.  Consequently, much of our organizational leadership time is devoted to fundraising, rather than sustainability and expansion of services.

With your help in reaching our campaign goal, The Lemong'o Project will be able to continue to meet the immediate needs of the village while simultaneously working on long term strategic planning to expand programs, secure predictable revenue sources, and improve organizational infrastructure. This will allow us to broaden and deepen the services we can provide to the beautiful people of Lemong'o.


The Big Picture - Where's the money going?

Your donation will help us keep our monthly commitments (lunches, teacher salaries and medical clinics) with the people of Lemong'o, while allowing us to transition towards true sustainability.  

The Lemong'o Project is a registered 501(c)3 non-profit foundation. The funds collected for this project are going directly to benefit the people of Lemong'o.

    

        

Your gift will go a long way

  • $10 pays for one child, K-8, to attend school in the village for one year
  • $30 provides basic clinic supplies and medicine for ten people
  • $40 will pay for half a teacher's salary for one month
  • $100 provides hot school lunch for 450 students for three days

Other ways to get involved

  • Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, blog it, email it, spread the message as far and wide as you can. How far the project can go is driven by how far this page reaches in 35 days. After you've shared, get your friends and relatives to as well! 
  • Research grants or other possible funding sources
  • Locate medical supply donors (ask your medical provider at your next visit)
  • Approach a local business for a donation
  • Organize a youth group to do a fundraiser or host a benefit at your church or organization
  • Sell Lemong'o jewelry and/or cards at your work place for a week

Contact Us: thelemongoproject@gmail.com
http://www.thelemongoproject.org/

Follow us on Facebook and twitter @LemongoProject

Ashe Oleng (Thank you very much!)

story:
My Story:

Hi! My name is Linda. I have been a single mom for the last 10 years. I have been a quilter for the last 30 years and it has been my passion and many times my savior in times of great stress. 

I moved to Texas almost 20 years ago and although it's a nice state, I haven't ever considered it my true home, Home is where your heart is, and that has, and always will be with my family who all live in Florida.  

I originally moved to Texas with my spouse but divorced 10 yrs ago when I decided that I couldn't get along with his girlfriend.  I got custody of both of my boys and stayed here so that they had stability and consistency during their high school years. My boys are grown now, and out of school and I long to be closer to my family. 

I come from a large tight knit family, the kind that share dinners and hugs and laughter and sadness. The kind that support you and hold you up when you need it and can also laugh and make fun of you when you do something ridiculous, or they might even decide to jump in and do it with you. I miss them deeply and long to be surrounded by this love once again.  

My Dream:

For many years I have dreamed of running my own business. I have been afraid to take a risk and do it because being a single mom and the sole breadwinner in your household makes taking a chance like this is much more daunting when you know you are responsible for others.  My finances have always been tight and budgets have been a necessity to ensure that my boys were taken care of.  Helping to buy cars and funding things for school can be expensive when its just you doing it.  Needless to say, this didn't leave a ton of room for savings,

I know it seems as though I want not only to have my cake and eat it too. And I would be lying if I didn't say, "yes",  you are right, that is exactly what I want! I have sacrificed so much in my life and I really would like to finally be able to do something for me.  Is that selfish? Yes, it is, but I think its time for me to be a little selfish now.  

Starting a business is not only a challenging undertaking but it can also be a financial burden for someone who has been doing things on their own for so long. Trying to move and set up a new household in another state is pretty much impossible for me to do at this time in my life because I gave all of what I had to my parenting over the last 10 years.  But I still have a dream, and I know what I want, and have a business plan to make that happen, I just need a little bit of help or a push to get me moving in the right direction. 

How you can help: 

If you can see it within your heart to help me to reach my goal to make my dream come true, you would be helping me to fulfill my dream of doing what I love while being surrounded by those that I love and love me.   For those of you that know me, kindness is my middle name, I have always been the one to give and give and I always find love in my heart. I am asking for you to find a little in yours to help to get me Home and help me to do what I am supposed to do in my life.  Please, give back if you can.  Your contributions will go towards getting me packed and moved from Texas and a jump start on getting into a new location in Florida. 

Have you heard the quote “And the trouble is, if you don't risk anything, you risk even more.”  by Erica Jong?  This is me, me taking a risk, asking YOU to help me to take this leap, asking you to help me because you can and you want to.  Will you? 

My Business Plan: 

My plan is to have my business and my home in the same building. Part of the my house will be designated for my Quilt/Coffee shop and the rest as my home.  The main goal is to have a Cozy Quilt shop that would offer fabrics, books, notions as well as classes and there would be Longarmining as I own a Longarm already. I would need a small kitchenette area that I would sell coffee/tea/cold drinks.  It is essential to have a a comfy sitting area for those that might want to chat or just take a break. An outside shaded sitting area will be essential.  I have a floor plan and a cost estimate on how much it will take me to get up and going for my building. I will also need to buy product as well. My goal is to have a relaxed laid back quaint smaller shop, that allows for sitting in large comfy chairs to chat and feel at home. I want my customers to feel like they are going over to a friends house when they come to purchase their Quilting needs. I believe that if you provide the right environment and the right attitude that quilters will come.

My first steps:   

I will need to find the perfect lot and have this home/business built.  I want it to be in a smaller town that will still be within driving distance for quilters. I am doing research online and working with multiple real estate agents but I will also need to fly to Florida to look at locations to narrow this down to the perfect spot.  I am hopeful to at least get enough money in my first campaign to cover the cost of this. 

What your help means...

People who know me are aware of how determined I am, they know that when I put my mind to something that I am passionate about that there is no stopping me.  I am always asked why I have not been doing this for a living for so long that now I have begun to realize that I could and I would like to, if I can only get the kick start that I need to get this thing off the ground. I know that we all want something in this world but what am I doing to make that something happen for myself?  I am taking this step, please help me to realize my dream.  Every little bit can help.  Just think of how much money you spend on coffee each week, or on beer, I bet you could spare to help me a little to get this going?  Just a few dollars can even make a difference!  

Can't contribute?  Please share this! 

I am sure that many of you will be thinking that you would like to help but you can't.  You still can help by getting the word out for me, send this to someone that you think might be able to help or that has potentially been where I am and could relate.  Please share and help me to reach my dream!  


I thank all of you from the bottom of my heart!  <3

I have sacrificed so much in my life and I really would like to finally be able to do something for me.  Is that selfish? Yes, it is, but I think its time for me to be a little selfish now.  
Starting a business is not only a challenging undertaking but it can also be a financial burden for someone who has been doing things on their own for so long. Trying to move and set up a new household in another state is pretty much impossible for me to do at this time in my life because I gave all of what I had to my parenting over the last 10 years.  But I still have a dream, and I know what I want, and have a business plan to make that happen, I just need a little bit of help or a push to get me moving in the right direction. How you can help: If you can see it within your heart to help me to reach my goal to make my dream come true, you would be helping me to fulfill my dream of doing what I love while being surrounded by those that I love and love me.   For those of you that know me, kindness is my middle name, I have always been the one to give and give and I always find love in my heart. I am asking for you to find a little in yours to help to get me Home and help me to do what I am supposed to do in my life.  Please, give back if you can.  Your contributions will go towards getting me packed and moved from Texas and a jump start on getting into a new location in Florida. Have you heard the quote “And the trouble is, if you don't risk anything, you risk even more.”  by Erica Jong?  This is me, me taking a risk, asking YOU to help me to take this leap, asking you to help me because you can and you want to.  Will you? My Business Plan: My plan is to have my business and my home in the same building. Part of the my house will be designated for my Quilt/Coffee shop and the rest as my home.  The main goal is to have a Cozy Quilt shop that would offer fabrics, books, notions as well as classes and there would be Longarmining as I own a Longarm already. I would need a small kitchenette area that I would sell coffee/tea/cold drinks.  It is essential to have a a comfy sitting area for those that might want to chat or just take a break. An outside shaded sitting area will be essential.  I have a floor plan and a cost estimate on how much it will take me to get up and going for my building. I will also need to buy product as well. My goal is to have a relaxed laid back quaint smaller shop, that allows for sitting in large comfy chairs to chat and feel at home. I want my customers to feel like they are going over to a friends house when they come to purchase their Quilting needs. I believe that if you provide the right environment and the right attitude that quilters will come.My first steps:   I will need to find the perfect lot and have this home/business built.  I want it to be in a smaller town that will still be within driving distance for quilters. I am doing research online and working with multiple real estate agents but I will also need to fly to Florida to look at locations to narrow this down to the perfect spot.  I am hopeful to at least get enough money in my first campaign to cover the cost of this. What your help means...People who know me are aware of how determined I am, they know that when I put my mind to something that I am passionate about that there is no stopping me.  I am always asked why I have not been doing this for a living for so long that now I have begun to realize that I could and I would like to, if I can only get the kick start that I need to get this thing off the ground. I know that we all want something in this world but what am I doing to make that something happen for myself?  I am taking this step, please help me to realize my dream.  Every little bit can help.  Just think of how much money you spend on coffee each week, or on beer, I bet you could spare to help me a little to get this going?  Just a few dollars can even make a difference!  Can't contribute?  Please share this! I am sure that many of you will be thinking that you would like to help but you can't.  You still can help by getting the word out for me, send this to someone that you think might be able to help or that has potentially been where I am and could relate.  Please share and help me to reach my dream!  I thank all of you from the bottom of my heart!  <3

story:
In 1919, Charles Dwight of Hockely Heath bought a Maxwell van to use in his haulage and removal business, and let his son Ernest drive it. The van became a regular sight on the Warwickshire roads throughout the 1920s until an accident in 1927 from which Ernest never recovered.

The van was retired to the family's orchard until 1966 when it entered the private collection of Michael Banfield, who restored it from a ruin to a fully operational glorious vehicle.

Mr Banfield died in 2013 and his collection is up for sale on 14th June 2014. Charles Dwight's grandaughter Janet Coulls was a teenager when the van left the family and would now like to bring it back to Warwickshire to be the centrepiece of displays in Hockley Heath and Umberslade about the village and its history, attending shows, events and visiting local schools to tell a variety of stories from transport to food supplies and the use of surplus war material for civilian operations.

The van is in full working order and would we hope become a familiar sight once again on the lanes where it worked over 90 years ago

At auction it is thought that it may cost upwards of £20,000 to buy; £5,000 is already in place but we hope

 We face the challenge of where to keep the vehicle and how to maintain it - but members of the team have over 25 years experience of heritage projects and maintaining and running historic vehicles.

If you can't help financially but know someone who might, please let them know about the appeal and get in touch!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Paul Sleath. 

I have worked with people for the last twelve years, my passion is making things happen for people and in the right way. Having managed many people over the years I understand everyone is different but I place integrity and trust at the heart of all my goals.  I've found this approach means you can not go far wrong. 

I'm asking for your investment to help me and others. The business can be full of Jargon so if you want to know some technical in depth detail please visit our website, peoworldwide.com.  In a nutshell I will try to describe what we do and why below:

  • When you go to work the most important thing for you is that you get paid and paid correctly. Its also important that you are employed properly with a contract and that your employer pays your tax for you. Its all about workers rights and being able to sleep at night. Thats what we do.
  • I can be a bit of a stickler for 'the rules' and doing things right, especially when it come to looking after employees. It is top of my list. Thats why I am passionate about this business. I know of too many cases where business pay people under the table or fail to pay their tax. Its not good for the employees, its not good for the economy and it causes all sorts of social issues and abuses of staff. 
  • By investing here today you will help us build a business that looks after people in work. You will be part of something special. It also means that the government gets its tax revenue, employees get the protection they need and employees have piece of mind they are acting ethically. Please read on....

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need funding for two things marketing and staffing. I have worked in this industry for a long time and know the model is solid. I also know some fantastic people that I want to employ. They share the vision, goals and most importantly the ethical ethos of the business. 
  • Marketing- I know what we have is special, revolutionary and brilliant! I need some investment to tell the world! I'd like to make our website a little more user friendly. I'm like to advertise (I'd really like to shout it from the rooftops but I think Google may work better.) We also need to talk to a lot of people, quite a few in the USA and those phone calls are not cheap! Your investment will really make a difference.
  • We want our investors at all levels to be part of the business and to be part of its success. Along with the perks offered I am also happy to offer my personal advice and help to anyone investing in us. From a simple payroll question to help on an employment dispute I am at your service.
  • Your investment gives you a range of perks that are listed on the right, from a mug to an equity stake. All investors also get a discount on our professional fees.
  • The great thing about our funding goals is that they are scalable. That means if we don't reach our target I'll be calling more people and advertising less. Anything you invest WILL make a difference.

The Impact


I see a world where people work hard, get paid well and give back to society. We have the system already in the Uk and the western world through taxation. We have experience of working in these markets already. We want to make sure that in these countries things are done right all of the time putting the employee first. 

  • We want to champion employee rights globally. We want to lobby governments to protect workers and in return allow them to tax those wages (Win Win). We all know of the Bangladesh disaster at the textile factory. This should not ever happen. Empowering workers globally will ensure that this does not. 
  • I have managed and helped many companies and workers in recent years to act responsibly. I have set up operations in Hungary that gave the working mothers maternity leave, sick pay and paid holiday. All things denied to them by there previous working arrangement. The company was happy to do this as well as they know they now have a happier more stable workforce. 
  • I hope you can see the value in our vision and share it. If you want to know more or have any questions at all please contact me directly. Paul@peoworldwide.com.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but cant contribute please do the following:

  • Shout about the campaign. Speak to your boss, speak to your friends, infact, Shout it from the rooftops! (I'll join you).
  • Look at our website. Peoworldwide.com. Google loves people looking at things!
  • Link-in with me Paul Sleath at linkedin.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
You want to support local, but you don't have the time, transport, or coordination to make it to your favorite butcher or baker every week. We pride ourselves on providing a reliable service for residents and businesses, making it easier for you to get the food you need and to be able to support the local farmers and businesses in Nova Scotia. We provide a much needed service for seniors, students, single parent families, or those who require a transportation service to access healthy, sustainable, food. We are  passionate about offering a quality service to help those without transportation, time, or resources to get the products they need.


History

Established in 2012. Locally owned and operated.

We have been providing grocery and food deliveries since 2012 via our website www.gropro.ca. We make it easier to buy local, so we focus on our Buy Local section members to try to get awareness out about the products we have right here in Nova Scotia. We have been successful at increasing sales for small business food producers in the area and are excited to expand our reach and delivery capabilities.

Meet the Business Owner

Jessica MacNutt

Hello All.

Originally from Tatamagouche, NS, I attended Dalhousie University where I studied Entrepreneurship and Marketing Management and completed my Bachelor of Commerce. After several years working in tourism, advertising, print media and retail marketing it was time to start a business of my own.  I wanted to start a social enterprise that encouraged a positive future and addressed a need in the market. With a small amount of money, I started www.gropro.ca and have been developing the business since.


What We Need & What You Get

  • We've got wind in our sails, but we are a team of 2 trying to fuel a new idea and refine our system so that we can continue to be profitable and hire more employees.
  • We need money for marketing activities to gain attention to our Buy Local section on gropro.ca.
  • We need funds to hire an additional employee to coordinate pick ups and help with sales
  • We need to improve our website to incorporate more functionality for our Buy Local members in the Buy Local section to further increase their sales.
  • We recognize the every dollar spent at a local business goes back into our community and we want to give easy access to these locations. By introducing our Buy Local system to more members and customers we can increase the dollars put into these businesses. We need your funds to help increase awareness and efforts to market these local producers.
  • If we do not reach our goal, we will use whatever money is raised to promote these businesses and help increase their sales.

The Impact

  • Our service allows small business owners to focus on creating their products. We provide professional marketing support and delivery services so they can focus on their business. When they partner with us, they immediately have a delivery option for their customers via our professional service.
  • Local producers benefit from our social media, marketing and word of mouth advertising and have access to our network of resources.
  • Local producers have a delivery option during busy times for their errands such as picking up local meat for their lunch menu, or dropping of their product at a retail location for sale.
  • Our residential customers are able to support local food producers easily.

Risks & Challenges

After being in operation for 2 years, our major challenges have been exposure and web expansion. GROPRO Buy Local is a new system. The major attraction to our business is our offering of delivery from local producers, and we need to educate local producers on how our service can benefit them and local residents on how they can support more local businesses.

  • We are training more delivery staff and now have a part-time employee who is ready for full time hours which will include addressing our contact challenges.
  • We are always looking for meetings with local producers and tell our customers about different local locations and options upon delivery. Our customers are our champions and we encourage them to introduce us to new producers.
  • We do not discourage visiting your local producer yourself, but we do understand that there simply is not enough time (or gas money) to visit 2-3 local producers every week. Now customers can use our service and add several stops at their favorite places and have it all delivered by the time they get home from work,

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the campaign, As part of the reason we are crowd funding is that we need help getting the word out about the system and its availability. We need more people (especially local business owners) to hear about our service and get familiar with it. By removing these barriers we can put more dollars back into our community.
  • Place an order! When you order from a local producer in our Buy Local section, you pay the same price as if you walked in to the market yourself. Believe us, the best part of our day is calling a local producer with another sale.

We do not discourage visiting your local producer yourself, but we do understand that there simply is not enough time (or gas money) to visit 2-3 local producers every week. Now customers can use our service and add several stops at their favorite places and have it all delivered by the time they get home from work,

We need more people (especially local business owners) to hear about our service and get familiar with it. By removing these barriers we can put more dollars back into our community. 
 Place an order! When you order from a local producer in our Buy Local section, you pay the same price as if you walked in to the market yourself. Believe us, the best part of our day is calling a local producer with another sale.

story:
Give a Man a Fish, Feed Him for a Day. Teach a Man to Fish, Feed Him for a Lifetime.

Hearts for Kenya is focused on “teaching for a lifetime” one rural community, Oyugis, Kenya, East Africa. By sharing modern agricultural practices with the citizens of Oyugis, the people are learning to be self-sufficient while raising their standard of living. Hearts for Kenya firmly believes that not only do the people of Oyugis become self-sufficient and are able to survive without being provided for, but they have a sense of achievement and fulfillment.

When Hearts for Kenya was first formed, Oyugis farms were yielding about 300 pounds of corn per acre. There was no significant ongoing fertilization, irrigation or crop rotation. There were no animals or machines to pull a plow. Sixty percent of the children of Oyugis were infected with HIV. Starvation and infection were the leading causes of death. Waterborne infectious diseases were spreading freely among the people. The few public buildings and churches that existed, being built of mud and sticks, were not durable.

Although dire conditions remain, significant progress has been made in Oyugis since 1997 due to the efforts of Hearts for Kenya and the initiative of the local people. Corn crop yield has been increased from 297 pounds to over 1,263 pounds per acre. There is now enough corn grown locally to sustain the local populace, with some left over from each harvest to sell. Significant progress has also been made in irrigation, fertilization and farming methods.

Although the recent drought has ended, the problems of malaria, TB and AIDS remain rampant. Local people are exercising enough leadership and initiative to sustain the gains made thus far. However, they will require much additional time and help in order to have a chance to overcome the various other barriers to survival that are characterized by the extreme poverty. Hearts for Kenya is ready and willing to continue providing that help, and it needs a continual flow of resources in order to accomplish that goal. 

While the primary mission of Hearts for Kenya is the development of a farming cooperative, the medical needs of the co-op community are integral to their ability to have better lives.  In an effort to improve the community’s access to affordable, reliable and convenient health care, Hearts for Kenya has developed plans for a medical clinic that can serve the co-op families.  By involving the community members in the clinic plans, we have been able to proceed with a concept that will be self-sustaining.

If we raise $30,000 we can transform the existing structure into a clinic.

Walls

Cement:

1 bag costs approximately $12

200 bags totaling $2,400

1 ton costs approximately $145

6 tons totaling $870

Anything above and beyond the $30,000 will go towards purchasing medical equipment and supplies for the clinic.

Give a Little

(or A LOT)

if you cannot give then please

Spread the word!

Tell your friends! Use Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc. to get the word out and help the people of Oyugis to help themselves. Give a hand up not just a hand out!
