story:
Yaku is a business located in Peoria, Illinois. The Organization is acting as a Benefit Corporation. It exists to oversee the restoration, repurposing, and management of the historic Hale Memorial Church (HMC), located at 401 West High Street, Peoria, IL. Yaku is the organizer of a growing 40+ members  community of artists and art groups from around the world. The Organization will draw artists from the international community to curate cultural festivals within the HMC. Between festivals Yaku will offer the HMC for use as a rental facility. Yaku will also actively engage the youth through school collaborations and outreach programs to promote community participation and cultural involvement.


Floors and Doors

Floors and Doors is the first restoration initiative of Yaku.   For years the Hale Memorial Church has been unattended to; this project is the first act to reclaim the space. Floors and Doors is series of simple preservative gestures to stabilize the church. These gestures include: 

  • Rebuilding the doors - to allow safe and secure movement in and out of the space.
  • Repairing the floors -  portions of the floor have been damaged by various elements, repairing these areas would allow for safe movement throughout the church. 
  • Clearing the space - over the years the church has accumulated debris varying from old building materials to garbage from previous inhabitants. Clearing this out will create a bigger and brighter space. 
  • The Envelope - To keep the elements out; resources will be spent on sealing the envelope, this includes: patching roof, boarding windows, repairing holes in the gutters, etc. 

Money from the Floors and Doors campaign will go to preserving the space and creating the momentum needed to take the project into the future.


E + N = Founders


The Founders of Yaku are Earl Power Murphy and his wife Natalia Villanueva Linares. Earl is a Canadian born US citizen who has been living in Peoria, IL for almost 20 years. He is a teacher and an avid member of the growing Peoria community. He is the President of the Organization and the voice of Yaku in the City. Natalia is a French-Peruvian sculptor who left her home, family, and friends in Paris, France to join her husband in Peoria and together build Yaku. She is the Creative Director, organizing the artistic presence of Yaku and creating an international community of artists.



The Church

The Church, formally known as the Hale Memorial Church, was built in 1900. It was originally an Episcopal church, but has passed through several different denominations during its lifetime. In the mid 1990’s the church congregation was on its last legs; after a few shortcomings with the neighborhood and a small fire the assembly was forced to find a new home. The building, to prevent demolition and decay, was purchased by the neighborhood organization in hopes that one day a group would come to bring the Church back to life. The building stayed empty until a couple purchased it from the neighborhood in the early 2000’s. They had plans to turn the building into a small chapel for weddings and their home. The couple gutted and cleaned the majority of the Church and fitted a small area of the building to be their home. The couple lived and worked in building for several years until they, as well, had a falling out. About this time Earl was growing more interested in the building. He saw great potential; a potential to revitalize the historic community, provide a home for the emerging culture-definers of the next generation, and a space to explore and share the arts. Earl and Natalia worked with the couple to purchase the building from them and continue their restoration efforts. The couples were unable to come to an agreement and the owners then lost the building to the City. After a period of grey, hoop jumping, and patience, the building was finally found in the hands of a tax-buyer. The Church was purchased on the spot. From that day on Earl and Natalia have been working with community members, volunteers, and professionals to organize the movement that will restore the church and breathe new life into it.


{logo created by John Seckler}

story:
What happens when you take 32 MBAs from 6 of the nation's top business schools and dispatch them to 26 cities to work hands-on with almost 50 of America's most visionary entrepreneurs? 

We start a movement that can help revitalize America — and you can help us do it! 

MBAs Across America began with four Harvard MBAs on an 8,000-mile journey last summer, but has grown to include 32 MBAs (MBAx Fellows) from six business schools who have decided to leave behind the comforts of classrooms and Wall Street cubicles and head out into the heart of America — spending this summer in over two dozen cities, working hands-on with almost 50 visionary MBAx Entrepreneurs.

Our MBAx Entrepreneurs include the team behind one of New Orleans’ most innovative food ventures, Montana's Entrepreneurs of the Year (make that 3 of them!), one of Detroit's most inspiring social entrepreneurs, as well as folks turning rural towns like Wichita, Kansas and Tupelo, Mississippi into startup communities. They represent everything from hi-tech to urban farming, but they all have one thing in common: they want to grow their business as well as their impact, like Will Anderson, whose Salemtown Board Company was recently featured on CBS for its transformational work with youth in Nashville. 


Our MBAx Fellows come from Babson, Columbia, Haas, Harvard, Ross and Stanford. They represent four core values — care deeply about the mission; listen more than you speak; act more than you plan; embrace & navigate uncertainty & discomfort — and a global generation of business leaders eager to make a difference. Check out their bios and Impact Itineraries here.


Why We Need You

It takes $30,000 to enable one MBAx Team to join forces with six MBAx Entrepreneurs this summer. With the amazing support of our partner schools and corporate sponsors like General Motors and Holiday Inn, we have secured almost all of the funding we need to launch the MBAx movement, but we need your help to finish the job. 

In return, you will become a part of the MBAx movement this summer and beyond — we'll send you awesome products from our entrepreneurs, postcards from the road,  and invites to exclusive Google Hangouts or to join us on the road! A few of you will even get your own brainstorming session with an MBAx Team, or an in-person visit with the cofounders of MBAs Across America. 

This is Only the Beginning

Even if you can't contribute money, you can certainly contribute to our mission by sharing our campaign with all your friends and following our journey throughout the summer & beyond.

To the future!

The MBAxAmerica Team


MBAx In the Press

Financial Times: 

A map, a car, 8,000 miles and four MBAs

New York Times: 

M.B.A. Students Hit the Road to Help Small-Business Owners

Forbes: 

Harvard Students Launch Domestic Peace Corps For MBAs

NationSwell: 

This Organization is Sending Business Students on Road Trips for Change

Harvard Business School:

2014 Class Day Speech by Casey Gerald

story:
THE ISSUE

One in six Americans do not know where their next meal will come from, while over 40% of food in the United States is wasted. This amounts to a daily loss of over 263 million pounds of consumable food, equivalent to $165 billion dollars.

Food waste not only hurts our planet, but our wallets as well. Worst of all, this discarded food could be used to help feed the 50 million Americans who go hungry every single day.

WHY WE CARE:

  • The problem is NOT a lack of food, rather an inequitable distribution of it.
  • The current method of coordinating food donations is ineffective.
  • Every day, there is enough food thrown away to feed the entire continent of Africa...twice.
  • That’s RIDICULOUS. We can fix it.

OUR SUCCESSES:

Feeding Forward began at UC Berkeley as a food recovery organization, redistributing surplus consumable food from campus dining halls to nearby homeless shelters and soup kitchens. This college-based food recovery movement quickly spread, leading to the launch of the national Food Recovery Network spanning over 62 college campuses in 35 states. 

WHAT WE’VE LEARNED:

  1. Food is wasted EVERYWHERE and ALL THE TIME -- not just on campus dining halls and not just at pre-scheduled pickup times.
  2. Perishable food has to be donated and transported quickly and safely -- so it is imperative to always have an “on-demand” driver to pick-up and deliver the donation AND a nearby place to take it to.
  3. Donating food must be effortless -- busy people want to do good things, and they want to do them with ease and speed.
  4. The donation of surplus food at random times is difficult (not to mention extremely frustrating) to coordinate with recipient agencies through phone calls and emails.
  5. It’s hard to locate and contact the agencies who need it most, when they need it most.

OUR NEWEST & FASTEST SOLUTION YET

Feeding Forward uses technology to connect those with excess food to feed those in need, instantly.

HOW IT WORKS

  1. The donor (i.e. restaurants, caterers, businesses, grocers etc.) posts a donation of excess food through Feeding Forward’s mobile app or website.
  2. Our unique algorithm matches the donation to a nearby recipient agency (i.e. homeless shelter, soup kitchen, etc.) in need of food at that given time.
  3. A volunteer is sent to pick up the food and upon delivery confirms that everything went smoothly.

Please continue spreading word about our campaign! By working together, we will achieve our goal in eradicating hunger and food waste once and for all. Thank you!


With love and gratitude,

The Feeding Forward Team


--- 

Watch the Founder's Story! 

Where I grew up in Las Vegas, homelessness was literally illegal. I was never exposed to such blatant poverty, as I was when I first came to Berkeley. The stark contrast between the prestige of the top public institution in the world and the rampant homelessness and poverty that was embedded in the city and the campus itself disturbed me. While at the same time, I was astonished as to how much food was being wasted at the dining halls. Right across the street from my university’s most popular dining hall was People’s Park, a public park that acts as a daytime sanctuary for Berkeley’s large homeless population. As someone training to be a navy officer and medical doctor, the problem hit home for me when I realized many of the inhabitants of this park were former veterans.

After witnessing this paradox firsthand, I approached my dining hall manager to discuss a possible food recovery initiative. I then spearheaded a team of students to rally behind this cause and established the nation’s first student-powered food recovery program, that soon became the catalyst for a nationwide food recovery network. Despite our amazing success, the challenges of being a student, a social entrepreneur, and first-time founder prompted the necessity to find a more efficient solution to our food recovery process. I couldn’t think of a better way than to use my phone instantly connect those with excess food to feed those in need. It was here that Feeding Forward started. And with your support, let's power this process forward. 

Best Wishes & Peace, Love, and Food for All!

story:
The Human Rights Organization for Transparency and Peace (HROTP) in a non government organisation that provides free legal advice and assistance for disadvantaged Khmer people. HROTP represents human rights interests and anti-corruption issues, acting as a nonpartisan liaison group between the government and the Khmer people. As a group HROTP assists in a wide range of human rights cases, ranging from human trafficking and rape to enabling rural people have access to medical care in Phnom Penh and housing development projects for the underprivileged. 

In the late 1970s the Khmer Rouge banned private property, destroying thousands of land documents. As a result, many Cambodians lack the proper land titles to the property they own. This often results in the illegal sale or eviction of people from the lands that they rightfully own. The Cambodian government has been selling Cambodian people’s land to foreign investors for monetary gain with little regard for the land rights of the Cambodian people, taking away their homes and their livelihoods with little to no compensation. According to the rights group Licadho in 2013, 400 000 people have been affected by land grabbing and land disputes since 2003.

Kampong Thom Province

HROTP frequently visits the rural province of Kampong Thom, where we spend time working and documenting the land rights issues with the locals in Prey Lang Forest, a bio diverse forest that has been subject to extensive logging and mining. Land surrounding the forest has been sold to Vietnamese investors by the Cambodian government with little regard to the rights of the Khmer people. 700 families have been forced from their land with the promise of new land for housing and arable land for farming. However, only 300 families have received a small block of land which is infertile. Multiple families have taken to living in one small home. They have lost their farms, no longer having the ability to earn an income, creating an inability to afford new housing. The Cambodian people feel that the government has no regard for their well-being and they cannot see a solution to their struggle.

One Story

For several months HROTP has been working on developing a grassroots housing project in Senserei Mongkul village which was inspired by one elderly woman and her family. This remarkable woman, Chhen Sopheap, and her family lost their home and land as a result of illegal land grabbing. They are currently living in wooden hut that is not much bigger than a single bedroom and does not have enough room to stand in. It is poorly built and low to the ground, having several times attracted poisonous snakes during the night. This hut is being lent to them on a short term basis by a neighbour and they live in constant fear of being asked to leave at any time. 

 The family are malnourished and often sick, Sopheap has been unable to see out of one eye and is too weak to walk very far or perform any type of hard labour. They have been attempting to make a small income through mending clothes, yet without a sewing machine they were rarely able to earn enough to buy even one meal of rice a day. This meant that they have had to rely on donations of food from the local villagers, creating a strain on an already impoverished community. The land on which they live now is rocky and largely infertile, so they are unable to even grow their own food. 

Sopheaps six year old granddaughter 


HROTPs Aim

HROTP wants to help this family to become self sustainable and have access to the basic human rights of adequate shelter, food and fresh water. By achieving this we will also be helping the local community as a whole, as it alleviates the strain placed on them by providing them with food and water. 

Through our fundraising campaign so far we have been able to provide Sopheap and her family with a sewing machine and the materials in which to mend and sew clothes, a small step on the road to self sufficiency. We have also secured a plot of arable land on which we aim to build the family a home and a well. 

What we need now are the funds with which to pay for the materials and labour associated with building them a home and digging the well. The cost of this has been quoted at $2000 US dollars. This money will make the world of difference for this family and the future prospects for the six year old granddaughter. But it does not stop with them, it will also make a huge difference to the community as a whole. Any contribution to this project, no matter how small, will have a lasting affect on the lives of the people of Kampong Thom. 

HROTP also aims to educate people and raise awareness about issues in Cambodia. Visit our website to find out about our other projects 

http://hrotp.org/

Please like us on Facebook and share one story of the many displaced families in the Kampong Thom province.

https://www.facebook.com/HROTP

HROTP volunteers meeting with the Family at their home in Kampong Thom

story:
Short Summary

   Every community should have one: a restaurant where everyone can feel at home, from families with small children, to young couples on a quiet date, to groups of friends. A place where friendly attentive service, exceptional food, and a relaxed, yet refined ambiance combine, creating a great destination for everyone. Flat Rock Farm to Table will open for business in Fairview, Tennesse,serving a varied menu of mouth-watering American favorites, presented with passion.  Flat Rock will also serve beer, wine, and cocktails in a responsible manner. Our food is freshly made in-house, using farm-raised organic ingredients whenever possibe. Flat Rock Farm to Table will cultivate a warm and welcoming environment, allowing hardworking people to enjoy excellent food, good company, and superb customer service.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down in more detail:

  • We are raising $45,000.00 in order to illustrate support for a great restaurant in Fairview. With your help, we will be able to show our investors and bank that demand for a quality dining choice is strong.
  • We will give you some nice gifts to show our gratitude for helping us get Flat Rock up and running!  
  • $50 for a future dinner. What do you have to lose? 
  • $85 for V I P treatment at our pre-opening events. Be the first to try our food!
  • The funds raised will be used to pay our opening expenses: design, food and beverage inventory, and training costs. .

The Impact

    Flat Rock will provide an exceptional dining choice for everyone in Fairview. Think of the time, money, and gas you will save by not needing to drive to Dickson, Franklin, or Nashville for dinner. Moms will have a place for quality afternoon luncheons. Meals after sporting events, rewards for good report cards and celebratory dinners are now only a few minutes away.

  • Our menu supports local farms. Our food is fresh and will taste better than anything currently available in Fairview.
  • I have 30 yeears of experience in restaurant operations and I know the commitment it will take to not only be successful, but to provide a great dining experience.
  • The money you save in gas alone will be worth the contribution.

Other Ways You Can Help  

   Share this video and weblink with all of your friends and family. Help us show how strong the demand is for our restaurant! Support your local farmers!

Visit our website @ www.Tnflatrock.com 

Like us on Facebook

 

    Help us get the word out and get ready for farm fresh ingredients, thoughtfully prepared, to be enjoyed in our family-rich environment.

story:
English Version below

________________________________________________________

Hallo zusammen,

ich heiße Marén, bin 33 Jahre jung und lebe in Neuss bei Düsseldorf.           
                                        

Vor 17 Jahren bin ich aus meiner Heimat Weißwasser (Oberlausitz) weggegangen, um einen Beruf zu erlernen und die Welt kennenzulernen. 

                               

Wenn man mich damals gefragt hat, was ich später mal machen will, habe ich immer gesagt: "Ich möchte mal ein kleines Lokal mit einer kleinen Zimmervermietung oben drüber haben." Also bin ich ausgezogen, um den Grundstein dafür zu legen. Ich habe eine Ausbildung zur Hotelfachfrau gemacht und bin dann nach Neuss gezogen.

Leider ergab sich hier keinerlei Möglichkeit für mich, meinen Traum weiter zu verfolgen und ich habe eine weitere Ausbildung zur Informatikkauffrau gemacht. Ich hatte einen Chef, der mir immer gesagt hat, dass man hart arbeiten muss, um seine Ziele zu erreichen. Die 11 Jahre bei ihm waren sehr schwer. Ich hatte Neider, Gönner, Unterstützer. In den letzten beiden Jahren war ich sehr oft kurz davor meine Kündigung einzureichen und einfach zu gehen. Ich wollte einfach nur noch nach Hause. Zu meiner Familie. Es hatte sich in den Jahren so entwickelt, dass ich nur 2 Mal im Jahr bei meiner Familie sein konnte und das Abschiednehmen fällt jedes Mal schwerer. Zu sehen, dass ich Vieles verpasse, dass ich Vieles gar nicht mitbekomme und das ich in schweren Zeiten nur telefonisch bei ihnen sein kann, lässt mich oft frustriert in der Ecke sitzen.

Weihnachten, im Dezember 2012, haben meine Familie und ich zusammengesessen und über Gott und die Welt geplaudert. Irgendwann kamen wir auf das Thema: "Was ist aus unseren Träumen geworden". Wir landeten schnell bei dem kleinen Restaurant mit kleiner Zimmervermietung oben drüber und begannen zu überlegen, wo man dieses Projekt in Weißwasser umsetzen könnte. Ich landete auf einem unbebauten Gelände und begann zu "spinnen". Ich habe auf großen Blättern aufgemalt, wie ich mir mein Restaurant vorstelle. Mit einer großen Glasfront, sodass man sehen kann, was los ist. Mit genügend Parkplätzen, sodass man das Auto auch gern mal stehen lassen kann, wenn es doch länger wird. Mit einer Terasse draussen, damit man im Sommer den Kaffee an der frischen Luft genießen kann und mit viel Grün drumherum, sodass die Natur zum Entspannen einlädt.

Leider stellte sich schnell heraus, dass ein solcher Neubau nicht zu finanzieren ist. Also ging ich bei Maklern und im Internet auf die Suche nach geeigneten, leerstehenden Immobilien. Selbst beim Bürgermeister habe ich gefragt, ob es Gebäude gibt, die dafür in Frage kommen. Gleichzeitig suchte ich mir direkt vor Ort einen Unternehmensberater, der mich vor Ort unterstützt, da ich ja die meiste Zeit in Neuss bin. 

Mein Berater war direkt begeistert von meiner Idee und meinem bereits vorhandenen Businessplan und sagte mir seine vollste Unterstützung zu. Wir fanden ein Lokal (direkt am Marktplatz), welches die große Glasfront hat. Welches die Möglichkeit für einen kleinen Biergarten hat, wo direkt nebenan genügend Parkplätze sind und zur Krönung auch noch viel Grün drum herum ist. Es steht der Businessplan, auch mit dem Vermieter ist alles geklärt, mit einer Brauerei hatte ich bereits Termine, um alles zu besprechen. Der Fliesenleger hat ein tolles Angebot gemacht, um wieder Flair in die Immobilie zu bekommen. Ich habe 2 Studenten die mich beim Corporate Design und der Inneneinrichtung unterstützen.

Nun sind wir nach etwas mehr als einem Jahr Planung schon soweit, dass eine Bank ihre Unterstützung zugesagt hat. Jedoch sind Banken bei Gastronomie-Projekten sehr zögerlich. Ich kann einen Kredit über den Großteil des Geldes aufnehmen. Aber leider scheitert mein Traum an 15.000 Euro, welche ich einfach nicht selbst aufbringen kann. Für dieses Geld wird der Gastraum neu hergerichtet und die Bar neu und modern aufgebaut. Auf dem Bild wird deutlich wie dringend notwendig das ist.

Es wird eine Mischung aus Steakhaus und Eventgastronomie. Alt und Jung sollen einen Ort zum Wohlfühlen haben.

Der einzige Jugendtreffpunkt der Stadt wurde geschlossen. Ich möchte, dass Jugendliche wieder einen Anlaufpunkt haben und nicht auf der Straße hocken müssen. Ideen hierfür wären eigene Teenie-Nachmittage. Es gibt Schülerbands, welche bei diesen Nachmittagen auftreten können und somit bekannter werden.

Freitags ist Wochenmarkt auf dem daneben liegenden Marktplatz. Man kann sich nach dem Einkauf auf eine Tasse Kaffe oder ein Mittagessen treffen.

Mittags gibt es besondere Angebote, die täglich wechseln, damit es immer interessant bleibt. Und das zu günstigen Preisen. Futtern wie bei Muttern ist hier die Devise.

Am Abend wird das Speisenangebot an die amerikanische Küche angelehnt. Steaks, Burger, Spare Rips und Ähnliches dürfen da nicht fehlen. Und an Wochenenden gibt es immer wechselnde Angebote, wie zum Beispiel: Motto-Partys, Krimidinner, Vorlesungen, Poetry-Slam, auch mal einen Bingo-Nachmittag und und und. Den Ideen sind hier kaum Grenzen gesetzt.

Ich möchte ein Anlaufpunkt sein, wo sich Alle wohlfühlen, gern hinkommen und auch gern mal länger bleiben.

Und genau an der Stelle kommt Ihr ins Spiel. Helft mir bitte, dass ich meinen Traum leben kann und zwar an der Seite und mit der Unterstützung meiner Familie. Macht meine Kampagne bekannt. Teilt sie mit Freunden, Bekannten, Verwandten.

Natürlich sollt Ihr dabei nicht leer ausgehen. Ich stelle Euch gern folgende Perks zur Auswahl:

1. Ein dickes Dankeschön. Für 10,00 Euro kommt Ihr an die Danke-Wand in dem Lokal. Dort werden alle Unterstützer namentlich genannt. Und wenn Du es schaffst auch persönlich vorbei zu kommen, gibt es oben drauf eine dicke Umarmung von mir :-)

2. Freigetränk. Für 25,00 Euro bekommst Du bei Deinem ersten Besuch ein Glas Deines Lieblingsgetränkes und selbstverständlich auch die dicke Umarmung. Und auch Dein Name kommt an unsere Wand.

3. Ein Mal Mittagstisch: für 50,00 Euro bekommst Du ein Gericht vom Mittagstisch und ein Glas Deines Lieblingsgetränkes. Und natürlich kommt Dein Name an die Wand und die Umarmung ist nicht zu vergessen.

4. Du bekommst für 100,00 Euro 10 % Rabatt auf unsere Speisen bei Deinem ersten Besuch (max. 4 Personen). Und natürlich kommt Dein Name an die Wand und die Umarmung ist auch dabei.

5. Für 150,00 Euro gehst Du zu unserem Koch und kreierst Deinen eigenen Burger (Er muss genießbar sein), der eine Woche lang unter Deinem Namen auf unserer Karte steht. Außerdem erhältst Du 10 % Rabatt auf unsere Speisen bei Deinem ersten Besuch (max. 2 Personen). Und natürlich kommt auch Dein Name an die Wand und die Umarmung ist auch dabei.

6. Für 200,00 Euro darfst Du einen eigenen Cocktail entwerfen (auch dieser muss genießbar sein), der dann eine Woche lang "Coktail der Woche" ist. Außerdem erhältst Du 15 % Rabatt auf unsere Speisen bei Deinem ersten Besuch (max. 2 Personen). Und natürlich kommt auch Dein Name an die Wand und die Umarmung ist auch dabei.

7. Für 500,00 Euro kommst Du mit einer Begleitperson Deiner Wahl bei uns Essen (es sind inkl.: 2 Hauptgänge nach Wahl, 1 Flasche passenden Wein, 1 Flasche Wasser). Und auch hier kommt Dein Name an die Wand und die Umarmung ist auch dabei.

8. Für 1.000,00 Euro kommst Du mit 3 Begleitpersonen an einem Abend Deiner Wahl zu uns (meldest Dich natürlich vorher an, damit wir alles vorbereiten können) und Ihr bekommt ein Hauptgericht nach Wahl (pro Person), 2 passende Flaschen Wein und 2 Flaschen Wasser (für alle 4). Auch hierbei kommt Dein Name an unsere Wand. Du darfst gern vor Eröffnung bei uns vorbei schauen und Dir den schönsten Platz für Deinen Namen aussuchen und selbst auf der Wand unterschreiben. Auch die Umarmung ist hier Bestandteil des Perks.

Ich danke Dir vielmals für Deine Unterstützung. 

_________________________________________________

English Version (it´s not the best quality but i hope you understand :-):

Hello *.

I am Marén, 33 years young and I´m living in Neuss near Duesseldorf.

                                         

17 years Ago I went away from my home's Weißwasser(Oberlausitz) to learn a profession and to get to know the world.

                                

If one me then in demand, has, I always said what I want to make
later once: "I would like to have once a small restaurant with a small room
rental above about that." Therefore I departed to set the foundation stone for
that. I made an education the hotel business and was used then according
to Neuss.

Unfortunately, no possibility resulted here for me, to keep on
tracing my dream and I made a further education the computer business. I
had a boss who always said to me that one in a hard way must work to reach its
goals. The 11 years with him were very hard. I had enviers, patron,
supporter. In the last two years it was to submit I very often shortly before my
cancellation and simply to work. I simply only want to got home. To my family. It had
expanded in the years so, that I could be only 2 time in the year near my family
and the departure-taking falls each time more heavily. To see that I miss many
things, that I do not realize many things at all and that I can be only by
telephone in hard times with them lets to me often frustrated in the edge
sit.

Christmas, in December 2012, my family and I sat together and
speak about God and the world. Sometime we came on the topic: "What became
from our dreams". We landed quickly near the Small restaurant with small room
rental above about that and we began to consider where one could convert this
project in Weißwasser. I landed on an undeveloped ground and began too "are
daft". I painted on big end nodes as I imagine my restaurant. With a big glass
front, so that one can see what is rid. With sufficient parking spaces, so that
one can make be the car once also gladly if nevertheless it becomes longer. With
a Terasse outside, so that one can enjoy the coffee
in the summer at the fresh air and with a lot green around, so that the nature invites to the relaxation.
Unfortunately, it turned out quickly that such a new development is not to be
financed. Therefore I went with brokers and in the Internet onto the search for
suitable, vacant real estate. Even with the mayor I asked whether there are
buildings which come into consideration for that. Simultaneously I searched
myself directly on site for a management consultant who supports me on site
since I am most time in Neuss.

My consultant was directly inspired by my idea and my already
existing business plan and promised me its fullest support. We found a
restaurant (directly at the marketplace) which has the big glass front. Which
one has the possibility for a small beer garden, where are sufficient parking
spaces directly next door and for the coronation a lot is also still green
around for that. It is the business plan, also with the landlord is clarified
everything, with a brewing I already had appointments to discuss everything. The 
craftsman made a fabulous offer to get atmosphere into the real estate again. I have  2 students with me and they´re supoorting me with the Corporate Design and the interior fitting. Now we are planning already so far after a little more than one year that a bank confirmed their support. However, banks are with gastronomy-projects very hesitant. I can take up a loan in the large part of the money. However, unfortunately my dream fails because of 15.000 Euros which I can simply not deposit myself. For this money the guest room is prepared new and the bar newly and in a modern way based.
On the Screen it becomes clear how that is urgently necessarily.

A mix becomes from steak house and event gastronomy. Old and
young should have a location for feeling well. The
only youth club of the city was closed. I would like that adolescents
must have a starting item again and sit not on the street. Ideas for that would
be own Teenie-afternoons. It gives to pupil bands which ones with these afternoons can occur and become thus better known. On Fridays is weekly market on the marketplace lying in addition to that. One can meet after the purchasing onto a cup godforsaken place or a lunch.

At noon there are special offers, which switch daily so that it remains always interesting. And that to favorable prices. At the evening the offer is leaned against the American kitchen. Steaks, Burger, Spare rips and similar may not be missing.

And at weekends there are always switching offers, such as: Partys, thriller dinners,
lectures, Poetry-Slam, also once a bingo afternoon and so on.
There are no limits for ideas.

I would like to be a starting item where They All feel well, get gladly and remain also gladly once longer.

And exactly at the position it´s you turn :-)

Please help me, that I can live my dream and in fact at the page and with the
support of my family. Make my campaign known. Share this with friends, acquaintances.

Of course you are not supposed to go out in this case emptily. I forward you Perks following gladly for the selection:

1. A big thank you. For 10,00 euros comes her at the thanking-wall in the restaurant.
There all supporters are specified in particular. And if you manage to come also
personally past, there is above on that a big hug of me: -)

2. Custom beverage. For 25,00 euros you get a glass of your Favorite Beverage and as a matter of course also the big hug for your first sales call. And also your
name accesses our wall.

3. A time dinner table: for 50,00 euros you get a court of the dinner table and a glass of your Favorite Beverage. And of course your name onto the wall and don´t forget the big hug.

 4. You get 10 % of discount onto our food for 100,00 euros for your first sales call (at the most 4 person). And of course your name onto the wall  and don´t forget the big hug.

5. For 150,00 euros you work to our cook and create your own Burger (It has to be eatable) which is specified for a week under your Name on our card. Additionally you receive 10 % of discount onto our food during your  first sales call (at the most 1 person). And of course also your name onto the wall and  don´t forget the big hug.

6. For 200,00 euros you may create an own Cocktail (it has to be drinkable), that then is a week long "Coktail of the week" . Also you keep 15 % of discount onto our
food during your first sales call (at the most 2 persons). And of course also your name onto the wall and also the big hug.

7. For 500,00 euros you come tu us with a person of your
choice (it includes: 2 main courses after choice, 1 bottle
of suitable wine, 1 bottle of water). And also here your Name accesses the wall
and also the big hug.

8. For 1.000,00 euros you to us with 3 person of you choice and spend an evening of your choice with us (log on of course before so that we can prepare everything). It includes a main course after choice (per person), 2 suitable bottles of wine and 2 bottles of water (for all together). Also with that your Name accesses our wall. You may look gladly before opening with us past and you select the most beautiful space for your Name and even on the wall sign. Also the big hug is element of the Perks here.

I thank you many times for your Support.

Auch hierbei kommt Dein Name an unsere Wand. Du darfst gern vor Eröffnung bei uns vorbei schauen und Dir den schönsten Platz für Deinen Namen aussuchen und selbst auf der Wand unterschreiben. Auch die Umarmung ist hier Bestandteil des Perks.Ich danke Dir vielmals für Deine Unterstützung. _________________________________________________English Version (it´s not the best quality but i hope you understand :-): Hello *.I am Marén, 33 years young and I´m living in Neuss near Duesseldorf.                                           17 years Ago I went away from my home's Weißwasser(Oberlausitz) to learn a profession and to get to know the world.                                 If one me then in demand, has, I always said what I want to make later once: "I would like to have once a small restaurant with a small room rental above about that." Therefore I departed to set the foundation stone for that. I made an education the hotel business and was used then according to Neuss.Unfortunately, no possibility resulted here for me, to keep on tracing my dream and I made a further education the computer business. I had a boss who always said to me that one in a hard way must work to reach its goals. The 11 years with him were very hard. I had enviers, patron, supporter. In the last two years it was to submit I very often shortly before my cancellation and simply to work. I simply only want to got home. To my family. It had expanded in the years so, that I could be only 2 time in the year near my family and the departure-taking falls each time more heavily. To see that I miss many things, that I do not realize many things at all and that I can be only by telephone in hard times with them lets to me often frustrated in the edge sit.Christmas, in December 2012, my family and I sat together and speak about God and the world. Sometime we came on the topic: "What became from our dreams". We landed quickly near the Small restaurant with small room rental above about that and we began to consider where one could convert this project in Weißwasser. I landed on an undeveloped ground and began too "are daft". I painted on big end nodes as I imagine my restaurant. With a big glass front, so that one can see what is rid. With sufficient parking spaces, so that one can make be the car once also gladly if nevertheless it becomes longer. With a Terasse outside, so that one can enjoy the coffee in the summer at the fresh air and with a lot green around, so that the nature invites to the relaxation. Unfortunately, it turned out quickly that such a new development is not to be financed. Therefore I went with brokers and in the Internet onto the search for suitable, vacant real estate. Even with the mayor I asked whether there are buildings which come into consideration for that. Simultaneously I searched myself directly on site for a management consultant who supports me on site since I am most time in Neuss.My consultant was directly inspired by my idea and my already existing business plan and promised me its fullest support. We found a restaurant (directly at the marketplace) which has the big glass front. Which one has the possibility for a small beer garden, where are sufficient parking spaces directly next door and for the coronation a lot is also still green around for that. It is the business plan, also with the landlord is clarified everything, with a brewing I already had appointments to discuss everything. The craftsman made a fabulous offer to get atmosphere into the real estate again. I have  2 students with me and they´re supoorting me with the Corporate Design and the interior fitting. Now we are planning already so far after a little more than one year that a bank confirmed their support. However, banks are with gastronomy-projects very hesitant. I can take up a loan in the large part of the money. However, unfortunately my dream fails because of 15.000 Euros which I can simply not deposit myself. For this money the guest room is prepared new and the bar newly and in a modern way based. On the Screen it becomes clear how that is urgently necessarily.A mix becomes from steak house and event gastronomy. Old and young should have a location for feeling well. The only youth club of the city was closed. I would like that adolescents must have a starting item again and sit not on the street. Ideas for that would be own Teenie-afternoons. It gives to pupil bands which ones with these afternoons can occur and become thus better known. On Fridays is weekly market on the marketplace lying in addition to that. And that to favorable prices. At the evening the offer is leaned against the American kitchen. Steaks, Burger, Spare rips and similar may not be missing. And at weekends there are always switching offers, such as: Partys, thriller dinners, lectures, Poetry-Slam, also once a bingo afternoon and so on.There are no limits for ideas. I would like to be a starting item where They All feel well, get gladly and remain also gladly once longer. And exactly at the position it´s you turn :-)Please help me, that I can live my dream and in fact at the page and with the support of my family. Make my campaign known. Share this with friends, acquaintances. Of course you are not supposed to go out in this case emptily. I forward you Perks following gladly for the selection: 1. A big thank you. For 10,00 euros comes her at the thanking-wall in the restaurant. There all supporters are specified in particular. And if you manage to come also personally past, there is above on that a big hug of me: -) 2. Custom beverage. For 25,00 euros you get a glass of your Favorite Beverage and as a matter of course also the big hug for your first sales call. And also your name accesses our wall. 3. For 200,00 euros you may create an own Cocktail (it has to be drinkable), that then is a week long "Coktail of the week" . Also you keep 15 % of discount onto our food during your first sales call (at the most 2 persons). And of course also your name onto the wall and also the big hug.7. story:
Please help me set up the new clinic!

I have been providing classical Chinese medicine services to Fairfax and surrounding areas for 4 years. I do my best to accommodate patients regardless of their ability to pay, and have offered numerous deep discounts or free treatment to our community.

After a sharp rent increase last june, i lost my clinic. I am happy to say that i have finally secured a new location! But, acquiring it has sucked my finances dry and although i have saved up for this i do not quite have enough... i need help to get up and running!

Specifically, i need help funding the move and some of the construction that is needed to get the clinic open ASAP!

If you or someone you know has benefited from my services, or you are just passionate about classical and natural medicine being widely available, please consider helping!

Your money will go to:

- pay for a moving truck and movers

- pay for shelving for the herbal pharmacy (organic and pesticide free Chinese herbs!)

- pay for the construction of partitions to create treatment rooms in the clinic

Thanks to your help, i will be able to return to helping patients (some paying, some non-paying) as soon as possible!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are handy in any way, i may need your help...!

story:
We are preparing to launch a new product unlike anything that is out there right now. It is an ONION based salsa that is a little sweet, and a little spicy. We have been selling it locally for a few months and are presently in production with a bottling plant.

Our customers have been using our salsa for chips, hot dogs, brats, marinades, and sauces. It's incredibly vesitile and has the potential for crossover to other area's other than salsa.  We have gone through the process of getting the salsa ready for production at a co-packing bottling plant in Kansas City.  We are finished with the label design and most of the licensing.  We are looking for funding to bring this product to its full potential. 

My wife and I have started Lynn Rich Foods.  We still sell our handmade gourmet pickles and wish to continue doing this along with getting our great salsa on store shelves.  Please feel free to visit our pickle website at www.grandmaeleanorspickles.com . 

We have gone through all the cost analysis, gross and net margins, and even have talked to a few national food brokers and grocery chains about our salsa.  It's only a matter of time before it's a big hit.  Please help us get this great product out there.

story:
• Are you a parent, educator or volunteer who works with children and young adults?
  • Are you concerned about seeing great kids and young adults struggling more with school or life?
  • Would you like to find a place where people are focused on working together to find small, do-able solutions that will have MASSIVE impact for our own life/work well-being as well as for our kids?

Nurturing Brilliance Project Summary

Welcome to Nurturing Brilliance!
We are:
  • Marilyn Foreman - an early childhood educator and parenting coach; and
  • Beth Campbell Duke - a former high school teacher and now the Career Tutor at PersonalBrand.Academy. 
When we got talking about the struggles we see most often in our students and clients, a distinct theme started to emerge. We were seeing people struggling with the same core issues over the course of their lives. Together we work with
Children |Teens |Youth |Parents |Adult Job Hunters |Teachers

All of these people are feeling the increasing pressures of our everyday lives, and all struggling to identify the problem. The majority are also feeling like the problem is so big that there's nothing really they can do to alleviate it.

And by far the biggest issue facing us as a group is a feeling of  disconnection from a positive, supportive community.

In the busy-ness of life, we've lost each other.  That's when the light-bulb came on - and Nurturing Brilliance was born.

The Vision

We are creating a movement - and we need your help... and not just your financial help!

Nurturing Brilliance is a community that connects parents, educators and volunteers who want to help children and youth make the most of school and life.

We are beginning by providing a forum for 'Conversations that Matter' - conversations that help US as a community identify small actions that individuals, families, classrooms and communities can take that will lead to BIG change.

'Conversations that Matter' are starting up in a number of fora - on our blog, Google Hangouts and our podcast. We invite you to participate online.

We're also geared up and ready to deliver 'Conversations That Matter' in person to groups of parents, educators and others who volunteer with children and young adults.

What We Need

This Indiegogo campaign is asking for $20 000. We will use this money to fund a variety of aspects of the Nurturing Brilliance community:

  • Marilyn has a book project in the final stages that needs funding to complete the editing, publishing and marketing. Financial contributors to this project will receive a copy of the first Nurturing Brilliance book.
  • We want to make 'Conversations That Matter' available to as many groups as possible. Money from this project will be used to help parent and educator groups cover the cost of travel and recording of our Conversations. The more money we raise, the more Conversations we can hold.
  • The outcomes from 'Conversations That Matter' need to be analysed and communicated to the growing community so that we can start to take action and report on the successes we are seeing.
  • And with any project, there are always technical costs. The Nurturing Brilliance website will require more resources as the community grows. There is already a significant amount of work with the little we're already doing on the blog, Google hangouts, social media and podcasting.

The Outcomes

  • We'd love to start to see positive changes happening on a wide scale for kids, youth and adults as a result of Nurturing Brilliance.
  • As the community grows, we'd love to see the conversations continue on social media and our podcast.
  • We envision sharing success stories in the future as a way to empower ourselves and support positive changes in our homes and schools.

How Can You Help?

Obviously - we're here on Indiegogo asking for financial support.

  • Please donate to our campaign.
  • Learn more about Nurturing Brilliance and other ways you can become involved at NurturingBrilliance.net.

Thank you for your support!

story:
The End to an Amazing Journey

As I conclude my journey overseas, I'm so happy to say that I will be contributing to a worthwhile cause. I will be traveling to Fez, Morocco to work with the local community on improving the economy through promoted tourism. I will be writing for "The View from Fez", a reputable blog run by an Australian couple. I will be covering the Fez World Music Festival forums held in the morning. This will give me the opportunity to write on meaningful discussions such as the Arab Spring and financial crises around the world as well as inform readers that the festival is not just about sharing music culture but also ideas on the world we live in today. The link is available here for the blog - http://riadzany.blogspot.fr/

How You Can Help

The funding needed for the trip is extraneous to the loans I am eligibal for in Paris therefore I am humbly asking for your help and support. I will be needing 600 euros to finance my time in Fez which will include the following:

  • Housing
  • Food
  • Transportation
  • Internet access
  • Phone access

Please feel free to contact me privately should you want additional information.

story:
So so so... this is what I need...


For years now I have been teaching my sewing classes in my living room. Cosy, comfortable, relaxed, and it puts people at ease. But, and this is a big but, it is a small living room.

 

So I can only teach 3 people at a time, and even then it is a constant "can I just get past you", " can you move a little so I can get to the cupboard" whilst I am teachig, and all not having family dinners at the table ever and using the ever present ironing board as an extra table, my 5 year old playing with the sewing machines as they are all over our space (I have about 12). Also I have cats. Some peopel don't liek them and they make some people sneeze. They sleep on my fabric. It would really help if I coud offer a space without cat hair.


So I need to move. I need to also stay close to the home. I have 6 cats, 3 kids, and I love working from home. I don't want to commute. I just need more space. I have lots of space in my garden. Lots.

 

So I can build a studio in my garden. One that can hold all my sewing machines, my fabric, my iron, my books, my patterns, my rulers. One than can comfortably hold 6 or 7 students (and an ironing board). This will give me back our living room (we miss it badly).

 

So I have looked into costs. I don't need anything fancy. Not a home office. Just a grand dry shed really. I can decorate, insulate, and carry stuff. I cannot build, lay foundations or put in electrics. For that I need help. And money.

 

So with a little help from you I can start reclaiming my living space and start teaching in a dedicated space. It will make a huge difference not just to my business but also to my family. We haven't eaten at a table for almost three years...

So I need specifically:
about £1500 for a shed
about £600 for electrics to go out to the shed
about £200 for furniture (tables, chairs, shelving)
about £100 for lighting both inside the shed and along the path to the garden
About £100 for the insulation
about £500 to pay someone to build the shed for me
 
If I don't make the full amount I will still build the studio. It will just take me a lot longer, and I was really hoping to get it done this summer. But any help is good. It is not just about money. You can do electrics and want to help? Great. You can help me take down the old shed? Fab. You are able and happy to lay foundations. I will love you for ever.
 

What's in it for you


so what is in it for you? Other than good karma? Well, lots.

If you can donate £25 I will make you a funky bespoke mini quilt/ potholder/ mug rug

If you can donate £100 I wil enroll you for two free classes of your choosing

If you can donate £150 I will make you a unique 45x60" quilt

If you can donate £250 I will make you a personalized double bed quilt

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not all of you can contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Help the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

A browser addon that allows online shoppers to find discount codes directly from the retailers checkout page.

Typically, online shoppers will purchase goods from an ecommerce store and reach the checkout page, then trawl Google for valid discount codes for that store. We are devloping a browser addon which will automatically present valid discount codes to the shopper on the checkout page, saving the shopper the time of searching thousands of expired codes on Google.

What We Need & What You Get

We need the funds to be able to continue development to launch the product. All releases will be available to Indiegogo supporters before general public release.

 

About me: http://about.me/themeade

story:
My Golden Birthday is right around the corner and many of you have asked me how to help make this one special.... Enter this campaign!

"At 30 you finally start to catch up to those dreams you’ve been chasing for the last 10 plus years."
~Bonnidette Lantz

Like most people I had some pretty firm ideas of where I was going to be once I got around to the ripe ol' age of thirty. The usual stuff... marriage, house, kids, etc etc. My twenties had some very different ideas in mind and am I glad they did.

Last May, as I blew out 29 sparkling candles, it hit me that this would be my last year in my twenties... I better make it good! Apparently 'making it good' meant a lot of really big changes. This last year has been a major growing experience and I've gained a lot of clarity and serenity around where my life is headed.

 I set 2 goals for myself before I reach the big 3-0 and I'm almost there...

Goal #1- Complete all exams and requirements to obtain my massage license.
  Needed: To pass the last practical board exam and pay for my license

Goal #2- Register and train for a Spartan Race later this summer.
  Needed: Training underway, just need to register
P.S. If you haven't heard of the Spartan Race, I highly recommend checking it out! www.spartanrace.com 

As I look around my life, I'm eternally grateful for the people in it and all the love and support you all have shown me. Help me reach my goals and start my thirties out on a great note! And then come to Portland, do the Spartan Race with me and then I'll give you a massage! :)

Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Much, much love and gratitude,
xoxo
Dana

Last May, as I blew out 29 sparkling candles, it hit me that this would be my last year in my twenties... I better make it good! Apparently 'making it good' meant a lot of really big changes. This last year has been a major growing experience and I've gained a lot of clarity and serenity around where my life is headed.
 I set 2 goals for myself before I reach the big 3-0 and I'm almost there...
Goal #1- Complete all exams and requirements to obtain my massage license.  Needed: To pass the last practical board exam and pay for my license
Goal #2- Register and train for a Spartan Race later this summer.  Needed: Training underway, just need to registerP.S. If you haven't heard of the Spartan Race, I highly recommend checking it out! www.spartanrace.com 
As I look around my life, I'm eternally grateful for the people in it and all the love and support you all have shown me. Help me reach my goals and start my thirties out on a great note! And then come to Portland, do the Spartan Race with me and then I'll give you a massage! :)
Thank you, thank you, thank you! Much, much love and gratitude,xoxoDana

story:
2020 A Year Without War is a program within the Department of Philosophy at Santa Barbara City College. Donations supporting 2020 AYWW are directed through the Foundation for Santa Barbara City College, a verified non-profit.

2020 A Year Without War (2020 AYWW) is a global community working towards one goal:  One year (2020) without war. 2020 will be a global cease fire, truce, or step down for just one year to rethink how we handle conflict in the 21st century and to reassess the costs of war on people, environments, economics, education, infrastructure, travel, food, animals, and families.

 For our children, do we choose a world with war or without war?



For the past 30 months, 2020 AYWW has been moving forward with volunteers, pro bono support, small donations, and student interns. Now it is time to push this organization to the next level with sustainable global technology and a professional staff. Organizing student interns and volunteers to accomplish strategic goals, following up with the many international organizations that want to partner, arranging for thought provoking presentations, keeping up with social media, cultivating and thanking donors, and handling the myriad operations are the tasks that need full-time attention now.

Professor Joe White, Chair of the Department of Philosophy Santa Barbara City College (SBCC), has been the visionary leader volunteering for 2020 A Year Without War. His blogs (ayearwithoutwar.org) demonstrate not only his ability to articulate the hard and sensitive issues of war but a deep passion for mentoring and empowering youth to embrace their future as leaders who will change this world.


No Child Chooses War





How much is one year without war worth to you? To the economy? To the planet? How priceless is it to be a part of something unprecedented and yet so attainable. Help 2020 AYWW push to the NEXT LEVEL!!!

2020 A Year Without War is asking for your tax-deductible contributions - our goal is to raise $111,000 for three positions in Technology and Leadership including:

1) Technology Support

2) Chief Operating Officer

3) Assistant Executive Director

The above positions will be contractual with no benefits, but it is a beginning that will lead to a positive future. Executive Director, Professor Joe White, will remain a volunteer.

Be generous. Be involved.

story:
South Florida Tax Clinic is keeping children out of poverty and helping the economy grow.

The Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) is a benefit for working people who have low to moderate income. A tax credit means more money in your pocket. The EITC is designed to encourage and reward work. A worker’s EITC grows with each additional dollar of earnings until reaching the maximum value. This creates an incentive for people to leave welfare for work and for low-wage workers to increase their work hours. In 2012, the EITC lifted about 6.5 million people out of poverty, including about 3.3 million children. Moving out of poverty is particularly important for young children. Research has found that lifting low-income families’ income when a child is young not only tends to improve a child’s immediate well-being, but is associated with better health, more schooling, more hours worked, and higher earnings in adulthood. Yet, many low income families are unaware of this credit and leave it unclaimed. The IRS estimates that for 2010 there were $760 million left unclaimed. Helping qualified people with the tools to claim this credit not only helps that family but the economy as a whole because these families will be getting disposable income to spend and by spending it they create demand, which will in turn generate supply, and thus generate new jobs.

story:
Your Donation = Their Future

Think of where you would be if somebody didn't reach out to help you. To give you that extra attention. To show you the possibilities of the world. It could have been a teacher, a coach, a friend. Through your donation, you can be that person for a child today.

To many, the world of aviation is magical - and unobtainable. With your help, I want to change that for young teens. Together, we can take neglected kids who are wasting their lives in front of the television and show them that they are more than a TV remote.

Think of being able to say to your friends that you helped take a teen and move them from a potential troubled future to one of being tomorrow's leader. These are kids just like your sons or daughters, but kids who might not get all the opportunities that you can provide to your family.

Now you can help. Through your donation, together we can get kids off the couch and into the cockpit where they can learn the potential that they have.

Please take the time to donate now. Even just the $1 donation can help. 

Help Spread the Word!

I know that the economy is difficult and that money is tight. If you can't help through a donation, you can still help. Please use the social tools above to share our campaign with others. Thank you in advance for your help!

story:
Short Summary

My name is AshEl "Seasunz" Eldridge. As a green jobs and food justice organizer, a hip-hop performer and climate educator in high schools, and a witness to my grandmother passing away from diabetes when I was just an young boy, I know food and nutrition are a nexus point connecting climate change, food security, obesity, hunger, and poverty. Food can lead to economic development, particularly in communities of color, and healing in a world increasingly inundated with chemicals, nutritionally deficient food products, and environmental degradation.

SOS Juice, is a solar-powered for-profit/non-profit hybrid that will sell juice, smoothies, and compost in order to improve health, promote sustainable agriculture, and create green jobs for low-income youth and the formerly incarcerated individuals.

To launch our business we need your help. We will pilot our idea in Oakland, Ca to prove the benefits of the model and out potential to grow nationwide. Our Goal is to set up the first official SOS Juice Booth this spring but we need support form like minded people like you to raise about 10K to make it happen.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We will need $10,000 total. This includes:

Commercial Grade Juicer $2600

Commercial Grade Blender $500

Commercial Wheat Grass Press $500 

Commercial Citris Press: $80

Moble Solar Unit: $1500

Vendor Tent: $500

Tables: $250

Coolers (one 100 & one 200-Quart) $500

Youth Stipends $ 2570

Permits & Liscences $1000

 

Perks include:

Juicy Love: Thanks on our newsletter, SosJuice.com, Twitter, and Facebook

Personal Invite to our first SOS juice spot in Oakland! Dinner and Juice with the founder in the SF Bay Area! 

First to get a Free download of our SOS Juice Mixtape featuring Songs from Dead Prez, Earth Amplified, Illuminati Congo, DJ Cavem, and more!

SOS juice t-shirt

We name a juice after you for first month of business

Join SoS founder 4 Smoothies and screening of Earth Amplified's Global WarNing and Food Fight @ SF Green Film Festival!

 

if we don’t reach our entire goal, funds will go to seed the full fruition of this project.

 

 

The Impact

As I mentioned earlier, I know food and nutrition are a nexus point connecting climate change, food security, obesity, hunger, and poverty. Food can lead to economic development, particularly in communities of color, and healing in a world increasingly inundated with chemicals, nutritionally deficient food products, and environmental degradation. SoS Juice can change this.

SOS Juice, in which the SOS stands for 'System out of our System', is a monthly food justice and health equity event inspired by Occupy, the Black Panthers free breakfast program, and Indigenous Wisdom and sacred ceremony.

These events have been powerful and have featured acclaimed artist and national speakers. However, I saw that in order for a deeper healing and transformation to happen, SoS Juice had to become a bigger ongoing business model that could provide jobs AND access to a healthier lifestyle. 

These realizations prompted us to go into business. Sos juice is for everyone with a stomach. Customers will not only improve their own health, getting a good dose of their daily requirements of fruit and veggies in a cup, but also improve the health of communities impacted by poverty and the lack of access to healthy food and education by buying juice and smoothies via farmers markets and food trucks.

SOS juice will also support the waste reduction of existing food businesses, by participating in both the creation and networking of existing commercial kitchens focused on food recovery, food processing and distribution.

 

Just can’t contribute right now, but still want to help? 

Please get the work out via email, facebook, twitter, etc and make some noise about this solutionary campaign. 

You can easily use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Version Française >>>

Campaign Update

 

Thanks to a wonderful collective effort we reached and exceeded our goals for both phase I and phase II of our Alter Ego crowd funding campaign on Indiegogo.com and we successfully raised nearly $90 000 to make this project a reality! And thanks to your enthusiasm in supporting the Alter Ego project's genesis, more than 600 people who will have access to safe drinking water for life!

This means that we are on the way to produce and market the Alter Ego duo to help hundreds and even thousands of people to get access to clean water in Guatemala and around the world!

This campaign is over but you can pre-order now on our Online Store to ensure that you are among the first on the planet to get your Alter Ego. This way we will be able to help even more people get access to clean water! Your purchase makes a difference.

Expected Shipping Date: Early June 2013

All inquiries should be sent to alterego@aquaovo.com

 

Alter Ego Phase II: Help us make it available to even more people

The Alter Ego project is moving forward and we are presently fine tuning the design and readying for the launch of the mould production. Thanks to your awesome contributions, the first phase of this campaign has allowed us to raise enough money to pay for the moulds and honor the perks that were bought.

And now we ask for your help to raise a little more money so that we can order more products and get the word out there to make this project a commercial success.  The more capital we raise to maximize distribution channels, the greater the chance of establishing a lasting brand.  Our goal is to provide a steady long term stream of income to our water charities.

This second phase is also a great opportunity to get the Alter Ego duo at very good pre-launch prices. 

Alter Ego Phase I : Checked!

We reached and exceeded the $45,000 base goal days before the end of the first phase of this campaign thanks to YOU ! Even better, we reached our $60,000 Stretch Goal with 15 hours to go before the end and we crossed the finish line at $65,602 with 652 funders backing our project !!

This means that we will be able to produce the Alter Ego duo and help hundreds and even thousands of people to get access to clean water in Guatemala and around the world!

THANK YOU !!!

 

Press Coverage

                 

"This portable water filter from Aquaovo is a fantastic alternative to buying bottled water." Read More

"Alter Ego is designed by the award winning Aquaovo team known for their stunning aesthetics, sustainable design and superior functionality in water filtration."

 

"(...) a personal hydration tower (bottle) "composed of the streamlined, BPA-free Alter tower and the EGO drinking-straw filtration unit"."

"Canadian examples include, Alter Ego, a personal water filtration system;(...)"

"(...) an innovative water filtration and hydration duo that can be used anywhere."

           

Satisfy your thirst for water and equity

What if we were to tell you that you can get the most stylish and efficient state of the art personal water filtration duo and give a family of five water for life at the same time?

Well that's exactly what Alter Ego is about: A highly functional piece of design that empowers you to create change in the world by helping reduce the inequity of clean water access.

How: The Alter Ego duo is tied to raising funds for inspiring water charities that are committed to bring fresh and clean water to the millions still in need around the world.

Good water for you AND for your alter ego

The Alter Ego duo is a high end designer product with much more than materialistic value. Drink good water with style for you and your family and make a life saving difference for your alter ego in a developing country!

 The Alter Ego duo

How it works

Each Alter Ego duo is tied to raising funds for inspiring, impactful water charities that are committed to bringing fresh and clean water to the millions still in need around the world.

For each Alter Ego duo you purchase, a water charity will bring fresh and clean water to someone in need. The more you purchase, the more you become part of the change. It's as simple as that!

We are currently finalizing partnerships with charity: water , and ecofiltro:one amongst others.

Ecofiltro: one is a 501(c)(3) public charity who delivers filters to rural communities in a sustained manner that creates clean water for life.

They reach rural communities by partnering with local community leadership, educating them about the importance of clean drinking water. Whether they get water from a natural spring, rain run-off, or contaminated well, the goal is to help villagers understand the health benefits of filtered water. They know the only way to do this sustainably is to organize communities to take control of their own health the same way affluent nations do.

 

Alter Ego and ecofiltro: one

When you buy an Alter Ego duo, funds will be given to ecofiltro:one. These funds will be used to give ecofilters to Guatemalan villagers in need of clean water.  This financial help will allow Guatemalans to implement a controllable, sustainable program to get replacement filters for the rest of their lives. For every 3 Alter Ego duos you purchase, 1 Guatemalan will get fresh, clean water for life. Act now!

Ecofiltro: one's Executive Director Samuel Snyder tells you how big a difference you make when you buy Alter Ego: http://player.vimeo.com/video/54563967

The amazing production process of an ecofiltro: http://player.vimeo.com/video/54067569

Samuel Snyder on how ecofiltro: one changes the cycle: http://vimeo.com/50702693

We've been dreaming of it...

 

We're the team behind the AQUAOVO experience who brought you the OVOPUR eco-design water filter and from the start, we've been dreaming of a stylish and equitable mass market solution that would be more portable than the OVOPUR.

 

The team: Stéphanie, Noémie, Vince, Isabelle, Fred and Manuel.

 

We listened to what you had to say and we worked very hard to bring you what we've all been waiting for: a portable, personal, intelligent water bottle with an outstanding design and first class water filtration technology!

And since we know that you care so much about the world around you, we designed this new product to help people in developing countries get access to clean water. Alter Ego’s purpose is to help reduce the inequity of clean water access in the world. Right from the start, we want every sale of an Alter Ego Duo to help someone less fortunate to gain access to clean water.

 

Team meeting around the Alter Ego prototype and drawings.

Alter Ego satisfies your thirst for water

Alter Ego is a personal water filtration and hydration duo made of two components: Alter, the bottle and Ego, the water filter assembly. It was designed to accommodate the urban traveller and the outdoor enthusiast on a day expedition, as well as the humanitarian worker in a developing country, for which access to clean water is a matter of survival.

The Alter Ego duo is your perfect hydration companion,reminding you to drink water daily and taking away the excuse of not drinking enough water:  The powerful filtration technology allows for the treatment of any questionable source of fresh water; from a chlorinated water source in the city to a dirty river in a foreign country.

The Alter Ego duo is also a must have in case of natural disaster. When the power goes off and the water supply becomes unsafe, your Alter Ego duo guarantees you a reliable and steady personal water supply. 

 

The Alter Ego prototype with packaging concept.

 

Made of safe and tough, BPA-free, Eastman Tritan copolymer, the Alter bottle is a premium choice in terms of personal hydration. Its seamless V-shaped trigon design allows for a grip that fits all hand sizes.  The unique shape will fit most cup holders and it prevents the bottle from rolling away! Designed to open on both ends, Alter is easy to wash and its wide mouth opening allows the use of ice cubes. It’s the perfect way to enjoy clean and fresh water with no metallic aftertaste. It can be purchased and used with or without the Ego water filter assembly.

Capacity: 700 ml – 24 oz

 

Top view of the Alter bottle's unique shape.

 

The Ego water filter assembly combines beautiful design, top-quality components, and state-of-the-art water filtration technology. Primarily designed to perfectly fit the Alter bottle, it can also be used separately, as the silicone spout adapter has been designed to fit most of the wide mouth bottle brands available on the market.

Equipped with EPA-approved filtration technology made in the USA by Revolve, our filter cartridge is designed to filter out contaminants up to six logs (99.9999%) and renders clean water that is free of chemical and organic contaminants, as well as viruses, bacteria and cysts. This means you can instantly drink water worry-free from nearly any fresh water body in the world. The filter cartridge is available in three different models: Tap, Outdoor (99.99%) and Advanced Outdoor (99.9999%). The filtration capacity varies upon the model. Tap: up to 200 gallons (750 liters) Outdoor: up to 200 gallons (750 liters) Advanced: up to 75 gallons (285 liters).

Here's a short video from our friends at Revolve: http://youtu.be/9vkrkX3rnEg

 

The Ego water filter assembly will fit most wide mouthed bottles on the market, including the Alter bottle.

 
 

Head Designer and co-founder Manuel Desrochers drinks filtered water from the St-Lawrence River

 
 

The Alter Ego packaging concept

Initially developed by creative agency Circo De Bakuza, the Alter Ego packaging concept is a reflection of the water situation in the world today. The Alter bottle and the Ego water filter assembly are packaged individually but they depend on each other to achieve their end goal. The faces on the boxes represent both the people in areas of the world who have plenty of access to clean water and the people from areas of the world where having access to clean water is still a daily struggle. They need each other to be whole and functional. There will be 12 sets of faces on the triangular shaped box.  6 haves and 6 have nots. The 6 have nots each represent the one person in six who doesn't have access to clean water. The faces represent the whole human race gathered to solve the world water crisis when assembled in a complete circle of six boxes.

 
 
The Alter Ego packaging concept in display.

 

What are the $$ for?

EVERY ALTEREGO DUO PURCHASED = CLEAN WATER FOR SOMEONE IN NEED

The rest of the money raised here on Indiegogo wiil fund the tooling, the first production run & distribution so we can make sure you will get your Alter Ego on time for the hot season. Additional money will go towards marketing efforts to expand the Alter Ego movement.

Manufacturing - We know you want your Alter Ego duo as soon as possible. We are already working on the production cycle and we need the money to get this first run manufactured and shipped ASAP!

Distribution - Our mission is to empower consumers to change the world.  As such, we want to make Alter Ego available anytime, anywhere and for everybody. To do so, we want to extend our distribution channels through ecommerce plateforms such as Fab.com and retail outlets such as Macy's, Target, Costco, Eddie Bauer, Anthropologie etc. many of which we already have existing relationships. 

Marketing - YOU are the most inportant link between Alter Ego and the rest of the world.  In order to grow the movement and change the world faster, we need you to tell your friends/family and the easiest way to do that is through social media: POST ON FB, TWEET, SHARE THE VIDEO & PIN A PHOTO!  

Growth - This is only the beginning. As the Alter Ego movement growes, we want to increase our impact in the field.  This means releasing new versions of the Alter Ego, creating viral content, and continuing our mission to help bring clean water to every human beign on earth.

The Plan

We've already been working with our suppliers for months and we're ready to set off things in motion as soon as we reach our goal. The Eastman Tritan parts and the silicone parts will be made by our Chinese manufacturer and the filtration cartridges will be supplied by our US manufacturer. We expect to be able to deliver most of the rewards within four to five months after our project is funded. Here are our next steps:

  • Start tooling production and update funders
  • Validate the tooling with a production sample run and update funders
  • Confirm first production run and update funders
  • Finalize packaging and update funders
  • Obtain supplies & packaging and update funders
  • Generate fulfillment tickets & shipping labels and update funders
  • Ship rewards...  and update funders!

Perk Levels

 

 

FAQ

If my question isn't answered here, how do I ask?

Just email us - alterego@aquaovo.com

When will my Alter Ego be delivered?

Expected Shipping Date: 05.31.2013

We know you want receive your Alter Ego yesterday! We are working hard to get them manufactured and ready to ship as soon as possible. However, we will not send you anything but the highest quality product!

Is there a warranty for the Alter Ego duo?

Yes. There is a 1-year limited warranty against manufacturer defects. If you encounter a problem you believe is due to defect in workmanship or materials, please contact us immediately. Our repair center will fix it or replace it. However, we strive to provide the highest quality materials so this will not be an issue.

How long does the filtration cartridge last?

The life time of the cartridge varies upon the model. Tap: up to 200 gallons (750 liters) Outdoor: up to 200 gallons (750 liters) Advanced: up to 75 gallons (285 liters).

How much will the replacement filter cartridge cost?

We're still working out the details to offer you the best quality at the lowest price but we can already say that it will be around $25.00 CAD, depending on the model you choose.

How can I choose the cartridge model I want with my Alter Ego duo?

A survey will be sent to you prior to the shipment of your Perk. You will then be able to specify the type of filtration you want and confirm your shipping address.

Are the Alter Ego duos available in retail stores?

Not yet, only on Indiegogo for now!  Alter Ego will be in retail stores by mid 2013.  

Is there a charge for International Shipping?

UPDATE: We've managed to significantly lower shipping charges for International shipments! See below for the updated prices.

Yes, there will need to be an additional charge to ship internationally. It costs $20 more per Alter Ego to ship to international addresses.  If you buy the 3 Alter Ego duos ($180 perk), international shipping is $40 more. For larger quantities please contact us to get a quote.  Please include the shipping charge in the checkout price.  If you forget, we'll contact you prior to shipping to finalize those details.

If you have any specific questions about your location, please email us at alterego@aquaovo.com

THANK YOU!
