story:
Henhouses 

The goals for this project is to create economical self maintenance for the families who are located in Santa Lucia La Reforma, Totonicapán, Guatemala through the production of henhouses.

Outline

Our institution is part of the Society of Jesus, so one of our main characteristic is the deep desire to teach teenagers  to help and serve to the poor people like Jesus did it, since some years, we are working with our students to have an experience with the hard situation from our country. 

Every year the educational procedures are enriched with an experience of social service, for this, each student is prepared to help with their own hands to the families who live in this community where there is a lot of poverty, one of the poorest areas of Guatemala. 

In this year 2015 we are working in the town of Santa Lucia La Reforma, Totonicapán, Guatemala, this project started with the community necessity to get sources to help the families to have a better economic support.

What we need, what you get

For the henhouses’ construction in Santa Lucia La Reforma, we need to collect $5000.00, this money will be used to buy the material to build the henhouses, the hens, transportation and all the training process for the families because they have to learn how to build them. 

One of the main challenges for this project is the economical factor, because it is a project where we will help a lot of families, but it requires a big economical investment, in addition we need to invest in the people who will build the henhouses, Santa Lucia La Reforma  community has a very hard access and we don’t count with the enough resources and the right materials for this project, so everything must be built in the community.


Breve Reseña

Las instituciones de la Compañía de Jesús están caracterizadas por un profundo deseo de formar y educar jóvenes al servicio de los demás, al modo de Jesús. Desde hace unos años se busca que los estudiantes tengan un acercamiento significativo con la realidad difícil del país.

Cada año, los procesos educativos están enriquecidos con una experiencia de Servicio Social. En esta experiencia, cada estudiante se prepara para ayudar con sus propias manos en una necesidad de las personas que viven en realidades difíciles en el país.

En este año 2015 se está trabajando con la comunidad Santa Lucía La Reforma, municipio del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Este proyecto surge de la necesidad de esta comunidad por obtener medios que le ayuden a su sostenimiento económico-familiar.  

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Para la construcción de los gallineros en Santa Lucía La Reforma es necesario recaudar un total de $5,000.00. Esta cantidad económica será invertida en el material para la construcción de los gallineros, las gallinas, el transporte y todos los procesos de capacitación y seguimiento del proyecto para estas familias.

Desafíos

Uno de los principales desafíos que se presentan en el proyecto es el factor económico. Es un proyecto de mucha ayuda para las familias que lo necesitan, pero que requiere una gran inversión económica.

Además de la inversión económica, también es indispensable una inversión de personas que colaboren en la construcción directa de los gallineros.

La comunidad de Santa Lucía La Reforma es de difícil acceso y no se cuenta con los recursos y materiales adecuados para el proyecto. Todo debe ser llevado y ensamblado allá.

story:
About Blue-Med Africa

Blue-Med Africa is a Ghana-based non-profit organization launched in 2008 by a group of young, hardworking, and passionate nurses, doctors, and social workers. Our goal is to reduce mortality, especially among youth and women through prevention, education, treatment and advocacy. Blue-Med and it's volunteers currently help almost 4,000 people each year through medical outreach in deprived rural communities throughout Ghana. 


About Our Campaign 

In Ghana, most health care is provided by the government and administered by the Ministry of Health and Ghana Health Services. However, this health care is variable throughout the country. Urban centers are well-served, and contain most hospitals, clinics, and pharmacies in the country while rural areas often have little or no access to these services. Sixty-two percent of Ghanians live in rural communities. People in these areas remain under-served, or must travel great distances to receive medical attention. 

Malaria continues to be one of the most detrimental diseases in Ghana. It is estimated that malaria infects 200 million people yearly worldwide. Ninety percent of the mortality from the disease occurs in Africa, mostly among children under 5 years of age. Malaria kills an African child every 30 seconds. In Ghana, government statistics show that malaria is the leading cause of death in children under age five and among pregnant women it accounts for 9% of maternal deaths.

Our goal is to raise $5,000 for medicine and other supplies, particularly those pertaining to the treatment of malaria. With this money, we can provide treatment for 1,000 malaria patients. If we exceed our goal, we will be able to serve more community members suffering from malaria! 



    Why Donate to Blue-Med Africa?

    1. Blue-Med Africa is a grassroots non-profit organization and receives no government aid, relying solely on volunteers and donations. 

    2. Blue-Med has created strategic partnerships and serves over 600 underprivileged communities in Ghana.  With your help this number will continue to grow.

    3. You will be supporting the work of dozens of volunteers who travel to Ghana from around the world each year to work for Blue-Med. 

    4. In 2012 we successfully raised $5,554 to ship a van to Ghana enabling us to transport our volunteers to rural communities to deliver medical supplies and care.

    5. Blue-Med is a nondenominational organization focusing solely on the reduction of morbidity and mortality among Ghanians through education, advocacy, and cultivating self-supporting skills.


    Help us fight malaria in Ghana, one community at a time!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

We need $50,000 to start the development of our community center. The community center will be the hub of all activities that IAMBK will provide.

    The Impact

    We believe that Self Improvement is the bases of community development.  The mission of IAMBK is to develop and operate programs that substantially improve the quality of life for the residents of the City of San Diego regardless of creed, class or color. To that end, our programs include educational and supportive services such as student enrichment, computer lab, entrepreneurship training, mentoring, parenting classes, senior services, food and nutrition and educational housing opportunities. This agency operates several community based programs, including MEN (Men Engaging Neighborhoods), Silence The Violence Open Mic’s and Get Up and Go For Success. 

    Mentoring

    I Am My Brother’s Keeper has partnered with local elementary schools to offer school-based and community mentoring to children affected by incarceration and children with failing grades. Community members and students are reunited, screened, trained and matched with a youth for a one year duration.

    Tutoring

    Partnering with local college students we offer tutoring services to students at no cost. In addition, our center offers SAT and ACT preparation for high school students to prepare them for post-secondary education.

    Senior Services

    Our center offers a wide array of seniors services that include: internet basics, financial literacy, assisted living, wills and trusts, and independent living.

    IAMBK Green

    I Am My Brothers Keeper CDC and Trans World Solar have crafted their programs to meet the particular job training and support needs of San Diego residents,

    IAMBK Green provides a variety of wrap- around training and counseling services in
    their courses, which average about 14 weeks in length. For example, in addition to construction skills, IAMBK Green  provides basic math and reading skills, resume. Job searching skills, and basic computer skills. To give its participants a strong foundation in the green economy, IAMBK Green has added an environmental literacy component (the ROOTS of Success Environmental Literacy Curriculum developed by Dr. Raquel Pinderhughes) to its program.
      IAMBK's Charter School Coming FALL of 2015!!!

      Risks & Challenges

      We already have a huge community presence, but do not have adequate space to serve all the people in the community.  With the funds from this project we can start the development of our community center, which, once finished, will allow us to provide our services(from education to job training), to many in the San Diego area.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        We understand if you cannot contribute today, but we hope that you will spread the word about this great cause. It's as easy as using the Indiegogo share tools, sharing our link on Facebook or just simply telling a friend.

story:
For more than 100 years, Auburn Avenue  (Atlanta GA) has remained one of the most important fixtures in American and World History for its role in the Civil Rights Movement, African-American business innovation and more.

But today, this once flourishing area is listed as one of the country’s “Most Endangered Historic Places”by The National Trust for Historic Preservation. Much of this is due to a mass exodus of businesses, the lack of new economic investment, crime, and homelessness thus, leaving many of the commercial structures vacant and vulnerable to demolition and/or incompatible redevelopment.

Quite frankly, one of the biggest and most disheartening issues is that many of today's generation are disconnected to the global relevance and historic significance of Auburn Avenue.  

These circumstances sparked the need for our team to take immediate action through the creation of the Sweet Auburn EXperience (SAX).

SAX is a collaborative community effort to produce a series of over 25 incredible and engaging events that will take place during Black History Month (February 2014) on Auburn Avenue.  These events will focus on civil and human rights, business, education, technology, entertainment, sports, health, wellness and more - something for all ages and for the entire month!

With your support the Sweet Auburn Experience will consist of the following and more:

  • African American Health Summit
  • STEAM Power Learning Seminars (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Math)
  • Youth Entrepreneur/Business Workshops
  • School to Prison Pipeline Stops at SAX! (Panel)
  • Classic Performances at the World Famous Royal Peacock
  • Culture, Politics & Music...The Shaping of a New Generation (Panel/Seminar)
  • What You Didn’t Catch...Youth Sports Business Clinic (High School/College Students)
  • Justice for Our Girls...The Road to Stop Human Sex Trafficking
  • Healthy Cooking Stages
AND SO MUCH MORE!

*All Events are Subject to Change


The SAX goal is to reflect, respect, and revitalize this deeply distressed community by bringing awareness to its rich cultural heritage and finding solutions to current issues plaguing this historic district and the community-at-large.

WE CAN'T DO THIS ALONE...WE NEED YOU!!


WHAT WE NEED....

$100,000 for the following:

-Event Expenses (Venue Costs, Supplies, Special Guests and Talent, Event Production Rental, Décor, Insurance, etc.) = $60,000

-Marketing & Promotions (Media Blasts, Individual Event Outreach, Flyers, Posters, Banners, Graphic Design, Video Editing, etc.) = $6,000

-Staffing/Labor/Professional Facilitation/Student Stipends = $27,000

-Campaign Fees (Indiegogo, PayPal, Shipping, etc.) = $7,000



WHAT YOU GET....

We want YOU to be a part of the Sweet Auburn  Experience...so we've created some really cool perks in return for your help and support!  

Please check them out >>>>>

Also, if for some reason we miss our fundraising goal...we will simply re-organize to produce a smaller number of events (still dynamic) with a smaller staff, but the EXPERIENCE will remain HUGE!!



It's All About SAX Baby!


THE IMPACT....

The success of this campaign is an illustration of the same sense of community effort and pride that made Auburn "Sweet" decades ago allowing residents, businesses and patrons to flourish and make an impact all around the world.

You are now a product of that rich history...Auburn Avenue's history.  And now it's OUR TURN to help make a positive difference and do our part to SAVE HISTORIC AUBURN AVENUE!


Other Ways You Can Help . . .

If you're unable to contribute to the campaign financially, not to worry...it definitely does not mean you can't contribute!

Please help us SPREAD THE WORD.....Tweet, Post and Blog us to the WORLD through your personal and social media networks!!


                      

     


Indiegogo has all the tools you need!  PLEASE SHARE!

This community is a part of each and every one of us...let's work together to make the SAX a reality!

---------------

*Contributions are tax deductible through our fiscal agent, Black Bayou Cultural Heritage, a 501(c)(3) community organization.

worry...it definitely does not mean you can't contribute!

Please help us SPREAD THE WORD.....Tweet,
Post and Blog us to the WORLD through your personal and social media networks!!                           Indiegogo has all the tools you need!  PLEASE SHARE!

This community is a part of each and every one of us...let's work
together to make the SAX a reality!

---------------
*Contributions are tax deductible through our fiscal agent,
Black Bayou Cultural Heritage, a 501(c)(3) community organization.

story:
Emmy's Heart

Joy can be difficult to find in the halls of a pediatric hospital.  Children are scared, parents are worried.  Until the magical clothes rack rolls in.
 
I know what it's like to be a parent, watching her child fight for his life.  I also know what it's like to be a daughter, watching her mother fight a valiant, yet losing battle with cancer.
 
My mother was a ten year melanoma survivor when we learned in October 2010 that the beast had returned.  One month later, I learned that my then-seven year old son had leukemia.  Their battles were brutal, and unfortunately, in April 2011, my mother entered hospice.
 
At the same time my mother was dying, my son, Josh, was receiving high dose methotrexate during a week-long stay in the hospital.  To say that I was despondent would be an understatement.  To ease my grief, I decided to learn how to make a tutu for my niece, with the hope that it would brighten both of our days.
 
I made that tutu on April 10, 2011, the day my mother passed away.  It was beautiful, it was fluffy, it lifted my heavy heart.  As I looked at that piece of magic, I realized that I knew many girls who would benefit from a tutu: the girls on the hematology/oncology floor at Joe DiMaggio Children's Hospital.  I took a picture, and posted it, along with my plan, on my facebook page.
 
What happened next was incredible: my friends wanted to help too!  Everyone wanted to lift the hearts of sick kids by giving them tutus and capes.  Now, I host tutu parties, where volunteers create magic in the form of tutus, crowns, capes and masks.  We then load them into my car and distribute them to kids in hospitals throughout South Florida.
 
Josh now receives chemo at the hospital once a month.  On those days, I can be found wheeling my clothes rack, laden with tutus and capes, to rooms around Joe D's.
 
It's joy.  Pure and simple.

What We Need & What You Get

Our tutus cost $8 on average, and capes run about $4.  Some months, we distribute to hundreds of children, so the costs add up quickly!  We have a dedicated donor to pay for mundane expenses like web hosting and business cards, so every penny received goes straight towards purchasing the materials for our kids!  (Really...our volunteers spend hours working away, and only receive brownies and a beverage or two in exchange.)
 
We use 6 inch rolls of tulle and poly/cotton blend broadcloth for our capes.  If you sew and have scraps, we might just be able to transform them into headbands for a little girl whose hair is finally growing in.
 
What will you get?  How about a warm and fuzzy feeling.  Really.  Imagine the smiles you will give.  It's beautiful.  Not only that, but you'll get a tax deduction too!  Emmy's Heart is a 501(c)(3) tax exempt charity, recognized by the IRS.

The Impact

By donating to us, you will help sick kids be regular kids for a while.  You will remind little girls who are dealing with the side effects of chemotherapies that they are beautiful.  You will allow a sick boy to put on his cape and remember that he is stronger than anyone could imagine.  You will send gifts home to siblings, who are affected in ways you cannot imagine.  You will help parents enjoy their children, as they giggle and laugh, spin and fly.  You will spread joy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you crafty?  Check out our locations tab on emmysheart.org.  You might just be able to create a little bit of magic too!
 
Please share our mission.  Help us spread joy.

story:
Share this and Win!

1st place winner - A private party on us.

      That's right. Share this campaign with everyone you know and you could win a Vine Van Gogh event for you and 20 of your friends and family. You tell us where and when and we bring the party. If your shares generate the most funds to our campaign, its party time for you! Here are the easy steps to make sure you have the best chance of winning -   http://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/203660683-How-To-Participate-In-A-Referral-Contest

2nd place winner -A brand new iPad Mini with retina display.



Great things are not done by impulse. But by a series of small thing brought together. - Vincent Van Gogh


Who is Vine Van Gogh? 


        For those of you who don't know us we are Vine Van Gogh, the Hudson Valley’s premier Sip & Paint. A what & what? Yeah, we get that alot.  A Sip & Paint is when you join us for a few drinks and a guided lesson on how to create a painting of your very own by one of our many fantastic artists. Consider it "edutainment". 3 parts fun and 1 part learning how to paint. The best part… We come to you! That's right! We are a 100% MOBILE business. We host public S&P’s at over 20 (and growing) bars and restaurants all over the Hudson Valley for your convenience. We also will gogh  wherever you want us to for a private party, great for so many occasions. We offer special parties for Fundraisers, Corporate events, and now we even do Van Gogh Jr. for kids 7-15 years old and they love it! 


Keegan ales 8-20-14

Over the last year, we have been perfecting our business so we can bring our idea to the nation, and then the world! Also, we want to create a duplicatable  process so anyone can join in on the fun of owning a part of the Vine Van Gogh Vision! Yeah we think big. The main idea is to bring art back into the spotlight on a personal level and offer a fresh new reason to get together with family and friends. Even if your skill level is the "curly haired smiling stick figure", THIS IS FOR YOU. Its such an amazing bonding experience you will most likely never forget.


Keegan ales 8-20-14

With your help, we can take this vision , which we started in the Hudson Valley,  to the tri-state area, then the north east region. After that, fill in the rest of the nation, just before making our way to Canada and overseas to share this with our friends in the UK and Japan, just to name a few! But it doesn't stop there. By sea and by land, we want to partner with cruise liners, theme parks, and sports teams for both locations to host and the licensing of their characters and other well known designs. Did we mention that we are developing a way for you to get Vine Van Gogh On Demand from any TV, computer, or mobile device so you can Gogh when and where you want to? By donating to our vision you are now part of the next generation of thinking that will take this proven concept to the stars. Time to paint like a pro with Vine Van Gogh.


Keegan ales 8-20-14

What We Need 

      At this time we are just covering our bases. We have created the platform and now we have a lot of very expensive work to do so we can offer other entrepreneurs the opportunity to have as much fun working as we have with virtually unlimited growth potential. Below is list of franchise expenses and website expenses with upgrades from our last version.

Franchising - $30,000

  1. Market Research and Competitive Analysis

  2. On-site Analysis

  3. Franchise Structure

  4. Franchise Owner Profile

  5. Type of Franchise Offered

  6. Determination of Territory

  7. Franchise Support Programs

  8. Internal Staffing

  9. Franchise Revenue Sources

  10. Initial Franchise Fees

  11. Royalties

  12. Advertising Fees

  13. Franchise Documentation

  14. Franchise Disclosure Document

  15. Individual Franchise Agreement

  16. Area Developer Franchise Agreement

  17. Franchise Registrations and Filings

  18. Franchise Operations Manual

  19. Advertising and Marketing Services 

  20. Setup Advertising Plan

  21. Advertising Creative Material

  22. Franchise Brochure

  23. Website Development Services

  24. Franchise Marketing Training

  25. Setting Achievable Goals

  26. Media Analysis

  27. Performance Evaluation

  28. Audited Financial Statements Services

  29. Franchise Sales Services

  30. Franchise Sales Training

  31. Franchise Sales Webinar

  32. Franchise Training Services

  33. Management Training Course

  34. Building the Franchise Organization

  35. Training Your Franchisees

  36. Developing a National Advertising Campaign

  37. Franchisor  Compliance

  38. Franchisee Relations

  39. ON-GOING GENERAL CONSULTING SERVICES

Web Development - $45,000

  1. Set up/Configure Store Options for Gogh Gear

  2. Connect to Social Media

  3. Set up Categories/ Product Attributes for each particular product type/product Location, Event, Skill Level, Artist, Venue, Date

  4. Event Page/Calendar View Set Up

  5. Accept Donations when doing a fundraising event

  6. Event Ticket Set up

  7. Google Map Set up to pull location of the venue Loyalty Program

  8. Gift Cards

  9. Notify a Customer when an Items Back in Stock

  10. Custom Labels for Products/Events

  11. Newsletter Sign Up

  12. Age Verification Attribute Set up Capture age of each attendee

  13. Custom form options for Pages like Teach/Host

  14. Advanced SEO plugin

  15. Connect to Payment Methods

  16. One Page Checkout

  17. Abandon Shopping Cart Tracking

  18. Avalara- automation of sales tax

  19. Login as Customer

  20. Google analtyics/Google Site Map Creation

  21. Testing, Server Configuration & Deployment

  22. Training & Documentation

STRETCH GOAL ALERT!

If we pass our goal and make it to $100,000 dollars we will be buying a Gogh Van! Because we are a mobile company, we need a more accommodating vehicle to work out of. That means we can store more of what we need in the van, and make less wasteful trips back to the office. That's better for the environment, and we can spend more time bringing you new venues and party types.
Imagine this, but with a way cooler paint job!


The Impact


      They say "a picture is worth a thousand words". We say painting a picture with friends is worth a thousand smiles. It is very well known that the expression of art is one of the most therapeutic actions we can take. With today's nonstop lifestyles, we never give ourselves time to recharge the mind and body. According to the article found at http://www.arttherapyblog.com/what-is-art-therapy/#arttherapist , we can create a more intimate understanding of yourself while painting, offering an opportunity for personal growth.  

“For the most part, anyone can use art therapy. In a world where there is a multitude of ways to communicate and express one’s self, expressive arts therapy is yet another. One of the major differences between art therapy and other forms of communication is that most other forms of communication elicit the use of words or language as a means of communication. Often times, humans are incapable of expressing themselves within this limited range.”

“One of the beauties of art as therapy is the ability for a person to express his/her feelings through any form of art. Though there are other types of expressive therapies (such as the performing arts), expressive art therapy as discussed here typically utilizes more traditional forms of art…such as painting, drawing, photography, sculpture, or a variety of other types of visual art expression.”

To date we have hosted over 1500 students in the last year, and are quickly approaching to a steady 400 students a month, with a schedule booked out to nearly six months. We have hosted fundraisers for over 80 people, and are set up to break that record in the near future.  

Devon Fahey Memorial Fundraiser 8/10/14


Other Ways You Can Help


     We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for giving us the opportunity to share what Vine Van Gogh is all about, as well as our plans for our very exciting future. Now, we must ask you to take what we have shared with you and SHARE it with your world. Please make sure to use the Indigogo share tools to let your friends and family know all about our exciting vision. We can’t do it without you.

Cheers!

Timothy & Melissa Palladino

"Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together." -Vincent Van Gogh

story:
"The world lost a courageous & wonderful woman. She was a mom, grandma, sister & friend. She was a fisherwoman, animal lover, welder, carpenter, farmer, firecracker, nature admirer, party animal. She had a beautiful laugh, the best stories & always encouraged dark humor.  Shari will leave a large gap in all the lives she touched. I know Shari will be somewhere in the wild, in the wind, in the air & soil, everywhere."

Please consider donating to help her family pay for her funeral, memorial and medical expenses.

If you are unable to contribute financially please help us by spreading the word and sharing this with your friends and family! <3

story:
As many of you know, I lived in Sierra Leone for a summer two years ago and made some close friends. I am very concerned about both the general population and my friends in light of the recent Ebola crisis, and I have decided to send a sort of medical care package to the family I am closest to in Sierra Leone, to protect them and to distribute to their community. Their names are Etta and Bakarr. They took care of me when I lived there, and they have two little boys. 

I talked to Etta yesterday, and she said that the biggest problem they see on a day to day basis does not actually involve the Ebola virus. Because of the situation the virus presents, other common diseases over there are getting even more out of control than they are normally (malaria, typhoid, worms, etc). People are afraid to go to hospitals for treatment and risk catching Ebola, and healthcare workers are so distracted by the Ebola crisis that it takes much longer to get treatment for other diseases. Having had one of these diseases myself, I can speak to the extreme discomfort they cause when unmedicated. Unfortunately, I cannot send antibiotics or anything prescribed that would cure any of these diseases, but I can send over the counter medications to help make things more bearable during the wait for treatment. I would also like to send some things to help people stay disease-free. Some items, like gloves, are aimed at the Ebola virus, but others are just for general disease prevention. 

I would like to start sending packages regularly, but as you might imagine, this costs a little more than I can afford on a research salary. So I'm reaching out to see if you would be willing to contribute. Even $5 makes a big difference, believe me - most Sierra Leoneans live on less than $1/day, if they are employed at all. Any leftover money will be wired safely to Etta to help pay for her sons' education.

Here is my tentative list. Please let me know if you have any other ideas, or anything that you want your specific money allocated to! My address is at the bottom if you want to mail money.

- Gloves

- EPA-approved disinfectant 

- Masks

- Bednets (to protect from malaria)

- Advil

- Water purifier

- Alcohol-based hand disinfectant

- Nail clippers (long nails spread diseases more easily than you might think)

- Immodium

- Many copies of educational materials to distribute in Freetown about how Ebola spreads and how to combat it

story:
In a nutshell...

We're raising money to heal an entire group of people through hypnosis in one night FREE OF CHARGE at an evening 2-hour seminar in Southern California!

"A Night of Healing"

My name is Jonathan Hyde and I'm a Certified Hypnotherapist practicing since April of 2010. I became a hypnotherapist because it's my goal in life to heal people of the emotional problems they carry with them. I don't feel I'm reaching enough people through the 1 on 1 sessions I have, so it is my wish and dream to help to heal an entire group of people through a 2 hour seminar that outlines hypnosis and to induce hypnosis to the entire audience and guide them through releasing their emotional problems and baggage. I want to donate my services as a hypnotherapist and help to heal those who can't afford a 1 on 1 hypnotherapy session by doing this for FREE. All who attend this "Night of Healing" will be admitted FREE OF CHARGE!

Here's the details of "A Night of Healing"

In September this year, I will hold a 2-hour hypnosis seminar at a local hotel in Torrance, California for SoCal residents. This seminar will be completely FREE OF CHARGE because I want to help as many people as I possibly can. Here's what'll happen at the seminar...

  • I'll Introduce myself and explain my credentials and background
  • Explain what hypnosis is and how it works
  • Give examples of some things hypnosis can help with and how
  • Provide a visual, drawn out explanation of how the sub-conscious and conscious minds work (and sometimes how they don't work)
  • (Short Break)
  • Test the audiences suggestibility (how one takes in information either directly or indirectly)
  • Induce the audience into a hypnotic state and deepen their state through a series of different techniques
  • Use the power of suggestions and imagination to release their emotional burden
  • Count up to 5 to return to a fully awake and alert state
  • Explain what I just did
  • Answer final questions and end the seminar

So I need to raise enough money to finance this event and to reach out to as many potential attendees as possible. That's my goal!

What will my donation do?

Your Contribution will pay for a banquet room at a hotel in Torrance, California and the advertising costs to promote "A Night of Healing". I don't want to do this only one time, I want to make this a reoccurring thing, so any donations that go over the goal will be contributed to future seminars!

What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $1,500. Half of that will go to covering the cost of renting a banquet room large enough to hold about 150 people for 2 hours. The other half will go toward advertising in local newspapers, mailers and flyers. Anything left over will go toward the next event! The benefit of this campaign is that contributors will see pictures of the seminar after it's taken place and top contributors will actually get to attend the event in person! Anyone who contributes, you will receive whatever perk at your level of contribution AND all perks below!

The Impact

This simple campaign is EASY to see where your money will go. There is NO RISK and you will actually see where your money goes AND there's no waiting around to see the results, because as soon as the funds are collected, Work will immediately go into reserving a banquet room and advertising the seminar.

Other Ways You Can Help

This may sound like a campaign you really want to donate to, but can't quite afford it, but there's still ways you can help! I need at least 2 volunteers (3 ideally) to donate their time on the night of the seminar to assist with the attendees sign-in, those who may be disabled, answering basic questions, finding seats and making sure people don't fall out of their chairs when they're in hypnosis :-P Yes, this means that if you volunteer, you won't be able to benefit from the hypnosis portion of the seminar.

You can also help to spread the word about this campaign to anyone who may want to contribute or even attend in person!

Referral Contest!!!

Want to win a free hypnosis session, discounted session or free books? Refer people to this campaign!
Use the "Share" tools at the top of this page to refer people to this campaign:

You will get credit for anyone who donates to this campaign through your referral. If you generate $200 or more through referrals, you'll win a FREE hypnosis session!

Here's what you get

  • Generate $200 or more to win a FREE standard hypnosis session!
  • Generate $100 to get 1/2 off a standard hypnosis session!
  • Generate $50 to win a free hypnosis book of your choosing! (http://www.jhhypnosis.com/purchase.html)

You're not the only winner though... both you AND the contributor you refer will get something out of it by whatever perk they choose at the time they make their donation!
It's recommended you first create an Indiegogo account, then start sharing!
That's all there is to it!
If you have any further questions regarding this campaign feel free to email! Or if you have any questions regarding hypnosis or are interested in hypnotherapy for yourself, you can email me at john@jhhypnosis.com or call (310) 947-4480.
story_txt:
In a nutshell...
We're raising money to heal an entire group of people through hypnosis in one night FREE OF CHARGE at an evening 2-hour seminar in Southern California!"A Night of Healing" My name is Jonathan Hyde and I'm a Certified Hypnotherapist practicing since April of 2010. I became a hypnotherapist because it's my goal in life to heal people of the emotional problems they carry with them. I don't feel I'm reaching enough people through the 1 on 1 sessions I have, so it is my wish and dream to help to heal an entire group of people through a 2 hour seminar that outlines hypnosis and to induce hypnosis to the entire audience and guide them through releasing their emotional problems and baggage. I want to donate my services as a hypnotherapist and help to heal those who can't afford a 1 on 1 hypnotherapy session by doing this for FREE. All who attend this "Night of Healing" will be admitted FREE OF CHARGE! 
Here's the details of "A Night of Healing"
In September this year, I will hold a 2-hour hypnosis seminar at a local hotel in Torrance, California for SoCal residents. This seminar will be completely FREE OF CHARGE because I want to help as many people as I possibly can. Here's what'll happen at the seminar...
I'll Introduce myself and explain my credentials and background
Explain what hypnosis is and how it works
Give examples of some things hypnosis can help with and how
Provide a visual, drawn out explanation of how the sub-conscious and conscious minds work (and sometimes how they don't work)

Induce the audience into a hypnotic state and deepen their state through a series of different techniques

story:
Founded in 2009 by Smithsonian artist, Alana Lea, Rainforest ECO is now a team of fashion-loving devas and environmental visionaries on a mission to connect customers to sensuous sustainable fabrics while renewing rainforests in Brazil.

We offer a range of high quality, organic, ethically traded fabrics and accessory products including scarves, shawls, sarongs and belts that will soon be available internationally through the online store, as well as in national retail outlets.

We envision a world of benefit from the production and distribution of award-winning fabric art and, we work toward this vision through our commitments to sustainable textile production, ethical sourcing, and rainforest renewal.

PLEASE JOIN US

Right now we are raising seed funds – both for the company to roll out a complete eco-fashion accessory line for the launch of our online shop AND for our rainforest nursery project in Brazil to begin the seed harvest process for this year.

Up to now, the only people who have our accessories are those who have donated $333 through this link: http://www.rainforesteco.com/donate.shtml.

“Keep up with that fabulous, contagious energy of yours and I know you will reach your goals and make a profound impact on our planet.”
Hugs, Caroline MacDougall
Founder / CEO Teeccino Herbal Coffee

We welcome you to use that link, as Caroline did. But now thanks to IndieGoGo, there are more ways for more people to participate.

Will you break ground with us, participating in the full launch of a sustainable social enterprise AND generating literal seed money for the nursery project?

YOU CAN do that by becoming one of our sponsors today, and by spreading the word using the social media tools here.

If every person who read this contributed at least $10, we’d reach our goal with incredible speed.

How many people do you know who could afford an investment in this Vision? We’re offering gorgeous gifts to those who are able to give more, so that you will become Rainforest Ambassadors with us.

Thank you so very much!

To learn more, please visit: http://blog.rainforesteco.com/ecobank.

story:
Introducing the first Wine Country resort destination in Southern California geared to serve the needs and interests of the LGBT community (and all other like-minded wine lovers.)

Short Summary

Many of the most desirable tourist destinations have hotels that cater to the needs of LGBT travelers and straight allies.  New York (The Out NYC), Barcelona, Buenos Aires and Berlin have the Axel Hotels.  Palm Springs is an entire city full of great options for LGBT travelers.  Even Napa Valley and Sonoma County each have more than a handful of vacation resorts catering to the LGBT community.  With over 40 wineries residing in the middle of the most visited U.S. LGBT destination (SoCal), and approximately 1.5 million LGBT residents within a two-hour drive why shouldn't the Southern California wine country have a great LGBT destination?

  • Que Syrah is a seven room boutique resort anchored in the rolling landscape of Temecula, California—just about an hour from San Diego and Palm Springs and under an hour and a half from Los Angeles.
  • The resort's nearly 10,000 square feet of guest accomodations will welcome you with five-acres of breathtaking scenery and easy-going charm for which Southern California is known.
  • Your contributions will directly fund upgrades to the guest suites and the grounds of the property.

What We Need & What You Get

The resort is on track to open this July, but there are a handful of necessary upgrades that will take a beautiful, multi-million dollar property and picturesque landscape and turn them an unforgettable destination experience for visitors.

In order to make sure we stay on track in the fundraising process, we have dug deep to come up with some desireable rewards you can only get through this campaign.  The earlier in the campaign you contribute, the easier it is to get a high-value reward for your contribution.  The rewards include: 

  • One-Year Membership in the Founder's Club (15% All-Resort Discount Card)
  • Curated Wine Package Deliveries (Shipped to Your Home)
  • Weeknight Stays
  • Weekend Stay Packages for two
  • Group Stay Packages
  • Resort Buy-Out Packages
  • Wedding/Event with Lodging Buyout
  • Corporate Sponsorship
  • Corporate Retreat Package

What will we do with the funds?

Specifically, we will be upgrading the guest room furnishings, lighting, sound systems, and guest bar area in the interior of the resort.   On the exterior space leading to the adjacent vineyard, we will be upgrading the landscaping and creating a more sanctuary-like spa experience for guests to enjoy the five lush acres of property.  In total we need to raise about $25,000 for the upgrades.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

In fact, one of the biggest ways you can help us is by getting the word out about the project.  Indiegogo has some incredible tools to help you share.  PLEASE SHARE.  Also, please like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.  You'll not only get the latest updates and event invitations, but we'll also have deals you can only get there. 

If you know press people who might be interested in either the first ever crowdfunded Resort for the LGBT community, please send us a message with their contact info.

story:
Help a Fighting Irishman

My name is Brad Haima and I have know Sean Murphy for over 25 years. We grew up together, got into trouble together and graduated together. Sean is one of those people that makes everyone love life and have a great time. 

On December 10th 2013 Sean was hit by a taxi crossing the road in Toronto. He sustained serious life threatening injuries that required him to be put into a coma for almost 2 weeks. Thankfully Sean is a fighter and is now showing positive signs of recovery, but he still has an incredibly long way to go. 

Sean and his family have had to absorb many costs in order to travel to Toronto so they can be with Sean while he is in the hospital. Sean's sister Robin has been in Toronto for over a month. 

We are planning a fundraiser pub night in Abbotsford on January 18th, but many people who are not in Abbotsford have asked if they could help in some way. 

Well here's a great way to help! 

Our Goal

We are looking for anyone to donate to Sean and his family! We want to raise at least $1,000 for him and his family! I think this amount is incredibly low, but we need to hit our goal in order to maximize our funds. All the money we raise will go directly to Sean. 

The impact your contribution will help to alleviate an already stressful situation. 

THANK YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to post this link to your Facebook wall or Twitter account.
  • Email and call friends and family to tell them about this site.

Let's get the word out!

story:
About My Fellowship

In February, I will depart for Zambia and Zimbabwe on a four-month assignment as a Kiva Fellow.  In this volunteer role, I will work with Kiva's Field Partners Zoona and the Campaign for Female Education (Camfed).  Both entities are part of Kiva's worldwide efforts to alleviate poverty through micro loans to build small businesses and lift up entire communities.

My first month of service will take place in Zambia, working with Zoona.  Zoona provides important resources and tools to small business owners that help keep transactions secure while providing customers with better service.  These tools help small businesses grow, and as they do, families become more financially stable.  My field work will focus on visiting with entrepreneurs who are benefitting from Kiva micro loans and Zoona's platforms, and ensuring that these resources and tools are being leveraged for maximum benefit.

For the remaining three months of my Kiva Fellowship, I'll be working in Zimbabwe with Camfed.  Camfed is dedicated to ensuring an education for girls' throughout rural Zimbabwe.  Their approach includes direct aid in the form of scholarships for girls' complete secondary education, covering school fees, uniforms, books, pencils and bags.  Additionally, Camfed provides loans in these same rural areas to support women-owned small businesses.  These two efforts then dovetail.  Women receiving interest-free loans to help grow their business commit to investing their own social capital by serving as etching assistance in local schools.  So not only does Camfed assist families with meeting the educational costs of their children, but they also engage them with dignity and respect - allowing them to invest what they can in making the education of their children possible.  My work will focus on helping Camfed maximize its partnership with Kiva, and will include work in the field visiting schools and meeting the families that are benefitting from Camfed's efforts.

For more than 20 years, my career and my travels have been dedicated to helping those in need around the world.  It's an honor to be chosen as a Kiva Fellow, allowing me to extend my professional work and personal passions for the benefit of impoverished families in southern Africa.

By contributing to my campaign, you'll be taking part in the great things we can only accomplish together.  I've been blessed with many things, but it's only been through the sharing of those blessings that I've found true meaning and richness in my life.  

I hope you'll join me in this special effort, and allow me to be your heart's boots on the ground doing important work for families in Zambia and Zimbabwe.

How You Can Be A Part

Because the nature of the work is so meaningful, it is a great honor and distinction to be named a Kiva Fellow.  In addition to committing my time and expertise, I must also fund all expenses associated with my assignment.  My budget for my four-month deployment is as follows:

  • Airfare ($0 - thanks to frequent flier miles!)
  • Housing ($2,000)
  • Food ($800)
  • Intra- and Inter-country transportation ($400)
  • Local cell phone ($200)
  • Travel insurance ($500)
  • Visas ($600)
  • Emergency Fund ($500)
  • TOTAL: $5,000

I'm personally committed to self-funding $2,500 of my expenses, making my campaign goal just $2,500 -- thereby matching every dollar I raise with one of my own.  It will take gifts at every level to reach my goal, so there's plenty of room for everyone!*

As a gesture of my gratitude, I'm offering some special "thank you" gifts.  Although the gifts I've outlined are cool just as they are, truth is I know I won't be able to help myself once I arrive in Africa and get new ideas on how to show you how much I appreciate your help.  So in addition to the items I've described, be prepared for an extra dose of "umpf" at every level. :)

If I exceed my goal, surplus funds will be used to extend my Kiva Fellowship (if possible), or will be donated to Kiva and/or Camfed.

* (Please note that your contribution to support my Fellowship is not tax-deductible.  While my volunteer efforts are being conducted on behalf of Kiva, and in pursuit of both Kiva's mission and those of the Field Partners', all contributions go into a personal fund to cover my direct expenses related to my deployment.)

Your Impact

We're in this together!  Through your generosity, you're locking arms with me in this important endeavor to help build dreams for families in Zambia, and little girls and young women in Zimbabwe.  I won't miss a single opportunity to demonstrate how important your support is by sharing with you the stories of those you're helping.  Once in the field, I know I'll have many moving and compelling stories, images and lessons to share with you -- drawing you closer to the work you helped make possible.  You can also follow along on my blog: www.leavetheboots.com

I've said it before: I don't think I can change the whole world, but I believe I can change another person's world.  So imagine what we can do together!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some can’t contribute money right now, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help in other ways:

  • PLEASE share my campaign with others through email, Facebook or Twitter! I will rely on people outside of my immediate networks to reach my goal.
  • Donate airline miles or hotel points to help me save money on travel expenses in the field.  Oh, by the way, my ticket to Africa is one-way, so I'll need to get back somehow! :)
  • Follow and share my blog (www.leavetheboots.com), find me on Facebook (www.facebook.com/leavetheboots) and Twitter (@leavetheboots).
  • Help me build my local network by connecting me to people you know in Zambia, Zimbabwe and other parts of southern Africa. :)

story:
CAMPAIGN CLOSED!!


Thank you so much for your support, please we do not need any further contributions, our project has been successfully funded by local investors and we are now Live on WWW.zipibyte.com.


You can show some love by following us on @zipibyte or by visiting our website regularly for top stories.


Our goal is to create an online product alert, advice and review system specifically tailored to the African market which will help readers to make the best buying decisions, identify and avoid fakes. This will be done by explaining tech terms in ways the African market understands, and reviewing current and the latest smartphones, laptops, desktops, tablets or other gadgets in the market.

We also plan to set up an in-house studio to make video reviews possible for those who would rather watch the reviews.

Reviews on the site will be comprehensive, informative and designed to help the reader make an informed buying decision.

We have a section entitled Afriteq, which is dedicated to the African tech industry and African tech startup coverage as part of our goals to expose ambitious and innovative hidden projects and ideas needing funding.

Here is a quick summary of our goals and targets


  • Build a website for product alert, advice and reviews of tech gadgets specifically tailored to the African market.

  • Educate and raise awareness of counterfeit tech gadgets in the African market.

  • Find and provide innovative tech ideas and startups adequate publicity to attract investment.


    THE BIG PROBLEM

    Ever wanted to buy a computer, smartphone, tablet or any tech gadget and got stuck making a choice? Did you get confused reading the specifications? Can’t understand jargon's like RAM, Memory, and Pixel? Did you go on a research spree, reading blogs, watching video reviews, consulting manuals and dictionaries, and asking salesmen and friends lots of questions?

    When you finally narrowed your options down to a list of probably four or more, did you get stuck again making a choice between brands with the specs you wanted, simply because you didn’t know the best fit for your circumstance, lifestyle and environment?

    If that happened to you, then you are not alone. Millions of people with different needs, budget, lifestyle, environment etc, are stuck daily when making tech-buying decisions, just like you.

    If you live in an advanced country, you would probably be up to date with current tech trends and vocabulary. You would likely have access to authoritative information and products readily tailored to your lifestyle. But third world countries lack such advantage.

    The problem is worse in Africa where technological advancement within the continent is relatively at its infancy.


    The African tech market is a major consumer of tech products not tailored to their needs. Yet nothing stops Africans from wanting the most current tech gadgets in foreign markets.

    Unfortunately the lack of information, quality control and the fact that these products are largely manufactured outside the continent has given counterfeiters and knock-off importers the opportunity to flood the African tech market with fake, overpriced and substandard products.

    Buying decisions in Africa are difficult to make due to "environment fit" issues, costs, poor understanding of tech specs, lack of access to authentic information and counterfeits flooding the market such that when decisions are made, most end up buying counterfeits.

    Counterfeit devices in the market made attractive by catchy aesthetics are often very hard to distinguish from the authentic ones by non-technical buyers. The majority of these devices break down after less than a month of use.



    THE TEAM

    We are a small group of tech-enthusiasts and entrepreneurs based in Lagos, Nigeria. We love everything tech, we follow the latest tech news and often get to try the trending gadgets in the market.

    We are motivated by previous bad experiences with counterfeit gadgets, the huge knowledge gap of tech information in the local market and the desire to expose hidden local innovative tech talents and ideas to potential local and foreign investors.

    BUDGET BREAKDOWN

    The funding needed for this project is broken down as follows:

    - Website design and branding, $2,000

    - 2 Canon Eos 5D Mark III cameras, among other production equipment. This is necessary for conducting reviews, interviews and various tech shows.  Cost of this equipment is $10,000.

    - Laptop Computers for the team,  $9,000.

    - $9,000 to fund the hiring of new writers, developers and a power generator set to mitigate erratic power supply.


    CARICATURE SAMPLES



    SCHEDULE

    We have carefully planned out our schedule should our funding targets be met. In the case of any delays along the line, we have ensured our timeline can accommodate them. You will also be informed of any unexpected delays.


    RISK AND CHALLENGES


    We have taken our time to do a very detailed case study and can tell you that the only risk involved in this would be internet-related security threats. And we will be doing our best to keep the website safe and secure as soon as we go live.

    The major challenge we are facing is getting the necessary funds to kick off the project on the right footing. Without the necessary funds we will not be able to achieve our goals, because we are not planning to set up just another tech site to compete with other big names - if that was the case then it would be very easy to set up a tech blog. However, this is not our goal, far from it. 70% of our target audience are offline, so we have to reach them by other means.

    FAQs

    This project was meant to serve the African market, why do you focus so much on Lagos Nigeria?

    We are focusing on Lagos Nigeria for starters because Lagos is the most populated city in Africa right now, and we are currently based in Lagos.


    Little insight on Lagos Nigeria:

    Lagos Nigeria also presents a familiar market. We researched and compared it with other notable sub-Saharan African cities and found it a worthy case study for Africa with the exception of a few countries.

    We hope to expand to Accra Ghana, Nairobi Kenya and Johannesburg South Africa within the second quarter of 2015.


    When will you deliver the website advertising perks and how do I know my ad is running?

    All website advertising perks will be delivered starting from the second month of our website launch and initial promotional phase, so that we have enough users on the site viewing the ads. You will also get a direct link to the page where your ad is placed.

    What do you need to create a caricature of me and how do I get it?

    Please note that you have to send us the picture you want used and this will be delivered to the provided email address once we are done.

    Privacy Policy: 

    All pictures submitted for caricature perks will not be used for any other purpose than to deliver the promised caricatures. Each picture will be stored securely and then deleted as soon as the caricature is successfully delivered to its rightful owner. Pictures will not be used for any other reason, and they will not be made public at any time.

    Useful Link: http://www.geek.com/apple/functional-iphone-6-knockoffs-now-exist-1599169/?fullsite=true              

    Thank you so much for your time and for supporting our goal. If you have any further questions, comments or suggestions, we invite you to contact us at contact@Zipibyte.com.



    You can also help us by sharing the campaign with friends and family :)


    Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

 

Hello amazing people!!  I am a young entrepreneur that has had my career taken away from me with ten days notice because an executive in the company I was a franchisee for told a lie that cost me everything.  I believe that this world is built on good, kind people, and I'm hoping and praying that you will help me through the rebuilding process.

The Help I Need

If any of you personally know me, you know that I LOVED my life.  I loved my career.  I loved being able to help people.  I loved that I got to spend quality time with my friends and family.  I loved that I had the freedoms to take care of myself, my business, people I loved, charities I felt strongly about, and people I came across that were in need.  What this company did to me was unspeakable.  My attorneys originally thought that, since this executive had admitted his fault, I would be able to gain some sort of compensation for the losses they left me with.  Not only did they tarnish my name and my reputation in the industry, but they caused the 600+ clients I had gained to lose faith in myself and my team.  They denied me earned bonuses that would've paid off my year-one debt entirely.  They left me with crippling debt and no way to pay it off.  On top of that, they took my business name.  This meant that, assuming I could find a company that would give me a chance, I would have to start all over again from scratch.  Trying to find funding for start-up businesses is impossible.  This is what I am hoping and praying for help with:

  • A business line of credit that I am currently three months behind on.  This line of credit was extended to me by my old company.  I had it in my business plan that it would be paid off in full with the bonuses I'd already earned from them, that were supposed to be paid to me in the 2014 year.  My payment is over $1000/mo and the balance is just over $48,000.
  • Business credit card debt totaling $52,000.00.  About $24,000 of this was left to me from my old company.  The extra has been added on as I have been relying on available credit to cover bills since the business was forced to close.

The Impact

Your contribution to my campaign will

  • Support a local small business that is fighting to stay solvent after a drastic blow from a giant corporation.
  • Allow me to build my business and get back to being able to help people in my community.
  • Not to sound cheesy or corny, but you will be saving my life - my sanity, my current relationships (both personal and professional), my credit, my name and my word.  You'd be giving me back the future that was taken from me and re-illuminating the stars in my sky.

The Plan

I've spend a lot of time after hours working on a solid plan to help bring my business to the surface.  With your help, I can hire a second employee and put some money back into marketing.  With hard work and a decent marketing budget, I can bring the business to where it needs to be within three months.

I have a great deal of experience in this industry.  I spent two and a half years working with an agent to build a business from scratch, then another two and a half years working with a different agent to turn his upside-down agency right-side-up.  Following that, I opened my own agency, starting with absolutely zero customers, and turned it into a business that grossed a  quarter of a million dollars within twelve months time.  Granted it takes time, money, and good employees to do that, but I firmly believe that, with your help, I can do it all over again this year. 

I feel that I've built a name for myself in my community.  My clients are constantly referring their friends and family to me for help, and I have build great relationships with business partners in the community that provide a variety of related services. All I need is just a bit of help lifting the rock off my chest so that I can breathe again.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you do not have the ability to donate personally, please pass my story along to anyone and everyone you know.  The more people this reaches, the more of a chance I will have at reaching my goal.  You never know who might be able to help, whether by donating, or simply sharing this with their circle of influence.

    Besides email, texting, and telling people about me, social networking sites like Twitter and Facebook are great ways to share this story.  You can also utilize some of the amazing sharing tools that IndieGoGo has set up for people like me.

    I want to thank you so very much for taking the time to read this and share it.  I want to thank you for your donations...for any help you can give.  I make a promise to each and every one of you that I will either pay this back, or pay it forward.

    Thank you!

    Erin

story:
What do you think of when you imagine a local coffee shop? Some might imagine the morning smell of freshly brewed coffee and warm baked goods, or a late night dessert. For others, the sight of students and young visionaries with their heads buried in books as they fuel their studies with coffee, or tea between friends meeting for a chat. Still others might think of the sound of acoustic guitars and singer/songwriters giving their commentary on life and love, and having an opportunity to be heard.

We picture all of this and more.

We believe that this area could and should have a location that is welcoming, gives fantastic customer service, is social and entertaining and provides the freshest, most consistent, most flavorful coffee, baked goods and fun food.

Your contribution to our campaign will help us to allow such a place to take root and flourish. This coffeehouse will be more than just a business. It will be a meeting place. A community hub. A launch pad for new vocalists and songwriters. A warm and friendly place for reading, studying, and socializing. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have a space and equipment all set up, but there are some expenses that we are looking for help with.

$7,000 – Two months rent.  This gives us a little more breathing room with getting everything up and running.

$3,000 – Equipment fees.  The space we are moving into already has all of the equipment we need – coffee roaster, coffee brewing stations, ovens, refrigerators, etc.  This is obviously very beneficial to us, as we won’t have to buy the equipment, or wait until we have the equipment lined up to start roasting coffee, and cooking delicious meals.  We are doing a rent to own agreement, and this $3,000 will take a big bite out of those charges.

$6,930 – Payroll.  In order to roast and brew coffee, plus cook and bake our little hearts out for your delight, we need a few people working for us.  This will be so that while we are getting established, we can hire and properly train our staff.

$1,442 – Utility deposits.  Obviously in order to brew the most amazing cup of joe that you have ever tasted, we need water.  And electricity.  And a phone so you can call us and tell us how miraculous our coffee is.  So this bit will help get the shop open, brewing and cooking, and ready for you to come in.

The Impact

Getting this café open would obviously be a wonderful thing for us.  Here’s how it helps you:

You deserve good coffee.  Not just good coffee, but great coffee.  Freshly roasted coffee is more than just a 'pick me up'. It's a GREAT tasting cup of 'get up and go'. Once more people start drinking the best coffee that they've ever had, their moods will improve, making them and the people around them happier.  That will spur feelings like ‘Alright, let’s get this done!’ and ‘Let’s do this!’. Freshly roasted, freshly brewed coffee is really the gift that keeps on giving.

We will be hoping to hire 8-12 staff members.  While this doesn't seem like a lot, it’s 8-12 people who will have a job, so that will be helping them and their families, which strengthens the community overall.

We will provide a comfortable, upbeat place for community groups to meet.  The space that we are moving into has not only tables and chairs, but couches and  comfy chairs making it perfect for meetings and gatherings.

We are also big supporters of the arts, and are looking forward to bringing lots of local talent into our place.  This will be a great way for customers to find new favorite bands, singers, poets or comedians, and really support the local arts community.

Risks & Challenges

We know that most new restaurants fail in the first year.  But… that won’t happen to us.  We will make the best coffee you've ever had, and our food will make you want to come back for more.  When you add that to our community ties, plus our sheer stubbornness, we don't see failure as an option.  We fully plan on becoming known for our food, drinks, and atmosphere, and intend to become a community staple.

Other Ways You Can Help

Demand better coffee.  Share this campaign with your family, share it with your friends.  Help make this dream of providing Voorhees with the café it deserves a reality.

story:
We are six students in an Environmental and Resources class at Thompson Rivers University and we want to start a community garden. This garden will be available for students, staff and faculty to rent plots and enjoy fresh food.

An on campus garden provides endless benefits including: easy access to healthy choices, a sense of community, educational opportunities, and the promotion of sustainable food sources.

The funds from this campaign will go towards starting this garden, things that will be needed include equipment, fencing, soil and seeds.

This garden will be run by the Roots and Shoots Club at TRU and will make sure maintenance, security and organization is completed 12 months of the year.

We would also like to install that a portion of the produce will go to the Kamloops Food Bank.

To learn more visit our website at the link below.

story:
** Thank you for all the support!  Our campaign is now in the In-Demand phase, which means you can continue to donate anytime.   We are going into our fourth week of helping Jenny and Shepherd and are accepting another family to start this week, so any continued help you can give is much appreciated!**

Jenny's Story

In Jenny's own words she is, "a sister, daughter, aunt, friend, wife, and most recently a mother.  Since February 20th, none of those titles has changed, but an unfortunate medical diagnosis has been added – Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, breast cancer."  

Jenny is currently recovering from a double mastectomy and just found out that she will need to start chemotherapy at the end of May and radiation after that.    She is looking at another 6-7 months of treatment, so there is a long road ahead of her. This is a difficult situation both physically and emotionally, but it is especially tough when you are a stay-at-home parent to a very active (and adorable) one-year old boy.  Jenny's biggest concern is that her son, Shepherd, is happy and well taken-care of while she goes through this.  

Mommies In Need is helping to take a bit of that burden off of her.  We are going to be providing her with a fantastic and experienced nanny during her recovery to watch Shepherd so that she can focus her energy on getting better.  This is our nanny's second week caring for Shepherd and they are loving getting to know each other.  We would like to be able to continue supporting her as long as we can, but we need the funds to do that! 

About Mommies In Need

Mommies In Need is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that provides in-home childcare to stay-at-home parents going through a health crisis.  We not only fund nannies for sick moms, but also provide them with someone who is vetted, background checked, CPR certified, and experienced in dealing with situations when the parent is suddenly ill.  

We began in October of 2014 with a very successful Indiegogo campaign to help one mom with colon cancer and are proud to say that through all of the generous donations we have recieved, we were able to see that family through the mom's entire chemo treatment- that's nearly six months of full-time nanny care!  We recently helped our second mom during radiation treatment and are currently supporting Jenny's family.

How You Can Help

Sending top quality nannies to these families is expensive, and we need money to be able to guarantee our help to Jenny and to keep growing so that we can take on even more families like hers.  

Let's help take some of the pressure off of these moms so that they can focus on getting better quickly and getting back to their full time jobs of raising little human beings the best they can!

Please, please consider donating as much as you can afford. And if you can't donate then share this link on all of your social media so you can help us find someone who can! Let's band together as a community and support the women who are dedicating their lives to a very important job, a job that has countless benefits- but unfortunately, none of those benefits are disability insurance!

You can visit us at www.mommiesinneed.org to learn more about our cause and how to help Jenny and other mommies going through a major health crisis.  You can also like us on Facebook to get updates on the progress of this organization.  

And if you want to donate the old fashioned way, you can send a check made out to Mommies In Need to PO Box 601562  Dallas, Tx 75360.  

And all donations here or by check are 100% tax deductible. Thank you for your support!!!
