story:
Won’t you support our mission?

 Our goal is to provide Affordable, Fresh , Wholesome, Organic, meals and snacks delivered fresh  in oven ready recyclable containers anywhere in the country . 

We understand the frustration in maintaining a healthy lifestyle, in our research and personal experience we believe that the three “A’s” prevent people from being able to enjoy the benefits of living a healthy organic lifestyle.  

Availability, Accessibility and Affordability. 

Our mission:

Don't you just love the fresh, clean Spring air where everything is blooming?q

I know I do, what comes with Spring is Farmers Markets, Festivals, Vacations and the desire to be outside. 

The busier we get the less time we have to be in the kitchen.  This often leaves us in the mercy of grab and go vending machines, convenience stores, and eating food that compromises our health. We have little to no idea how the food was prepared, if it's a GMO, full of salt and hydrogenated oils. 

Has trying to understand what is good optimal health left you in a haze of confusion, frustrated or have you surrendered to not worrying about it because of  your lack of options?

We are here to assist you, guide you, answer your questions and help you take the stress out of your diet by being your wellness companion. 

Don't stop here , READ ON! 

You deserve  a lifestyles that supports joyful living.  

Well-Beingness and vibrant health are natural conditions of life. 

Since we are just getting to know each other allow me to introduce our Simple philosophy. 

 Every aspect of our business is an opportunity to infuse more awesomeness in the lives of you, your family, your community and the people around you. 

We continue to build alliances with organic farmers. We support local Eco -organic consumerism, soup kitchens, food pantries, homeless shelters and new mom programs. Our goal is to improve the quality of the food banks around the country by giving back in the way of donation of Organic Non-GMO food to these banks.

 Our mission is to cause Revolutionary shift in the way America eats, by making Wholesome Fresh Organic meals and snacks Delicious, Convenient and affordable for everyone.

We believe that everyone has a right to healthy food regardless  of economic ability.

We support grass roots causes and education programs. We offer life skill opportunities to students, and work related opportunities for retired citizens. We inspire people with passion  to join our fast paced growing team. 

We support Sustainable Living and believe that our service will  significantly contribute to the health and the preservation of our planet and its natural resources . This is who we are and how we live . 

 Our true mission at Deanna's OrganicKitchen is all about YOU! 

Our pleasure is to nourish YOU with Delicious Green Cuisine. 

We want YOU to have more time doing what you love, so you can enjoy your life to the fullest. 

Our marketing starts and stops with YOU 

We believe if YOU love our service you will naturally share what we are about with your friends family and community . 

We live a Organic Lifestyle, keeping everything as close to nature as possible. Gluten Free, Vegan, Vegetarian and Gourmet Green Cuisine is a way of life for us.

We are proud and passionate.  We believe that when love goes into the preparation of our food, that we are passing it forward in the way of blessings to those who are receiving it. The result will be improved health and quality of life. 

Health is not a buzzword ,but your everyday opportunity to put some good back into the world and in our bodies. YOU and your family can have peace of mind, enjoy life and have more quality time for yourself. Your gonna feel amazing. 

We believe we have to give back our fair share . We will be donating meals to local soup kitchens , and will  give  5 percent of our profits to establish 501-c Organic Girls Food Bank. A non profit foundation that will deliver free Organic meals for this less fortunate  into the local communities . We have a goal to replace Organic food in existing food banks . 

Because Deanna has had the unfortunate experience of losing so many to cancer. After witnessing the tortuous suffering of both her parents , 3 close girlfriends and many  other friends and relatives have endured until the end of their battles with cancer , she committed  her to life to teach others, the benefits of  Advanced Lifestyle Nutrition and be a influence to providing quality food in hospitals, work place, airports, theme parks and college campuses around the World.  



The Founders:

Deanna is a seasoned professional chef and an experienced restaurateur.  Daryl is a respected, successful internet marketing entrepreneur.  Both are Ambassadors of Health with Hippocrates Health Institute as well as experienced Lifestyle Coaches for weight loss and whole food nutrition.  They saw the need for more options and developed a business model that would provide a solution.

“We have an operation that includes a kitchen in the perfect location. It is very near a UPS shipping hub and in a area in the country that has  a year round growing season with great relationships with the local organic farmers."

Here’s Where YOU Come In:

Deanna and Daryl with their team of professionals have been working for months perfecting recipes and creating incredible invaluable relationships with experts in the areas of Advanced Life Style Nutrition. In order to finish developing the website and our extensive marketing strategy we are asking for YOUR support.

Your generous Donation will literally help change the lives of people around across the nation by making these quality, organic, non genetically modified (GMO), and don’t forget DELICIOUS meals and snacks available, accessible and affordable for everyone!

We've even included some Yummy ways to say "Thank You" for your generous donation and support …

 

At Deanna’s Organic Kitchen:

•                     We feel eating Organic shouldn’t be expensive.

•                     We think food is the most powerful yet least invasive form of medicine.

•                     We believe Organic Gluten Free Plant Based Whole foods encourage the natural healing abilities of the body and mind, and provide Optimal Nourishment  

•                     We think it’s often a challenge to find healthy tasty fresh  plant based organic gourmet prepared meals.

•                     Health and flavor should not have to be compromised for convenience

•                     Vegan Vegetarian Gluten Free food should always taste delicious.

•                     Our service will not only cause a positive impact on the health of our society, but our impact on the environment will make a profound contribution to the preservation and healing of our planet.

 

MEET DEANNA:

Although Deanna, was raised in fine dining restaurants, she seemed to have been born with a green spoon in her mouth and an intuition about food and its relationship to health. 

 In 1989 after she welcomed her daughter Alicia into the world, her journey became a mission to feed her children organic, healthy food. In trying to accomplish this mission, Deanna quickly discovered eating organic was very expensive not to mention inconvenient for a busy mom (or anyone for that matter).

Ahead of her time, Deanna understood the Health Benefits of eating a plant-based diet. She became a self-taught Pure Food Chef and a pioneer of plant-based super food nutrition, self-educating herself on how to replace flavors and textures used to prepare rich gourmet food with delicious healthy alternatives.  She opened a 200 seat Italian restaurant in a 4 star hotel in a metropolitan tourist area. She created an Organic, mouth-watering vegan, and gluten free menu, including a quality vegan dessert selection that even non-vegans couldn’t get enough of.

Among Deanna’s many professional accomplishments, she was chosen to be the private chef for a well-known actor. Guests of her restaurant included the Princess of Monaco, the US Attorney Surgeon General and an award winning colon cancer research scientist, as well as many prominent guests from around the world. Deanna's signature healthy smoothie "The Green Goddess" landed her a guest appearance on a local TV show as well as radio interviews and several speaking engagements for Health related conventions.

While she loved catering and creating mouthwatering organic healthy plant based food, she found herself limited in her ability to reach a larger population.

 

Meet Daryl:

Daryl is no stranger to the Internet. 

As the former CEO/President of Prospect Planet Inc. The company launched at the time one of the first web based Customer Relationship Management Systems.  He led the company to nearly 13 million dollars in sales while attracting tens of thousands of customers. It was introduced during a time when there was a great need in the market. He continues to provide lead generation sales systems for companies in the multi billion dollar Direct Selling Industry.   

    Daryl believes the void that Deanna's Organic Kitchen will provide in the market along with the timing for delicious Organic Meals that are convenient and affordable is much greater at this time than it ever will be. He is excited about the company becoming an industry trend setter. 

 

While his professional credentials may be impressive, what is really amazing about Daryl’s story is the part about his incredible life transformation that not only changed his life, but impacted the lives of his entire family.  When Daryl made the decision to take control of his health and change the way he lived and ate.  He devoured everything in the way of information that he could learn about a plant-based lifestyle.  Because of the dramatic positive changes evident in his life, his family and friends are following his lead and are now on their own path to well being. 

 

 The Impact

Think about the global implications of what we are proposing… We believe that our positive impact on the health of peoples lives and our planet is amazing. We purchase fresh produce in bulk from local organic farmers, grow our own herbs. We use recyclable packaging. Our meals are prepared fresh in oven ready, Eco friendly containers.  We drastically reduce carbon footprint. Compare that to what is used in packaging alone from the average person’s 7-Day meal plan.  Furthering the sustainability of our kitchen, we grow our own herbs and sprouts while germinating our grains and seeds. We use Tower Gardens to save space and energy as well as recycling cooking water for gardening use and we practice composting.

Each meal is prepared with Organic ingredients and made with pure love, while never compromising flavor, balance and your health. Everything is prepared fresh with your choices from a 100% Organic Vegan and Vegetarian Menu. In this fast paced world being able to eat healthy organic food shouldn’t have to be compromised.

Our long term goals are to have a sustainable teaching Kitchen with an organic garden to educate children on Organic Farming and culinary skills as well as inviting students and retired persons as interns.  Our model encompasses the creation of new jobs and the education of a whole new era of Pure Food Chefs.

 

OUR ADVISORY BOARD:

Deanna’s Organic Kitchen is excited to join forces with a team of professionals we will call our “Wellness Advisory Team” including a Lifestyle Coach and Naturopathic Doctor who will be there to contribute their wisdom and valuable feedback along this journey.

 

 Other Ways You Can Help

Anything you can do to assist us in making this vision a reality is appreciated. You can do a lot of free things by clicking “LIKE” on our  Deanna's Organic Kitchen  Facebook Fan Page or Following us on Twitter at Deanna's Organic Kitchen Twitter Page and Pinterest and subscribe to our newsletter.  Feel free to spread the word to people that you believe would benefit. Share the love, impact the world…change some lives!

 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Here's the deal...

My name is Sarah Mayles. On April 13th 2014 I'll be running the London Marathon. Although its a dream to run such a world famous event in my own city it's not going to be easy!  As my long training runs are taking their toll it's time to make this all worthwhile by raising money for people to whom hard work is not just a personal challenge, but a necessity to daily living. Drinking plenty of water has been a mantra to me in the last few months, I'm lucky enough to know I can drink it fresh from the tap. However, for thousands of people living on the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua, clean water is a struggle to find. blueEnergy provides water, energy, sanitation, and climate change solutions to over 16,000 people and a key part of their model is to train local people to plan, build and maintain these solutions. I volunteered with them in 2007 and it was such an inspirational experience that I'm keen to support them in any way I can now that I'm back in my comfortable life in the UK.

So please help me reach my target and donate to my campaign for blueEnergy.  I need all the motivation I can get!

To spur me on even more, if I run it in over 4 hours I will give a full refund to the highest donor, as well as matching their donation to blueEnergy. However, if I run it in 3h30 or less I will ask the lowest donor (or joint donators) to double their donation (there's not much chance of that, but lets aim high!), so please dig deep!

Many thanks for your support -- and don't forget to forward this to anyone who you think might want to donate too!  

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $1,500 through this campaign to serve the people on the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua that are depending on us.  I could send you trinkets and knickknacks to thank you but that takes time and money and I'm pretty sure you'd rather have me and blueEnergy focus our attention and resources on changing lives in Nicaragua.

The Impact

Founded in 2004, blueEnergy works with isolated communities in Nicaragua to develop solutions that can be applied worldwide.  blueEnergy has been extensively recognized for its innovative work by CNN Heroes, Larry King Live, the Tech Awards, the Energy Globe Awards, and the Ashoka Fellowship.

blueEnergy have served over 16,000 people in Nicaragua and invites all of its supporters to come visit it in the field to see the impact firsthand.

You can read about blueEnergy's impact on the blueNews: http://bluenews.blueenergygroup.org/

Other Ways You Can Help,

You can help us spread the word by posting my campaign on your Facebook page and liking blueEnergy's page: https://www.facebook.com/like.blueEnergy.  If you want to follow blueEnergy's work, you can also subscribe to their newsletter, the blueNews: http://bluenews.blueenergygroup.org

If you like these pictures and want to see more from Will Martinez, please check him out at: http://willmzapata.com/

If you like the music and want to hear more from Mango Ghost and the Bluefields Sound System, please check them out at: http://bluefieldsound.bandcamp.com/

---

Please note that the specific impacts listed with each donation amount are for illustrative purposes only and that every gift to blueEnergy represents a gift to our total mission of improving health, capacity and economic development opportunities for the isolated poor.
story_txt:
Here's the deal...
My name is Sarah Mayles. On April 13th 2014 I'll be running the London Marathon. Although its a dream to run such a world famous event in my own city it's not going to be easy!  As my long training runs are taking their toll it's time to make this all worthwhile by raising money for people to whom hard work is not just a personal challenge, but a necessity to daily living. Drinking plenty of water has been a mantra to me in the last few months, I'm lucky enough to know I can drink it fresh from the tap. However, for thousands of people living on the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua, clean water is a struggle to find. blueEnergy provides water, energy, sanitation, and climate change solutions to over 16,000 people and a key part of their model is to train local people to plan, build and maintain these solutions. I volunteered with them in 2007 and it was such an inspirational experience that I'm keen to support them in any way I can now that I'm back in my comfortable life in the UK.
So please help me reach my target and donate to my campaign for blueEnergy.  I need all the motivation I can get!
To spur me on even more, if I run it in over 4 hours I will give a full refund to the highest donor, as well as matching their donation to blueEnergy. However, if I run it in 3h30 or less I will ask the lowest donor (or joint donators) to double their donation (there's not much chance of that, but lets aim high!), so please dig deep!
Many thanks for your support -- and don't forget to forward this to anyone who you think might want to donate too!  What We Need & What You GetI need to raise $1,500 through this campaign to serve the people on the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua that are depending on us.  I could send you trinkets and knickknacks to thank you but that takes time and money and I'm pretty sure you'd rather have me and blueEnergy focus our attention and resources on changing lives in Nicaragua.The ImpactFounded in 2004, blueEnergy works with isolated communities in Nicaragua to develop solutions that can be applied worldwide.  blueEnergy has been extensively recognized for its innovative work by CNN Heroes, Larry King Live, the Tech Awards, the Energy Globe Awards, and the Ashoka Fellowship.blueEnergy have served over 16,000 people in Nicaragua and invites all of its supporters to come visit it in the field to see the impact firsthand.You can read about blueEnergy's impact on the blueNews: http://bluenews.blueenergygroup.org/Other Ways You Can Help,You can help us spread the word by posting my campaign on your Facebook page and liking blueEnergy's page: https://www.facebook.com/like.blueEnergy.  If you want to follow blueEnergy's work, you can also subscribe to their newsletter, the blueNews: http://bluenews.blueenergygroup.orgIf you like these pictures and want to see more from Will Martinez, please check him out at: http://willmzapata.com/If you like the music and want to hear more from Mango Ghost and the Bluefields Sound System, please check them out at: http://bluefieldsound.bandcamp.com/---Please note that the specific impacts listed with each donation amount are for illustrative purposes only and that every gift to blueEnergy represents a gift to our total mission of improving health, capacity and economic development opportunities for the isolated poor.

story:
Thanks to all our backers, Felfil Evo is now available from our e-commerce felfil.com/shop !

 

Download Press Kit

 

 

 

An easy to use filament extruder, which will allow anyone to produce their 3D printer filament on their own, starting from industrial pellet, wrong 3d prints or recycled wastes.

You will be able to choose your filament colour, diameter and material, day by day, according to your creativity and your curiosity.


This is an open project, designed for everyone and developed in a Fablab, thought for makers but also for the less experienced. Currently, our aim is to start a small production in series of Felfil Evo and in order to realize this project we need your help!

 

 

 

Latest news

“An excellent and very cool looking design, that will be a great addition to any desktop: the Felfil Evo.” 3ders.org 

"3Dプリンターで出力したあとのゴミを集めて溶かしてフィラメントに戻せる「Felfil Evo.」" gigazine.net

 “Con este fabricador de filamento plástico, tu podrás hacerte tu propio filamento de una manera fácil y sencilla, además de barata. El Felfil Evo es lo que te faltaba…” impresion3daily.es

"You will be able to choose your filament colour, diameter and material, day by day, according to your creativity and your curiosity." open-electronics.org

"Recycle And Make Your Own 3D Printer Filament Using The Fulfil Evo Extruder"  geeky-gadgets.com

"..if you’re at all eco-minded, throwing away your useless creations, recyclable or not, is guilt-inducing. A group of Italian designers understands your pain, and the Earth’s." 3dprint.com

 

 

Advantages

 

All regular printers know that the filament spools are very expensive, about 35 €/Kg, especially if compared with the price of the same material in the form of industrial pellet, about 5 €/Kg. 

 

 

But the best is yet to come: using Felfil Evo you will extrude also your printing waste, opportunely shredded, making your custom filament with no cost. However, it is not only an economic issue, in fact you will be free to experiment new colours, compositions and materials. 

 

Moreover, you will be independent during the whole printing process, from the beginning to its end. Is that all? Not yet. The last advantage, the most important in our opinion, is that you can have a positive impact on the environment, recovering materials originally directed to landfill.

 

 

Why a basic kit?

Also Felfil Evo, like its predecessor Felfil, is an open project; but they use some important parts that are specifically made and are very expensive when handcrafted in single pieces. 

So we decided to offer you that parts into a truly unexpansive kit! 

All the other parts, like heaters an electronics (Arduino based and compatible), are easily reachable on the market and are almost the same used in your 3D printer.

 

 

 

Rewards

How does it work?

Felfil Evo is a small machine that takes inspiration, for its functioning, from the industrial extruders. It can extrude any thermoplastic polymer whose melting temperature does not exceed 300°C, but is tested for PLA and ABS. The material, like pellets or granules, is poured into a hopper from which the screw, specifically realized, fishes. The plastic, now dissolved by the high temperature, (generated from three heaters), comes out passing through a brass nozzle carefully dimensioned.

 

The lowering of the temperature, in the final stretch extrusion, allows greater consistency in obtaining the filament which, according to the nozzle, can be chosen among 1,75mm, 2,85mm or 3mm diameter.

Felfil Evo is designed in order to ensure an high accessibility to all its components and an easy maintenance and implementability.

The temperature control is obtained through a PID system, Arduino based, freely controllable and customizable by the user..
Using the easy menu you will be able to choose a preset or fine tuning your preferences.
 

 

Techs

How can Felfil Evo be so small and cheap?

Every design choice has been taken in order to reduce the final cost and to increase easy-to-use features, without compromising filament quality.

In fact, Felfil Evo uses a complex brass nozzle, that is able to progressively cool down the filament in a passive way. So the filament gets out from the nozzle with the correct diameter and a relatively cool temperature, so no more deformations would occur.

Thanks to this revolutionary nozzle we were able to not integrate any spooler or water tank, resulting in minor costs and dimension.

The screw specifically realized, compared with the diffused wood drills, ensures an higher pressure and raises up the filament quality.

 

 
You could choose the colour of the lateral sides of Felfil from a list of six colors.
 

Why Indiegogo? 

After finishing a crowdfunding campaign on Kickstarter, we joined the InDemand program. We think that the crowdfunding is the only way to realize our dream, without capitals. In order to keep the price of the extruder low, a small series is needed, and with your help, we will make it. 

We would like to demonstrate how a product made for makers and open may have a possible commercial future.

 

Featured

 

 

Team

We are Collettivo Cocomeri, a team of young designers from Turin, born during the Ecodesign Master Degree at the Politecnico of Turin, which is currently under TreataBit project, a developing path towards the creation of startups, under the same Politecnico.

We love authentic design, we think it’s very important to valorize wastes and to help people saving money: Felfil Evo was born with these features, and we hope you will love it!

 

Project Philosophy

Our cultural and educational background drove us to project using the open source philosophy, keeping an eye to eco-sustainability.  

The Felfil project was originally born as the main topic of our Master Degree Thesis in Ecodesign at Politecnico of Turin, and we are proud to show you its entire evolution.

 

 

We think that the open can be a right path in order to share and improve projects, with an high customization level for users. With this spirit Felfil Evo was born, raising opinions and desires from users who had the chance to test it: for this reason we decided to release it with a Creative Commons License.  

The theme of recycling has always been very important to us, this is the main reason why our project was born, and for which we care so much to make it happen: we hope it will be an opportunity for everyone to pollute less, saving time and money.

The first prototype, open and DIY, freely downloadable from the website felfil.com and already downloaded by almost one thousand makers, was for the majority made up of recovery components (for example we used a windscreen wiper), as we were motivated by the desire to give a second life to old and unused components.

 

Felfil obtained the following recognitions:

 


Obviously, in order to ensure everyone better usability, safety and quality, Felfil Evo was developed: an open source heart in an industrialized body

 

 

Timeline

 

Scenario

Making a deep analysis about the actual 3D printing consumabilies production system, we found some critical issues.

Why do we always have to use new materials, which often come from raw resources, that could be natural or oil-based, when we have got a really large quantity of plastic waste around us? Why can’t we reuse failed prints or domestic plastic wastes or also industrial materials, which often come directly from waste processing ad are really cheap? 

In order to find an answer and a solution to all this questions we have designed Felfil!

 

 

Risks and challenges

Given that Felfil Evo is based on an open and widespread project, we were able to solve most of the problems of the first one.
Moreover, we worked hard in order to find reliability suppliers, to ensure the quality of the components and to facilitate shipping operations. Indeed, we chose suppliers of mechanic components settled in Turin in order to be in close contact with them, while the electronics components suppliers are global. However, we tested both the parts.
We are developing, helped by the community and by Fablab Turin, a custom electronic board, improving the quality of our project. This is our next goal.

story:
Dos Cuernos Tequila

No Tequila, No Life. Know Tequila, Know Life. 

Our names are Angel Gallegos, Peter Trevino and Sylvester Palacios, and we have a dream to launch our own tequila in the next year. Is starting a tequila company a new thing? Of course not. However, we're not celebrities or high income individuals starting a tequila company just for kicks. We're three smart, entrepreneurial Hispanics that love our background, heritage, and especially tequila, and want to bring our tequila to the U.S. to share with our friends and family and eventually grow it into something special.  

We have a brand that is snowballing on social media, merchandise that is turning heads and people that we just met already ordering bottles by the cases. The caveat is we don't have the funding to bring in our first order to the states - that's why we’re here.  And that's where you come in.

We've been progressing in stages, documenting our steps along the way. Now, imagine you being a part of this endeavor. One day, you'll see our bottle at the liquor store or bar and you'll be able to tell the person next to you that it's because of you that tequila is on that shelf and being enjoyed by millions. How cool will that be?! We're here to give you tequila that you'll be proud of, and you'll be glad to know that it was your dollars that helped to create it.

We're a registered U.S. company. We have a logo, chosen bottle design, and are currently working on our licenses to import and sell tequila. We need funding to assist with the first runs of our tequila.

What do you get in return? 

  • The pride of knowing that your dollars helped to bring this premium tequila to the states - simply, being able to say that you're an original funder;
  • Receiving stylish Dos Cuernos swag;
  • Being featured in our social media posts and photos;
  • Invitation(s) to our launch party;
  • Promo opportunities; and more.

Why aren't we asking for bank loans, private equity or other type of institutional financial commitments? 

Easy! We want to maintain as much control and stake in our company as possible. It's been our creativity, ideas, style design, pacing and marketing that have elevated our brand to what it is today. We want to keep it that way as we know that once our tequila is in the states, it's going to be our ideas that take it to the next level.

  • Check out our social media pages and website.
  • Check out our merchandise. 

If there weren't risks involved, it wouldn't be interesting or exciting.

Why would you trust three guys from Austin, Texas, starting a tequila company? Honestly, I don't have a good answer for that, and I probably wouldn’t trust them right off the bat. However, the unknown is what makes this endeavor so exciting. 

The only perceived risk is Dos Cuernos' failure to launch. I am here to tell you that won’t happen. The only unknown here is how big this brand will get. The only true risk is not investing with us and regretting that you didn't help to originate Dos Cuernos Tequila.

Dos Cuernos founders Angel, Pete and Sylvester bring a mix of PR, marketing, recruiting, management, sales, real estate and service industry expertise that somehow make the right combustion of creativity and project management that is propelling our company forward. We have a plan, and we have a brand, all we need is your dollars to bring this tasty adult agave beverage across the border. From there, just like you would a newly planted agave, stand back and watch it grow.

How else can you help? 

Dollars are great as well as word of mouth. If you can’t help us financially, go like us on Facebook, buy some merchandise, follow us on Instagram, and help spread the word of this distinguished drink.

For any questions or comments, email us at doscuernos@outlook.com.

story:
IBE Ministries was founded in 2005 and became a 501c3 faith-based, charitable, nonprofit ministry in 2008. We are dedicated to providing care, comfort and solutions to all families that struggle with substance abuse by combining faith-based and 12 step principles.

We operate fully on donations so your contribution large or small, makes a difference in the lives of those who suffer.

John Michael Weber,

President/Founder
IBE Ministries, Inc.

Short Summary

My name is John Michael Weber and I am founder of IBE Ministries, Inc. We are dedicated to providing help to the community and families that struggle with substance abuse. As with all charitable nonprofits, one of our hardest tasks is raising money. We are launching this campaign in hopes of getting the start up funding we need to open the In the Blink of an Eye Thrift Store & Center for Solutions, Care & Hope.

The Thrift Store will provide affordable items for those less fortunate and generate a small but necessary cash flow for IBE Ministries, Inc. The adjacent Center for Solutions Care & Hope will provide counseling services and pastoral care for those families in the grips of addiction.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations will give us the start up funds necessary to make this happen. John Michael Weber is a Chaplain, Certified Addictions Counselor and Author and has made his books available as perks for your donations.

Rest assured all monies go into the operating costs of IBE Ministries, Inc.

 

The Impact

You can make a difference and without you, we cannot. Please help us help those in need!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially, we ask for your prayers and encouragement. Please use the Indigo share tools to reach out for us!

story:
The Brew Pub ( See the Gallery )

We all look forward to having a chance to realize a  dream or a passion some time in our life. For Greg and I that moment happened spontaneously while we were having a brew in the local pub. And two weeks later we had a business plan. We set out and found the perfect location and building. Our goal is to give the community a family friendly place to hang out, enjoy a craft beer and great pizza. We are strongly motivated to work with the visual and performing artists in the region and beyond to use our location to showcase their work and talent.
We will be selling beer brewed in the brew pub as well as beer from the small breweries in the South West. We will also hope to represent the local wineries who do make some fabulous wines.
We have poured our life time savings into this project and are so very exited that it is all coming together. We really appreciate the support from our friends and fans who have expressed their confidence and keep telling us that this is exactly what this town needs.


The Pizza Oven


The Pizza Oven Has become the topic of the month as we realized that we can not take a chance with a budget  friendly oven. We all love good and healthy food and that is why we must have the wood fired clay oven. It is its soul purpose to heat and bake the pizza to perfection. It is the tool of the trade and therefore we need your help to expand our budget so we can install one of these great and timeless inventions. 

We appreciate all the help we can get. You can spread the word about our campaign or make a donation yourself of any size. You can be assured that it will be put to good use and it will go a long way to help us realizing our dream.

We really appreciate the support from our friends and fans who have expressed their confidence and keep telling us that this is exactly what this town needs.The Pizza OvenThe Pizza Oven Has become the topic of the month as we realized that we can not take a chance with a budget  friendly oven. We all love good and healthy food and that is why we must have the wood fired clay oven. It is its soul purpose to heat and bake the pizza to perfection. It is the tool of the trade and therefore we need your help to expand our budget so we can install one of these great and timeless inventions.  We appreciate all the help we can get. You can spread the word about our campaign or make a donation yourself of any size. You can be assured that it will be put to good use and it will go a long way to help us realizing our dream.

story:
Combining a Passion for Soap Making & Humanity

Hi, my name is Kenna. I've been making soap for the last ten years. Over the last three years, I owned and operated a vegan bath and body company named Amathia Soapworks. This fall, I discovered how much of a difference soap making could really make in the world around us. In no time flat, I started the process to transition to creating a new business model where:

  • all profits go towards charitable endeavors with a featured organization every quarter, spreading the love both locally and globally.
  • free monthly soap making workshops are provided to organizations that work with low-income or poverty-stricken women to help them provide for their families.
  • every bar sold is another bar put into the hands of those who need it, using shelters and missions as distributors.

With that, Gratitude Soapery was born.

Why Indiegogo?

While I have invested every dime we have to spare, and have been selling inventory and unneeded supplies from Amathia Soapworks, there are still some funding holes in the woodwork. This campaign will make a huge difference to helping Gratitude Soapery take flight.

Gratitude Soapery has no credit history or debt, and we want it to stay that way. The funding from this campaign will help to:

  • Make a bulk purchase of ingredients needed to make bigger batches of soap for both local shelters and Gratitude Soapery to pursue wholesale, which in turn creates the ability to help more people. Ingredients like food grade vegetable oils, sodium hydroxide, cosmetic colorants, and essential oils. ($2000)
  • Fund the purchase of printed soap boxes that highlight the company's mission and goals, facilitating a better product presentation, a special experience for the receiver, and more efficient production practice by cutting packaging time in half. ($1500)
  • Upgrade equipment to handle the production process more efficiently. Our current equipment, like our cutters and batching process, handle batches of 50 bars or less with ease, an upgrade will allow us to move towards 120+ bar batches, doubling efficiency. ($1000)

Making strides in efficiency will allow me to spend more time volunteering, and creating materials for our free workshops that will also be available for download online.

The Sweet Perks

With perks for both soap makers and soap aficionados, you are sure to find something to tickle your fancy.

Pocket Inspiration Cards come with every bar of Gratitude soap, and will also come with a handwritten thank you note.

Eleven varieties of Gratitude Soapery bars are available, with names that remind you how sweet you are, like Authentic, Clever, and Fierce. Each bar is vegan friendly, palm free, and contains over 25% African shea butter. All varieties have endured the production process and will be made fresh for you!

To learn more about Gratitude Soapery and the debut line of eleven soaps, please visit the website here: www.gratitudesoapery.com

For the first time ever, I'm selling intellectual property from Amathia Soapworks including proprietary formulas. You will be granted exclusive rights to use and sell these formulas as your own in exchange for your support. They will never be available again.

To learn more about the other perks for soap makers or my experience in our industry, please check out my website for Amathia Soapworks here: www.amathiasoapworks.com

Already Making a Difference

Gratitude Soapery launched on November 1st with the shoestring funding from my original company, and is already:

  • Donating soap locally. Over 350 bars have been donated to local organizations like Operation Breakthrough, with another donation of 600 more bars being delivered by the end of November.
  • Hosting free workshops. November 20th marks the first free workshop with women, where we will cover the basics of soap making and creating home cleaning products with food grade ingredients to cut the costs of maintaining a healthy home. 
  • Donating globally. Partnering with the Lovin' Soap Project (www.lovinsoapproject.org), $2 to $4 from every bar sold until March 31, 2014 will help teach women in Haiti soap making in order for them to start their own businesses, creating a sustainable circle providing both education and better hygiene.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're asking for help because we know what it's like to scrape by, but know the value in helping others and doing what you can to make a difference in the world. 

If you want to help but can't contribute, please consider:

  • Telling your friends and family about this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools, especially via social media like Facebook
  • Telling people about what Gratitude Soapery is doing by sharing our website (www.gratitudesoapery.com)

Special Thanks

  • Thank you to Kindling, who did the original video for me for Amathia Soapworks & is much better than my attempt! (http://vimeo.com/73661783)
  • Thank you to my friends, family (especially my husband), fans, and customers from Amathia Soapworks who are following me into my passion.
  • Thank you to Lucky Break Consulting for helping me create wholesale materials for Gratitude Soapery's future (www.luckybreakconsulting.com)
  • Music featured is Black Rainbow by Pitx

story:
After being so angry on the roads all the time, we're finally doing something and making a change.


We Want Change! On our roads.

We are tired of being honked at, high beamed at, having fast cars cut into our lanes, taxi drivers driving dangerously and recklessly,  showing off our middle finger, shouting vulgarities. And just being uncultured as a whole.

The Gentlemen Movement is a social initiative that aims to cultivate and instill road courtesy and respect and is our way to help solve a problem of road rage that we all face in Singapore. 

http://thegentlemenmovement.org

What We Need & What You Get

In order for us to achieve our social vision, this is what we need:

 The team will need $15,900 to make this entire campaign possible. 

The $15,900 will go into production of collaterals that substantiates the movement. 

-  650 bow-tie for cars

-  650 handbook 

-  650 briefcases

-  650 TGM car decals

-  650 Briefcase decals

-  Shipping of bow ties

-  Delivery Costs to send the entire package to your house/office.

There are more than 970,000 vehicles on our Singapore roads.

If 1 out of 1500 cars put up this BOW TIE, a positive effect will happen. 

We will stop being angry on the roads. And that will stop the unnecessary accidents and deaths. 

    Risks & Challenges

    This project is definitely not all smooth sailing.

    We started this campaign in December 2013.  Being full time workers ourselves, we have to juggle both work commitments and this social project. On top of that, we need to convince our families and friends that they had to play a part in effecting a positive change on our roads.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cant contribute monetarily, and get a package for your friend or family, that doesn't mean you can't play a part. J

    Play a part by:
    1.  Playing the video. And sharing it on your social media platforms. Remember, every share counts!

    2.  Share this indiegogo page and get your family or friends to contribute!

    Simple isnt it? :)

story:
The brief

I am raising $1,002 for travel to and from the isle of Hispaniola in the Caribbean. Would you be able to contribute $25 for my 25th birthday to help me complete this trip?

About the trip

I'm Eric G. 25 year-old Argentine very interested in social equality, enabling the pursuit of happiness for all and eradicating extreme poverty in Latin America. 

I embarked on this two year journey on December 2012 with a dual purpose in mind:

1. I believe in the potential that social businesses have to improve the livelihoods of those with the least and effectively eradicate extreme poverty. As I travel I explore possible business opportunities, establish connections and actively study and learn from past and current organizations.

2. In 2012 I joined Aynah seeing the possibilities this organization has in improving standards of living around the globe through empowering groups to undertake cooperative projects. As I travel, I spread the work of this organization on a volunteer basis, finding new projects and visiting existing ones.

Trip thus far

I began this trip by moving back to Argentina to study business operations in Latin America. 

After 7 months, and a short visit to the U.S, I embarked on my current journey, heading to El Salvador and south from there - Honduras, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, Panama, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, and currently Paraguay. 

It has been 11 months in the making. I work on rural farms for about three weeks at a time and have lots of interesting conversations with farm workers, people in the communities, cooperatives, other organizations, other volunteers, universities, etc. I lost about 20 pounds, gave first aid to a volunteer who chopped off his thumb with a machete, got denied entry into Panama (only to be allowed in once my bus left me), visited some incredible ruins, partook in Bolivian Carnaval and indigenous ceremonies and saw and tried more fruits, vegetables and foods than I ever realized existed.

Every country I have travelled to has proven to be an enriching experience, being able to establish valuable connections, explore several business ventures, and find new opportunities for Aynah projects. I hope to continue this enriching experience to the very final leg of the trip: the Caribbean.

Going forward

I hope to visit the Dominican Republic and Haiti to allow for the same types of exploration. As two of the most poverty stricken countries in Latin America, the work I aim to undertake is particularly relevant there. Reaching these countries, however, proves to be a challenge due to a financial barrier.

I have self-funded my trip in its entirety, working alongside locals in rural areas in exchange for food and housing, and spending an average of $150 a month - mostly on transportation. 

I need $1,002 for plane travel to and from the isle of Hispaniola, where I will then spend two months searching for possibilities to work with social enterprises and possible projects to fund via Aynah. Would you be able to help me reach this goal with a 25 dollar 25th-birthday gift? 

Besides financial contributions I am continuously searching for possible connections with non-profits, social entrepreneurs, and any movement I can join leading to the eradication of extreme poverty in Latin America. I highly appreciate any such connections, information or links for organizations in the Dominican Republic and Haiti.

Saludos y un fuerte abrazo!

story:
Our Mission

As a college student, it can be tough to get a good night’s sleep. We are launching Campus Sleeps in partnership with Nature’s Sleep to provide mattresses and other comfortable bedding solutions right to your door when you need them at student-friendly pricing.

By supporting the Campus Sleeps campaign, you will receive a memory foam mattress at an unbeatable deal in just a few easy steps:

1. Choose the “perk” with the size mattress that fits your needs.

2. Complete the IndieGoGo payment process with your name, contact information, and shipping address. If you do not know your shipping address just yet, no worries. Simply put your current/home address in and after the campaign ends we will contact you to confirm your address. 

3. Directly after the close of the campaign, we will contact you to obtain a shipping address and preferred ship date for your products. Shipping takes 1-2 days and can be scheduled for any date - ship your mattress as soon as you know you’ll be at your new address!

4. Your mattress will arrive in a vacuum-pressed, compressed package and delivered by FedEx (all shipping and delivery charges are included in the price of the order). As soon as you open the mattress, it will begin to decompress to its actual size.

5. You’re all set! If you would like to buy other products, including pillows, bed frames, and slippers, you can do so on this page as well by beginning the payment process again and selecting the appropriate perk.


The Nature’s Sleep Diamond Gel Memory Foam Mattress uniquely delivers a great feel, superior comfort and heat dissipation unlike any other gel memory foam mattress. Our gel spheres capture the heat and release it away from your body for a comfortable night’s sleep.

The Mattress.

The Foundation.

At Nature’s Sleep, we believe in a healthier home for you – and the home we all share. From sustainable processes to safer materials, we do what's right to protect you and conserve our precious global resources. We're committed to a responsible and unselfish environmental philosophy, not to mention your peace of mind.

Mattress Size  Current Price  Original Price
Twin $449 $1800
Twin XL $549 $2000
Full $599 $2200
Queen $699 $2400
King $899 $3000

What's the difference between a Nature’s Sleep memory foam mattress and the nationally advertised mattress – or any other memory foam mattress?

We know, it's confusing. There are many memory foam mattresses on the market making many different claims. Every brand has its own formula – like Coke and Pepsi. But not all are created equal. We think ours provides the superior combination of support, comfort, affordability and sustainability. And using the latest technology available, our mattresses are specifically designed to promote better health and well-being. Our mattresses are also CertiPur approved where most of our competitors are not. (Did we mention ours does it for less than half the price?)

I don't know where I'm living yet. Can I still order?

Yes! Just put in a temporary address. We will email you at the end of the campaign and you can set up delivery whenever you decide!

Will the mattress or foundation fit my bedroom furniture and frame?

Our mattresses and foundations will fit most standard US-size bed furniture and frames. The best way to tell is: does your current mattress fit, and is it the same size as ours?

Does the cover already come on the mattress upon delivery?

Yes, it does.

Would it damage the mattress to leave it packaged for a long period?

It will not be a problem at all as the mattress will be shipped vac-packed inside its packaging and preserved until it is opened.

What are the dimensions of each size bed?

All of our Memory Foam Mattresses are in standard sizes such as below:

Twin: 38" x 75"

Twin XL: 38" x 80"

Full: 54" x 75"

Queen: 60" x 80"

King: 76" x 80"

Can I use my own box spring or foundation?

If your previous foundation is in relatively good condition and is the same size as the mattress you ordered from us, you can use it. If it is not in good condition, in a different size or another reason, you can purchase a new foundation from us.

How can I get the status of my order?

Once you've received your order confirmation, please wait for an email with your FedEx tracking number. Once received, you can go to www.FedEx.com to track your delivery. All orders usually process within three business days. You should receive a tracking number within seven business days.

How will I know that you’ve received my order?

Once you’ve placed your order, we'll send you an email confirmation. Please print or save the email for your records.

How are mattresses delivered?

Glad you asked (because it's pretty cool). All mattresses are shipped compressed and vacuum-packed and delivered by FedEx. This means that your mattress will arrive in a much smaller box than you're probably expecting. Don't be alarmed! It's just that we're using cutting-edge technology. As soon as you unpack your mattress, it will decompress to its normal size. Please make sure you open it in the room where you'll use it. And watch it open – you'll like what you see!

What are the mattress shipping weights and dimensions?

Typical shipping weights for mattresses range from 50lbs to 135lbs. The mattresses comes vacuum packed in a carton with measurements that range from a Twin 14” x 14” x 40” to a King 18" x18” x 78”.

Are there any shipping or delivery charges?

Shipping or delivery charges are included in the cost of the product.

Does Nature's Sleep products come with warranties?

All Nature’s Sleep products are fully warrantied with proof of purchase from the Nature's Sleep website or an authorized retailer. Below is a brief guide on warranty lengths. Please check the product page for details on your specific item.

If you have additional questions, see the full FAQ listing here or email campus.sleeps@gmail.com.

Shipping or delivery charges are included in the cost of the product. 
Does Nature's Sleep products come with warranties?
All Nature’s Sleep products are fully warrantied with proof of purchase from the Nature's Sleep website or an authorized retailer. Below is a brief guide on warranty lengths. Please check the product page for details on your specific item.
If you have additional questions, see the full FAQ listing here or email campus.sleeps@gmail.com.

story:
❝the wood design feeder that goes with the petbed❞

Petsmood feeder is the appealing feeder for fashion furry friends.

We work to enhance the use of design in multidisciplinary contexts and mix innovative functions.

Petsmood is the story of our great love for pets

Gianluca, co founder, realized thanks to its dog, Jack,  that there was a need to let restbed for pets become real furnitures in our homes.

Jack our mascot looking at the feeder


Pets are today real members of our families and deserve to live with us comfortably: that is why we created this collection.


Petsmood® represents the choice to create design for Humans & Pets and to transform the concept of a bedrest for your pet in a real element of design and comfort, under the sign of the living together.

The first collection of Petsmood is composed of pet rests with natural wood finishes which are meant to be real furnitures in your living room.

Dogs and Cats find their comfort meanwhile their owners satisfy their love for hand-made and esthetics furnitures.

DOGS MODELS

Proud French Bulldog seating on  Piedato


Having fun under the Tavolato


Sharpeis on Divanato

"A large choice of colors"

The collection exists in 12 different colors of wood veneers and 12 colors of fabrics for cushions, that you can associate freely to coordinate with your home interior.


CATS MODELS

Cats on their Saltato Furniture


Life is cool from the top of the Intellato


With Petsmood, you can be proud of your petbed!

Fabrication of the furnitures and the cushions are hand-made with care and know-how.


Since our furry friends asked more and told us « why not the coordinated feeder», we created it and hope you will give us the opportunity to launch the production.

A feeder with clean lines

«never imagined it would be a dog feeder»

  • you can coordinate it with our furnitures, because it is available in the 12 same wood finishes of the Petsmood collection
  • you can have it stand alone as a masterpiece in your living room.

    • «You won’t need to hide your dogbowl anymore»

    The inside of the feeder is treated with finish of PTFE  and a top hides its function when needed.


We need your support to launch the mass production of the feeder, furnitures, create new products, and make our collection well-known by participating in world wide events.

    • Goal 1 - 35 000 dollars: To optimize the mass production and marketing of the feeder furniture and participation to important events
    • Goal 2 - 70 000 dollars: To concept, design and prototype the first production of new models of furnitures with the essential ressources

    • Goal 3 - 150 000 dollars: To improve all our marketing ressources, to launch the mass production of all new models and  to participate to signficant world wide events in our business sector.

Visualiser la traduction en Français

Feeder Size


Size 1: 8 cm high, adapted for small/medium dogs

You can choose between the 12 wood colors of the collection.

                Pre-order it now and save more than 30%

Don't worry about deciding on a color right now - we'll reach out to you at the end of the campaign and find out which color you'd like!


Core Team

Our core team is united by design and pet love and supported by the help of the partnership of many creative and logical minds.


Production Plan of the Feeder



What can we offer when you support us




We thank also friends and family for their support, our partners and suppliers for their fidelity and passion and everyone who is  sharing with us this pet dream world.

story:
Hello friends and family!

As many of you know, I spent fall and winter of 2013 in Lyantonde, Uganda studying the intersection of gender and natural resource management. Not only was this an amazing educational experience, but it also gave me the opportunity to create relationships and put names and faces to this area of research that I had previously only read about in academic papers and books. 

Much of the research I had done both prior to arriving in Uganda and what I witnessed during my time there was extremely disheartening.  Uganda has the highest rate of deforestation in East Africa. The country is losing forests at a rate of about 80,000 hectares per year —approximately the size of New York City’s land mass — and could lose most of its forest cover in the next 40 years if deforestation continues at the current rate. This deforestation and the resulting loss of carbon-sequestration have caused a change in climate and rainfall has decreased significantly. Water sources are limited while soil erosion destroys farmland throughout the country. 

Those who suffer from environmental degradation the most are small-scale farmers, who in Uganda’s case are predominantly female. Approximately 90% of rural women work in agriculture versus 53% of men. These women, especially the poor, work almost double the time of men in the community, yet have little formal control over the crops they produce and the land they work on. As the backbone of the home, women are primary food providers and spend much of their time in search of firewood and water for cooking, placing them in constant contact with natural resources. When these resources are diminished, it is women who are the first to feel the effects. They are the ones who walk the extra 5 miles to find fuel wood and water in order to provide food for their families, and risk sexual assault as these walks grow longer.

During my stay, I had the opportunity to spend time speaking and learning from rural women in the area. From these conversations and friendships, I learned about the fierce resilience of rural Ugandan women, despite the many struggles they face on a daily basis. As I have learned more about Africa, I have observed that there is a general perception of the "African woman" as being vulnerable and weak, someone who is in need of "empowerment" and saving. My experience interacting with women in Uganda proved this stereotype false over and over again. I learned that despite their struggles, there are Ugandan women that are taking matters into their own hands, placing their hands in the soil, and planting trees. 

We need your help!

This is where you come in. I had the privilege of spending time with two amazing women's led reforestation groups: The Kimuli Women's Group and the Tukwaszwamu Group. These groups were such a beacon of hope and inspiration during my experience in Uganda, and I with this fundraiser I am hoping to provide some financial support for the work that they do. Here is their story. 

Tukwaszwamu Group

Ms. Kolama Mariam is a widowed farmer living in the Lyantonde Districtof Southern Uganda, and the founder of the Tukwaszmanu Group. Mariam has managed to facilitate the planting of 9 acres of trees on hillsides surrounding Lyantonde’s main watershed, and intends to keep planting.  After her husband died, Mariam was left with a large portion of land to tend between herself and her children. Because her family owned a small shop in the trading center, she spent much of her time away from her land. As a result, people in the community began chopping the hillsides and burning trees for charcoal. Although she knew this was occurring, she felt that there was little she could do to stop it. She saw deforestation was occurring throughout the region, and knew her community was struggling because of it. Mariam drafted a project proposal for the restoration of bare hills surrounding the water shed through tree planting. After the project was approved, Mariam recruited other community members, mostly other widows, to form the Tukwaszwamu group, or “let’s all come together” in the Luganda language. After receiving funding for seedlings from the United Nations Development Program, the group began planting up the hillsides.

“We looked for people who were somewhat vulnerable, and widows,” says Mariam. She told me that at first, the main motivation for people to join the group was poverty eradication, as the trees would be cut and sold for income once they grew older.With money as motivation, the group continued planting, despite many trees serving as snacks for grazing cattle and villagers continuing to bush burn periodically. Gradually, Mariam began to notice the subtle benefits of the trees as their roots sank deeper into the ground, holding the soil together. Later, the group was able to distribute seedlings to the community and educate people about the importance of planting trees, not only for income, but for restoring the health of their environment. “People are becoming sensitized about growing trees,” says Mariam.  "We have come up with seminars to inform people about the importance of trees and the disadvantages of cutting trees. We have learned a lot from growing trees in our community.” She says that these trees have had specific benefits for women. “When women have eucalyptus trees around their house they no longer have to walk long distances in search of firewood.”

The Kimuli Women's Group

The Kimuli Women’s Group is an agricultural and social cooperation of 32 women that was formed in 2000. These women travel to different communities to perform drama and music to sensitize people about HIV and challenges that rural women face. Olivia, the vice chairperson and founder of the group says that she started the group so that women in the area can be joined under one umbrella. “It has created unity among women. If a woman gets a problem, she can be helped by the group.” One of their intentions is to generate income so that they could pay their children’s school fees. One of the initial goals of the group had been to reforest the hillsides in the area so that they could later sell them for income generation, while also improving the soil quality of their farms. They later added the drama aspect of the group in order to create social change surrounding the issues that rural women face. 

What really amazed me about these two groups was that they were created and run by women themselves. They build on existing structures rather than imposing new and complicated projects that run the risk of doing more damage than good. Prior to traveling to Uganda, I had heard an array of development and empowerment project horror stories, in which an Western NGO attempts to empower or develop local communities without really understanding the situation that the people live in. These groups know what they need, they know how to do it, they just need financial support. Through planting trees, these projects address women's empowerment, poverty eradication, and improving the health of the environment that supports them. It astounded me that more of these groups are not recognized, and that I had not heard more about these kinds of projects. It showed me that much of the work that women do is invisible. Like roots, they are Uganda's life support system, yet the work they do lies out if sight and is seldom recognized by the rest of the world. 


The fundraiser

With your help, I am hoping to raise $1000 USD for the Kimuli Women's Group and the Tukwaszwamu Group. On June 13th, I am going to run my race, the Skagway Half-Marathon here in mountainous Skagway, Alaska and am hoping that you will sponsor me. I thought that this would be a good way to use my passion of running and connecting with nature, as a means to support these two groups financially. They are in need of funding in order to buy more seedlings and set up more nurseries where they can grow the trees. These trees will then be grown and sold as as poles, timber, and fruit while also protecting the soil on hillsides. The Kimuli Women's Group also mentioned that they are in need more more supplies for setting up their drama acts, as right now they are performing on their own time and dime, which has been extremely difficult. I understand that in donating to charities there is a risk of your money not going where it is intended to go, so this is a great opportunity to know that your donations will be directly benefiting not only these women, but their families and the communities at large. 
The donations will be sent to RACOBAO, the organization that I worked with during my time in Uganda, as they are in connection with both and are how I first was able to come in contact with these groups. Please visit their website and learn about all the awesome work that they are doing.

story:
Hey everyone, my name is Duane Lyons and I'm from Ontario, Canada. I'm a professional chef with 15+ years experience. In 2007, I began to focus on a more nutritious lifestyle and with that I began to educate myself about the meat industry and the negative effects it has on our health, the environment and our animals. I decided to removed animal products from my plate completely. For the past 10 years, I have developed so many amazing vegan dishes that prove that a healthy plant-based diet is just as exciting and delicious. Now, we would love to share some of those dishes with all of you!

Short Summary

  •  We are The Earthling, a modern eatery with a universe of infinite delicious plant-based possibilities! We decided to focus on a mobile food truck instead of a single location. This way we're free to move around & be available to everyone.
  • We plan to rotate regularly at local markets, parks & universities in Kitchener, Waterloo, Cambridge and Guelph. You can also find us this year at several festivals in the GTA.
  • We are raising funds to help get our venture off the ground. Help 'The Earthling' become a vessel to deliver our beloved cuisine to everyone!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking for $15,000 to help with startup costs. Any funds collected will go to things like permits, certifications and inspections as well equipping our truck with the necessary equipment and supplies.
  • Take a look at our fun perks section. Choose between 'The Earthling' swag, discount/value items along with many other cool rewards!

Our Mission

  • As a vegan eatery, we strive to expand our audiences & become a progressive establishment where  everyone can come together eat, talk, laugh and connect. 
  • With your contribution, The Earthling can serve its community by providing a healthy alternative to comfort/junk food with a truly modern style cuisine. We are so excited and thankful to work with our backers! Together, we can all be a part of supporting clean eating for our health, the planet and the animals. <3

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We realize not everyone can back us but it would be a tremendous help if you shared our campaign with your friends and family on social media.

You can also help by liking us on Facebook and following us on Twitter.

https://www.facebook.com/theearthlingcuisine/

https://twitter.com/TheEarthlingV

We will be posting updates throughout the next 30 days. Keep an eye out for our upcoming video with footage from our Taste Party :) 

Thank you so much for joining us in our launch!

Duane & Stacey

story:
PARTNER WITH US TO SAVE LIVES

There are over 7.3 billion people in the world today and approximately 780,000,000 don't have access to safe drinking water.  That is 1 out of 10 people don't have access to safe drinking water.  Show that you care and partner with us to get H2gO purifiers to the people that need them the most this holiday season.


Make a difference this holiday season and support a family in need of safe drinking water for NOT 1, NOT 2 BUT FOR 10 YEARS!!.  The gift that keeps on giving.  We are partnering with Operation Blessing to get our H2gO purifiers to the people that need them the most.


Globally, 98% of water-related deaths occur in developing nations and most of these deaths occur in children under the age of 5 (water.org).  Help us provide safe water for people who need it most. Your donation shows that you care! You are helping supply safe water for a family of four for 10 years using our hand held water purifier and common salt.

A MESSAGE FROM AQUA RESEARCH PRESIDENT, RODNEY HERRINGTON


This technology was developed, in part, from funding provided by contributors to an earlier Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign.  Help us get our life saving technology to those who need it most and give the gift that continues to keep giving for NOT 1, NOT 2 BUT FOR 10 YEARS!!

The H2gO Purifier retails for $100 and is available globally for outdoors enthusiasts. Aqua Research is offering H2gO Purifiers at a significant discount to help as many people as possible gain access to safe water. Help us help them!


CHLORINATION SAVES LIVES

The H2gO Purifier is a hand held water purifier that fits in a shirt pocket and creates a powerful chlorine solution using common salt. The chlorine solution kills water-borne pathogens when added to a water supply.  The H2gO purifier works off an internal cell phone battery that can be recharged via the built-in solar panel or by a USB wall charger (all included).  Why chlorination?  Chlorination of water began in the United States in 1908 in New Jersey and was rapidly adopted across the U.S.  Chlorination eliminated Typhoid Fever within a few short years (figure 1-1), helped eliminate cholera in Haiti in recent years, and helped to end the Ebola virus epidemic in Africa in 2014. Show that “I Care” this holiday season and give the gift that will keep on giving  and supply a family of four with lifesaving water for 10 years!


Approximately 3.3 million people die each year from water-related health problems and 84% of these deaths are in children younger than 14 years (water.org).  This is why we are partnering with Operation Blessing to get our lifesaving water purification technology to the people that need it the most with the only consumable being common salt.  Help us give the gift of safe water to people in developing nations and show that “I Care” ! Your donation will help provide safe water for a family of four for NOT 1, NOT 2 BUT FOR 10 YEARS!!


SUSTAINABLE

More than two-thirds of people without an improved water source live on less than $2 a day, which is why a prominent microbiologist at the University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill has noted that “85% of people in developing countries do not stay with water treatment programs that require an on-going consumable component.” Aqua Research technology used in the H2gO purifier provides the highest levels of purification with the only consumable being common salt.  The H2gO purifier is sustainable and durable and the most cost effective option for developing nations.  It uses 10,000 times less energy than boiling water.  Consider partnering with us and Operation Blessing to help a family of four to protect their health through the gift of safe water as a part of your holiday giving.


SAFE WATER FOR DISASTER RELIEF

Emergency situations can arise anywhere. NGOs are some of the first groups to arrive in these areas.  Since the purifier was commercially launched in the spring of 2015, the H2gO purifier has been distributed to make a difference in regions including Nepal after the April 2015 earthquake, Iraq Kurdistan, and Syria to relieve the suffering of refugees, Cayman Islands, Cuba, El Salvador, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras, Japan, Kenya, Kurdistan Liberia, Mexico, Peru, and Sierra Leone,  through Operation Blessing alone.

story:
It's going to be a combination of theatre and party; sexy and classy. Madame Noir, herself has ensured us to have the best table to see it all, for my birthday! It would be my upmost pleasure to spend it with people I love. The night will be fabulous, so I don't mind if you bring a plus one or two, just please confirm. 

See here for a taste. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HcaCyo7x8QQ

More info: http://www.designmynight.com/london/whats-on/burlesque-cabaret/nude-noir-chapter-17

Attire: I am joking. Please don't come all nude. I feel like, I do need to say that for some of my crazy friends. HA! Dress code is strict, so dress up! Head pieces and mask are in order as well. For ideas: https://uk.pinterest.com/nudenoir/nude-noir-dress-code/

It is a ticked event, but Madame Noir has given all my birthday guest a discount of £25 per person (usually tickets are £40); which is why I set up this Indiegogo. Tickets need to go through me, but I won't take cash. I don't want to go through the hassle of money or account numbers etc... It is my birthday after, please don't make me stress.  ;)

If you love me and are able to come, confirm by making the transfer. I'll send the list of "contributors" as the guest list. If there is any technical problem, do let me know because I want you there! <3

With Love,

K


P.S. Thank you House of Noir. xxx
